text: There does not appear to be any information on the noticeboard.
Kyrie forgot her backpack, which is filled with traveling supplies. Perhaps she hoped to join Avalanche after all.

Though Costa del Sol is now a renowned beach resort, it was once home to a string of humble fishing villages. However, when relations between Shinra and the Republic of Junon began to deteriorate, Shinra annexed this portion of the coast. After the war, the company designated the area for redevelopment, transforming it into the must-visit location for avid sunseekers that it is today.

Costa del Sol offers vacation packages to suit any budget, allowing travelers from every corner of the globe to savor the idyllic beaches. Plans that include a trip to the Gold Saucer have proven particularly popular.
Costa del Sol: A Recent History

Coal was in high demand in the days of the republic, and the wealth of Mt. Corel drew miners from far and wide. Though the work was hard and dangerous, the laborers banded together to overcome their difficulties, forming a close-knit community in the process.

Alas, the advent of mako saw the price of coal plummet, spelling disaster for the people of Corel. As they struggled to find a way forward, Shinra proposed the construction of a mako reactor, and after much debate, the villagers accepted the offer.

The reactor was constructed with astonishing haste, but just prior to being brought online, it was torn apart by an immense explosion, and has been left in ruins ever since.

The tale of the Gold Saucer began with a Shinra employee named Dio, who convinced the company to build a museum called the Reliquary. Although it was doomed to failure, Dio was not to be deterred, and he set about founding the world's largest theme park, which he first conceived as a small-scale fairground.

In the wake of the Corel Mako Reactor explosion four years ago, plans were set in motion to revitalize the local economy. Hearing this, Dio decided to relocate his fairground to the region, eventually transforming it into a state-of-the-art entertainment complex.

Now known as the Gold Saucer, it is powered by several modular reactors, which are responsible for the surrounding area's accelerated desertification. In light of this, the reactors are now run at minimum output, in an attempt to mitigate further damage to the environment.
The Rise of the Gold Saucer

Cosmo Canyon is located in the south of the western continent, where countless valleys and caverns have formed in the red clay. In ages past, seismic activity forced this soil to the surface, where it was later eroded by the surging lifestream below, giving the region its unique appearance.

Throughout the year, the canyon sees very little rainfall, and the temperature variation between the plateaus and gorges is considerable. As such, it is extremely difficult to grow crops, and the mere act of survival is a daily struggle. Nevertheless, the canyon is a prime destination for students of planetology. In addition to scholars and devotees, many tourists can also be found here, seeking to take in the "mystical" air. In more practical terms, the arid conditions and lack of cloud cover facilitate the observation of celestial bodies, making the canyon popular among astronomers.

The founders of the canyon's eponymous village made use of the naturally formed caves, and following the emergence of planetology, more and more people found themselves drawn to the place. The makeshift walkways and tent-like domiciles have only increased in number as the settlement continues to expand to this day.

Rather than rely on mako, the villagers built an array of windmills, and each home is equipped to store the generated electricity. A leading planetologist, Bugenhagen, introduced this form of wind power to Cosmo Canyon, and it is said his technical marvel was inspired by the ways of the Cetra.

When it comes to nutrition, the villagers' diet consists mainly of grain and legumes grown around the village, supplemented by game meat obtained with traditional hunting methods.

In the distant past, the Cetra made contact with the Gi, entities who could not return to the lifestream. Pitying their plight, the Cetra built altars to commune with and calm these tormented souls in the hope of finding a means to coexist peaceably.

Over time, the Cetra grew increasingly aware of the dire fate that would befall the planet, and resolved to entrust their knowledge to the people of Cosmo Canyon. These teachings would become the foundation of planetology, which continues to be refined through research and discourse even as it is spread throughout the world.

When the Cetra finally departed Cosmo Canyon, none remained to provide solace to the Gi, who in their festering anguish and rage were driven to turn on the villagers. Many brave warriors gave their lives to beat back these vengeful spirits, entombing them in their prison once more.

In ancient times, Gongaga was settled by descendants of the Cetra, who lived in quiet seclusion. The region was largely ignored by later kingdoms and empires, until the Republic of Junon thought to expand its influence westward. They soon discovered, though, that the expense of establishing trade routes through such dense jungle far outweighed the benefits of reaching the small communities there, and elected to instead construct an airstrip and little else.

When war erupted between the republic and Shinra, people the world over were impacted to varying degrees. Those in Gongaga were the rare exception, as being so far removed from the theater of war meant that they were not subject to forced conscription, nor were their villages ever host to the bloodshed.

The village of Gongaga lies at the heart of the humid jungle, where many species of moss, fern, and mushroom thrive. Its people have a long tradition of self-sustenance, growing only enough produce and raising only enough livestock to support their collective. Though the village is by no means commercially enterprising, the Gongaga mushroom endemic to the region is renowned for its rich aroma, and commands a high price.

Gongaga's fortunes took a turn for the worse following an explosion at the nearby mako reactor. Though much of the jungle was temporarily declared a disaster area, due to its elevated position, the village itself escaped the worst of the fallout─a small mercy considering the devastation wrought below.

First generation mako reactors based on the one built in Nibel are prone to malfunction due to flaws in the pressurization system's design. This, however, did not deter Shinra from installing them at various locations throughout the world, including Gongaga.

The company's failure to follow their own inspection and maintenance procedures led to a disastrous explosion which claimed the lives of many villagers. Acknowledging its part in the incident, Shinra dedicated a monument to the victims.

This accident was not an isolated occurrence, though, as at least one other reactor is known to have exploded in a similar fashion. Stranger yet, Shinra has been investigating alleged sightings of gigantic life-forms known as "Weapons" near the remains of these destroyed mako reactors.

This humble town serves as a transport hub for the grasslands, hence the distinctive bailey built for the monitoring of commercial and private traffic. During the war with the Republic of Junon, Shinra saw fit to occupy Kalm, due to its stout fortifications and strategic value, and it has remained under company control ever since.

As it lacks a reactor of its own, Kalm is reliant on Midgar and its pipelines for a steady supply of mako, which is stored in a large tank for regulated use. This arrangement allows the residents to enjoy both modern conveniences and a healthy environment─a combination that has attracted many new residents of late.

Ten years ago, a significant portion of the town was "damaged," though Shinra quickly intervened and carried out a comprehensive reconstruction effort. Details regarding the incident and the extent of the destruction are sparse.

In stark contrast to the barren, mako-ravaged outskirts of Midgar, the ecosystem of the grasslands remains relatively unscathed. Streams flowing from the central mountain range nourish the lush meadows below, which sustain a diverse range of species. Ranchers and farmers also benefit greatly from this bountiful environment.

Vast wetlands make up much of the southern region. In days past, boats and chocobo carriages were a common sight, but as most goods are now transported by sea or air, traffic through the wetlands has steadily decreased. Moreover, as an immense, man-eating serpent dubbed Midgardsormr has been sighted in this area of late, few dare to brave the old trails. Even those capable of evading the gargantuan snake may yet fall victim to one of the many inescapable quagmires.
Flora and Fauna of the Grasslands

A natural passage through the mountains between Junon and the grasslands, this mine has long served as a rich source of mythril. The mineral boasts an exquisite shimmer and remarkable strength, and was historically used to fashion the very finest weapons and armor, but it fell out of favor after Shinra developed superior synthetic materials.

After the mine was closed, the Republic of Junon converted it into a tunnel for the general public, allowing travel to and from the grasslands. The glistening mythril deposits drew regular sightseers as well. Following Shinra's triumph over the republic, however, the tunnel has been effectively abandoned. Various sections have fallen into disrepair, and the depths are host to untold dangers.
The Mythril Mine: Changing with the Times

The people of Junon were once largely seafarers, who only returned to the shore to peddle the bounty of the ocean. Unlike other communities that settled in a single location and gradually expanded their territory, these sailors preferred the freedom of the open sea, and over time banded together with like-minded souls to form a unique society.

As a republic, they repurposed a flotilla of large vessels to construct a floating city that would serve as the center of their trade network. Having forged a robust infrastructure, they then set their sights on uniting the disparate peoples of the world.

Though Junon ushered in an era of economic and cultural prosperity, it was not to last. Shinra's revolutionary mako technology put paid to their ambitions, and their once proud city now slumbers beneath the waves.
The Rise and Fall of the Republic of Junon

Having conquered the Republic of Junon, Shinra constructed a nigh-impregnable fortress on the coast in the heart of their enemy's former territory. Powered by the world's only underwater mako reactor and equipped with a colossal cannon capable of firing as far as Wutai, the stronghold resembles a vast battleship, risen from the deep to defend the eastern continent.

Junon is a city composed of multiple levels, each of which is lined with uniform buildings that were originally designed to serve the needs of military personnel. After the war with Wutai, some were converted into hotels and retail outlets, and the harbor and airport now see a constant stream of civilian visitors.

Military exercises are still conducted frequently, however, and should the need arise, defense countermeasures can be deployed at a moment's notice, transforming the city into a fortress, ready to repel would-be invaders.

It is said that beyond the desolate, jagged crags of Mt. Nibel lies the land of the dead, and few dare to approach its slopes. Indeed, even plant life struggles to find a foothold here, and with tumbling boulders and rockslides a constant threat, the locals see little reason to make such a perilous journey.

Many of the mountain's caves are filled with mako vapor, and the inner reaches contain mako springs and naturally formed materia. Shinra's search for a new energy source led them to Mt. Nibel, and its abundant supply of mako made it the ideal site for the world's first reactor.

Although it played an instrumental role in the proliferation of mako energy, the Nibel reactor's time in the spotlight was brief, and it now operates at greatly reduced capacity.
Mt. Nibel and the Birth of Mako Energy

In the shadow of the jagged formations at the foot of Mt. Nibel, the village of Nibelheim had little to offer the outside world. However, their quiet existence would change dramatically with Shinra's discovery of vast reserves of mako within the mountain.

The company's efforts began with the construction of Shinra Manor on a plot of leased land. It was there that the head of Research and Development, Professor Gast, and his assistant, Professor Hojo, pioneered studies on mako and Jenova.

Shinra's financial investment delivered the people of Nibelheim from poverty. Their newfound happiness and prosperity would be short-lived, though, as the entire village was burned to the ground and countless innocents slaughtered by Sephiroth.

A perfect reconstruction of Nibelheim was later erected on the site in secret, and now serves as a treatment center for victims of mako poisoning.

After careful consideration, I have devised a new name for this type of research.
I hope you'll assist me in gathering relevant data by completing various tasks on your travels.
In return, I will use the information you provide to develop new materia─quid pro quo.
To summarize, I want us to become research partners!

But before that, is there anything
you would like to ask?
What would you like to ask about?
These communications towers were built by the Republic of Junon─in order to further their understanding of the planet.
They scan for all manner of signals...
which, in turn, reveal myriad locations of interest...

such as long-forgotten ruins
and rare natural phenomena.

Should you happen to stumble across
a tower, please activate it.

I must urge you to proceed with caution though.
Feral beasts often claim these installations as their territory.
With a special pair of goggles, you can do battle in a virtual arena, regardless of your real-world location.
Or my combat simulator, as Shinra developed the stationary models first.
And fret not─it will never be obsolete.

I'll keep it up-to-date with intel
from unique enemy encounters.
I will also endeavor to implement all of the summons─once I finish analyzing the myths and legends surrounding them, of course.
In fact, after poring over stories from the grasslands...

I have finished implementing a new one:
the towering colossus known as "Titan."
With a special pair of goggles, you can do battle in a virtual arena, regardless of your real-world location.
It can simulate battles with summons...
and any unique fiends you've terminated─provided I've applied the latest update.
With each piece of world intel you collect, you will also provide me with the data I need to develop new materia.

What I ultimately produce, however,
is for you to decide.

I look forward to finding out
what we can create together!
In that case, I see no reason not to begin at once.
With your activation of this tower, my analysis of the grasslands has already yielded some data.

Though hardly substantial, it is
enough for me to create materia.
Which of these would you like?

I wish you all the best in the long journey
that lies ahead of you.

And remember: you're not in this alone.
Should you require assistance, just ask!

Do you happen to have any questions
about world intel and the like?
Which particular task would you like to learn about?
And which particular task would you like to learn about?
Which particular task would you like to learn about?
While it is normal for creatures to adapt to their environment, sometimes these adaptations make them a threat.
I would like you to track down and eliminate these creatures─and amass data on them in the process.
In certain remote areas, fragments of planetary wisdom have coalesced into crystalline forms.

Though the knowledge contained
within them is vast and varied...

one subject is of particular interest to me:
that of summons.
If you would analyze the crystals in my stead─thus extracting said knowledge from them...
I can use it to enhance our materia.
Ah, yes! I was hoping you would ask!
I detected some strange energy signals earlier.
My current theory is that they emanate from the remnants of ancient artifacts...
But until we investigate, there's simply no telling what the sources might be!
And since we have yet to identify them, I have taken the liberty of naming these objects "protorelics."
A rather endearing name, if I may say so.
At any rate, I would be grateful if you could investigate said curiosities, and ultimately recover them for study.
This task requires you to search for objects which I believe to be the remnants of ancient artifacts.
Though what they truly are is anyone's guess! Ah, the suspense is killing me!
While I do not want to rush you, I would like you to please keep them in mind during your journey.
Simply put, "lifesprings" are formed when the lifestream breaches the planet's surface.
To Shinra, the volume of mako that can be extracted from these springs is insignificant─certainly not worth the expense.
But to us, they are a veritable font of knowledge.
In order to tap these precious reserves, however, you will first need to find them!
If you still have questions about world intel, please─ask away.

No storm clouds, swells, or crosswinds. Not a thing!

some of the world's very best have recently met with unnaturally violent deaths.

Cloud. Fancy seeing you again.

Come. Let me tell you a story.

Once, there lived a queen of
peerless beauty and compassion.
She loved her people, and they in turn loved her.

But one day, a change came over the queen.
In the blink of an eye, her love turned to hate─her compassion to cruelty.

Fair and beauteous though she remained,
her heart became black as pitch.
Conquest was now her cause, her subjects mere fodder to feed her boundless ambition.
And so her kingdom grew as her people perished.

Until, that is, a ray of hope appeared─
a sorceress who would be their salvation.
The Emerald Witch they called her. And with her arcane powers, she led the people in rebellion, captured the queen, and put her to death.
Yet from the tyrant's body spilled blood as dark as shadow. And from this wicked ichor, the myriad fiends of the world were born.
And that...is the story of the Shadowblood Queen.

Some call it a parable. A myth. A fairy tale.
And I wish it were!
But she is as real as you and I!
And she is coming. Her resurrection is nigh.
You know what must be done.

She cannot be allowed to return.
She must not reclaim her throne!
I pray you will succeed...where I so miserably failed.
I await you at the Haunted Hotel. You must hurry.

At this rate, it's gonna take me the whole day just to assemble my deck! But hey, time flies when you're having fun, I guess.
I can't wait to show off all my precious babies. Only problem is, I'll need someone to play against first.

Oh man, you've got perfect timing.
Wanna go a round against my little angels here?
Name's Dokaccha. I believe in my cards and they believe in me! We're like a big, happy family.
You wanna know how I got them to love me?
With praise! "You're so cute," "You're so cool!" You gotta show 'em every day how much you care!
But I also wanna tell 'em how strong and hardworking they are too, y'know? Which is why I've been looking high and low for someone I can play against.
Oh yeah, I completely understand not wanting to see your babies get hurt. I struggle with that all the time. No worries!
Okay little ones, shall we show him how brave you are?

See? He'd be happy to play with you all.
Isn't he so nice?
...As much as I hate to admit it, it seems you have a much stronger bond with your cards than I do.
Just what do you say to them to get them to love you so much?
Huh. So you let your actions speak louder than your words? I see...
By the way, on a completely different subject, have you ever heard of the card: the Shadowblood Queen? Apparently there's only one.
I tell you, if that's true, I hope I get the chance to see it in person someday.
I bet it's the most beautiful card anyone's ever laid eyes on.

So what did you think of my little angels?
They put in work every turn, don't they?
How did you like my prized collection? Aren't my babies just the cutest, strongest cards you've ever met?
I guess that proves all cards are made equal.
Your cards are positively beaming! Don't forget to shower them with love for that victory.
It's clear your cards have the utmost trust in you. I'm so jealous!
Is there anyone out there who can rekindle my fighting spirit?
I'm sick of running on the beach all day, every day! Ugh, I need to go a round if I ever want to get out of this funk.
I just wish I had a chance to go all out in a hardcore game of Queen's Blood.
What're you looking at? You want a piece of me or something?
Easy now. I didn't mean it like that. No need to be so on edge.
Name's Maahir─though some call me the "Child of the Sun." I'm training to be a boxer.
I've not been feeling it lately, so I'm trying other ways to motivate myself.
Like Queen's Blood. I don't suppose you're up for a game?
No problem. But if you're ever in the mood, come see me.
Oh hey! Are you here for a blazing hot showdown?
I expect a match as fiery as the sand on this beach!
Ouch...! What a knockout. You got me.
Not only was your defense on point, but your offense was swift and brutal. I've never played such an intense game.
It was hotter than the sun─enough to light a fire in my soul, even! I think I'm finally out of my funk!
And now I can get back to boxing. Thank you.
And here I thought you'd burn so much brighter than that. Well, it is what it is.
Man, it feels like I've been hit with a bucket of ice water.
We managed a few embers, but I wanna burn...
You don't disappoint! That fight was hot!
Thanks for sharing your burning passion with me. I needed it.
What's wrong? Why're you barking so much?
Is it because you smell a Queen's Blood player?

Oh, don't mind Rolf here.
He's just a bit worked up is all.
Wait... Do you play Queen's Blood?

Rolf gets really excited whenever
he senses a skilled player nearby.

You may find this hard to believe,
but he's the world's only canine competitor─and he's pretty good too!
Heh, he's saying he wants to go a round with you. Well, you game?
Aw, bummer. Well, come back if you ever wanna play!
Rolf says that he'd love to play with you!
Looks like he's really happy to have met you.
But you gotta admit─he's pretty good, right? Amazing even.
Rolf is actually scheduled to make his television debut! They're doing a special on animals who can play Queen's Blood.
And, once we get famous, we can finally kiss this town goodbye!
Betcha underestimated him 'cause he's a dog, huh?
Joke's on you. Rolf's so good he could win tournaments! Could make good money that way too, I bet...
Rolf says you're not half bad for a human. He'd love to play another round if you're game!
...Guess Rolf and I have some work to do before that big TV appearance.
You must be really talented to beat him like that. I couldn't win against him no matter how hard I tried!
Watch out, shitheads! A new bandit's in town, and he ain't messin' around!
I play for keeps─you'll see! And when we're through, I'll be keepin' all your gil!
Hehehehe! Look at these chickens. That's right, you better run!
What're you lookin' at? If you got somethin' to say, then spit it out!
Just know that I'm such a badass that even Beck and his Bitches couldn't handle me! Kicked me out of their stupid little gang!
That's right! You're standing face-to-face with the legendary Biff!
You shakin' in your boots yet?
But it seems to me like we got no choice but to settle this with a game of Queen's Blood!
And if I whoop your ass, you gotta give me three─No! Seven whole gil!
Yeah, you ain't so tough after all!
Huh? Hold up. You tellin' me you ain't got seven gil?
Hey! We gonna go a round or what? And don't forget: you gotta pony up seven gil when you lose!
So, you got the balls to take on the legend himself? Remember: lose and ya owe me seven gil!
Wanna know a secret? Truth is, I bailed from the bandit life 'cause I just couldn't hack it.
So I...I figured I'd turn over a new leaf and become a Queen's Blood player instead, but turns out I'm no good at that neither.

You gotta tell me. What's the trick, man?
How do I get your kinda skills?
What, don't like handin' out free advice or somethin'? Only a real cheapskate would charge for that shit, asshole.
Well, better hang on to that gil of yours, 'cause next time we meet, I'mma take seven off you for sure!
Hahahaha... That's what you get for messin' with the legend.
Hahaha... I'm gonna be drinkin' good tonight!
Maybe I'd be better off givin' up on Queen's Blood too.
Come one and all to see the living statue who plays Queen's Blood. It's a sight to behold.
Feel free to look as looong as you want. And if you like what you see, consider leaving a tip.
Amazing, isn't it? I don't move a single muscle.

Huh? May I help you?
I'm in the middle of a performance.
Are you...here to play Queen's Blood?
That's going to be tricky. I'm a living statue, you see. I'm not supposed to move under any circumstances.
...Well, I guess I could move my arms at least.
You're going to regret making me come to life.
Oh! Do you want to play?
Is it time for me to move my arms again?

You completely demolished me.
Well played, good sir.

But my performance wasn't half bad,
wouldn't you agree?
Someday, I hope to join the Gold Saucer's grand stable of performers.
That's why I'm trying to hone my skills by purposely putting myself in the harshest of environments.
But my winning streak was starting to draw negative attention, so maybe losing was for the best.
I'll be here for a while yet. If you would like to play another game, just let me know.
No one stands a chance of beating me once I come to life.
Hehe... Bet you didn't see that coming.

I'm a living statue.
Even if I lose, I'll show no distress.

Not many can defeat me once I come to life.
Well done.
Hey, come on... Anyone up for a few rounds of Queen's Blood between drinks? It'll be fun!
Wanna know my secret to victory? It sounds like "Glug, glug, glug!"
Ugh... What, no takers? Boo. You guys are no fun at all.

I take it you're here to join me for a drink?
Well, aren't you the sweetest little thing!

Ugh... You big party pooper. Fine, be that way.
Guess we'll play Queen's Blood instead!
Oh, no. Don't even try to wiggle out of it.
Because I'm Mary, darling dear. And when I've knocked a few back, nobody slips through my fingers.

So...either ya take a drink, or we play a game.
Your choice.
Oho, someone knows how to have a good time!

That won't getcha drunk, though.
It was just a vegetable smoothie.
But deal's a deal. I release you!
You party animal. Off ya trot.

So, what'll it be? A drink?
Or a game of Queen's Blood?

Oh, didn't think I'd see you again.
You here for a drink, or a round of QB?

Well, shit! You got me good, hot stuff!
Shoulda had more to drink!
I have a confession to make...
You see, my dear, even though it's my surefire ticket to victory, I've kinda been cutting back on the booze. Do you wanna know why?
A while back, I drank way too much. Blacked out in the middle of a match and had an awful nightmare!

I dreamed this creepy stranger
was trying to chat me up.

Which is why...this match totally doesn't count!
I am still off my game.
Next time, you better bet I'm gonna be sauced to the max. So watch out, boyo!
I'll raise a glass to that!
See? Drinking really gets those gears in your head turning faster! Try it for yourself. It's a winning strategy.
Ugh. You... One more! Just one more round!
Seeing as you won...you're gonna help me drink the blues away!
Why's everyone avoiding me like the plague!? I just wanna play Queen's Blood! I'm not out to rough 'em up or anything.
Wait... Do they hate me? What did I ever do to them!?
I mean, I don't hang out with the nicest folks, but...throw me a bone here!
I worked so hard to put this deck together! And now no one's gonna let me test it out!?

Gah, shit! I did it again. Sorry, old habits.
No harm meant!
Please don't go! I'm beggin' you! I only wanna play a game of Queen's Blood, I promise! That's all!
I have a hard time talking to people and, well, I know I'm not the friendliest-looking guy, so...
I can't convince anyone to go a round.

Anyway, uh, the name's Dax. You, uh,
want to play with me? Pretty please?
I get it. You're tryin' to avoid me too.
Looking forward to playing again sometime!

If you're not here to play a game,
then get lost, loser!
Hey buddy, how you been? You got time to go a round? S'all good if you don't.

That was even more fun than I'd imagined.
I've been missin' out.

Prison ain't a great place
to let your guard down, y'know?

So I got into the habit of actin' tough and yellin'
at anyone who looked at me funny. It kept me safe, but...

it also made good, decent people
like you avoid me altogether.
Even though I just wanted to play cards.
I got so frustrated that no one would give me the time of day that I started to resent the judgy bastards.
But I've got to change myself first if I want people to talk to me.
Because you had the courage to approach me when no one else did, I know that now.
So I'm gonna do it like you and ask people to play, instead of waitin' for 'em to come to me.
Haha! Woo! I won! I won!
So this is what victory tastes like! Su-weet!
Guess what? I've gotten more people to play with me! I couldn't've done it without you, man! You rock!
What d'you think? Am I kinda sorta respectable, or not quite yet?
My achin' back... Look at you all go. I wish I had your energy.
I suppose I'll sit here for a spell, and hope someone comes along and offers to play cards. That would be nice.

Come now, that's enough.
Can't you see you're scaring the poor man?
Sorry for all that. It doesn't take much for them to get worked up.

I'm Zhijun─a farmer. I should be hard at work,
but my back's forcing me to take a break for a short while.

Oh, do you play Queen's Blood, by chance?
A game would help to pass the time.
Sitting around soaking up the sun is all well and good, but at this rate it's liable to put me to sleep.
Well, you know right where to find me.
Ahaha... Once again, sorry about the racket.

What do you say to a nice,
relaxing match while you're here?
Well, I'll be. Aren't you something? Why, you were running circles around me─like one of those professional racing chocobos!
So is that how all you young folk play these days? Huh, Queen's Blood sure has changed. Us old-timers can't keep up anymore.
Hm, but you know, that's exactly the way it should be. You're better off harnessing that energy while you've still got enough to live life to the fullest.
You can sit and relax to your heart's content when you get older and your back starts giving you no say in the matter.
That's why you should spend your youth getting up to all kinds of mischief.
If you ever tire yourself out, though, I'll be here with my cards. A little downtime can do a body good.
Well now, this is an unexpected turn of events. If my luck stays this good, maybe those knots in my back'll work 'emselves out too!
Don't rush it. Try taking time to think about your next move.
How about that. Feeling a little more relaxed now?
Thanks for playing with me. I had a blast.
You're really going places. That's great.
What's the matter, Oscar? Do you wanna play a game?
Okay, okay, I'll see if I can find you a Queen's Blood player. But after that you've got to get to work.
Don't ask how I can tell, but you're into Queen's Blood, aren't you?

Isn't that great, Oscar?
I've found someone you can play against.

Let me introduce you: this is Oscar the Swift.
He's a watch chocobo.
A huge Queen's Blood fan too. He gets cranky if he can't play at least one game a day.

So, how about it?
Mind going a round with him?
Can you play with Oscar? Please?
Oh hey! Would you be up for a round?
Whoa! This is the first time I've ever seen Oscar lose. Didn't expect that.

Hehehe, seems like he's a little bitter.
Anyway, thanks so much for indulging him.
He can make it a lot harder for us to do our jobs when he's in a mood. Really.
Believe it or not, he's gonna make his television debut soon.
He'll be up against a dog that plays Queen's Blood.
And we have to make sure he wins, to help drive up tourism here.
Our Oscar's pretty smart, isn't he?
He's so swift, that he can finish a match in the blink of an eye.
I swear, you nearly had me squawking with excitement! That was intense!
Looks like Oscar had a great time playing with you.
Win or lose, he's never in a better mood than after he's played a game.
Lotsa hand signals. That's how Shinra Sign Language came to be a thing.
Put up a good fight, though.
Hang on. Are you ex-military too?
Yes. Lost my voice in the war.
But you don't need one to duel─not when you've got SSL.
That's why I'm trying to introduce it to people.
Solid idea. Good luck with that.
Good game! That was a close one.
Thought I could pull it off, but you're just too good.
Good day, ladies and gentlemen! Who's ready for some Queen's Blood carnage!?
We're comin' to you live from Cosmo Canyon for a special episode of Card Sharks!
Join me as we search for this region's greatest players!
What QB sharks are swimming in these waters?
Don't be shy! Step right up, all you aficionados, and show us your bite!

Oho! It's our very first catch of the day, folks!
We have ourselves a challenger!
Hello, sir! Care to tell the folks at home who you are?
Haha! Could this shark be more of a guppy?
Well, I spy a row of razor-sharp teeth in this little fishie's maw!
You might be the QB killer we've been waiting for!
But there's only one way to find out!
That's right─our audience doesn't wanna hear commentary. They wanna see blood!
To up the ante, our challenger's opponent will be none other than your host with the most─me! Bernard!
Feeling camera shy already? Well, don't you worry. We'll be here when you've found your courage!
Our challenger has returned and he looks like he's got something to prove! Hope you're ready, folks!
Look who it is, folks! Our favorite card shark is back! Is this apex predator still feeling a mite peckish!?
Talk about carnage, am I right!?
I'm lucky I got outta that match with my limbs intact! Today's shark is a ferocious man-eating menace!
He made a serious splash with some ruthless moves. Players the world over have got to be shakin' in their boots!
Something tells me this beast is about to upset the QB food chain!
Congratulations to you, sir, for an incredible match!
Though we found the canyon's resident shark, the fun never ends on this show!
Stay tuned, because we've got more coming your way!
Ooh, too bad! Maybe our friend here is a guppy after all!
A solid match, but one that was more in my favor than his!
Well, he's certainly one to keep an eye out for!
You are much too much, sir! Your star is on the rise, and I don't think it's ever gonna come down!
Warning: these waters are no longer safe now that this shark's swimming in 'em!
The cards may serve as a conduit for the very wisdom of the planet.

Attune yourself to the pulse of your decks.
That is the planet's essence.
Through Queen's Blood, we humans can commune with our great mother.
Traveler. You've more than a passing interest in Queen's Blood─it has bewitched you.
Be at ease. It is only natural to hear its call.
Queen's Blood is of the planet and for the planet. It, like all things, is part of the great cycle that connects us.
Indeed, each and every card holds within it a greater purpose, one that belies their form.
Come. Join me in a match, that you too may glimpse the truth of our great mother.
Do as your heart bids, friend.

You have nothing to fear, traveler.
Let us engage in a friendly match.
Shall we partake of the planet's wisdom through the cards once more?
A turn I did not expect, which confirms my fears:
a strange, wicked pall hangs over the lifestream.
And a similar dark energy has corrupted Queen's Blood.
The game's pleasures belie the thorns beneath, that will bleed you slowly and surely.
Many devotees have succumbed to the darkness of which I spoke. Too many.
Remember: the cards are a link between us and the planet. If you are in trouble, reach out─she shall answer.

O great mother, hear my prayer.
Watch over your son.
There is a flow to Queen's Blood that you mustn't fight. Surrender yourself to it.
Fear clouds your judgment. Perhaps a prayer to the planet can dispel that which haunts you.
The cards have shown us that all are equal in the eyes of our great mother.
This too must be part of our great mother's design.
As lambs heed the shepherd, so too must we follow where the planet seeks to guide us.
No, Dale. Leave the man alone.
I can play Queen's Blood with you, if that's what you want, okay?
This is Dale. He loves playing Queen's Blood more than anything else in the world.
Actually...I don't suppose you would mind playing a match or two with him─just real quick?
I'm not the best player, so I think he's been looking for someone who'll give him more of a challenge.
That's fine. Come back if you ever have a moment though!
Oh wow... I don't think I've ever seen him this happy. It must've been a great match.
That's enough, Dale. He has other things to do, I'm sure.
Thank you so much for taking the time to play with him.
Oh... I hadn't realized Dale was so talented.
Honestly, I bet even I could beat you.
Wow, that went right down to the wire! It had me on the edge of my seat.
I should try to learn a thing or two from you, so I can be a better opponent for Dale.
Dale can't talk, but I know how grateful he is. Thank you.
Okay, the captain's nowhere in sight. Which means I can play Queen's Blood!
I've gotta make the most of my time before roll call starts...
The question is: is there anyone out there who's brave enough to slack off with me?
You don't happen to be a card player, do you!?
You're slacking off because you wanna play Queen's Blood─because you're just like me!
I won't tell if you won't. Comrade.
The name's Turner, the top truant.
I say screw working! I'm all about playin' hooky!
You'd be hard-pressed to find anyone who's better at it than me! I don't give a damn about demotions!
You're not gonna blow off work with me?
Playing while you should be working makes it more fun.
Remember: these companies don't deserve shit. Screw 'em all.
Heard they sent a survey team to check out the reactor. Not that I care.
I didn't think you'd beat me so easily. When I entered contests on the clock, I always won.
Wait... Could you be more of a slacker than me?
But I devote all my time outside of roll calls specifically to playing Queen's Blood!
Oh, I see... You're unemployed. Living the dream!

No, that's none of my business.
You're a bigger fish. That's all.
It was an honor to have played with you. I hope I'll have another chance someday.
You'll never beat me until you become a better slacker.
You need to slack off more.
You really gave me a run for my money.
I need to work harder at slacking off.
You might be even more committed than me to the truant lifestyle.

I have confirmed that you are now in possession of the protorelic.

Should I happen to pick up other protorelic readings, I may request your assistance again.
Oh, there is one more thing I should mention.
Your device detected a small amount of interference.

I was unable to locate you, albeit for only a moment.
If something had happened to you because of me, I...

Rattled ya, huh? Could it be ya got a soft spot for SOLDIER boy here?
Annoyance response triggered. Cause: Barret's mocking tone of voice.

Regardless, I will do what I can to improve security measures.
Incoming transmission from Kid G! One moment.

Sorry for the wait. The next trial is ready and waiting for challengers!
If you're still interested in collecting all those treasure pieces, then head on over to the third reactor!

The end of our quest for the protorelics draws near, but I hope you will continue to assist me in exploring our world!

Wait... So what exactly are the protorelics?
It is of course too early to say anything for certain...
but I suspect they may be some manner of armaments formed from matter not normally present in this dimension.
If we assume the giant was also from another dimension...
then there is a possibility that he was the original owner of the protorelics.
Wait, so...if they are his, does that mean we should give 'em back?
Given the phenomena he has been able to conjure in this dimension without the protorelics on hand...
I shudder to think what havoc he might wreak were his powers fully restored.
It might be prudent for us to gather a bit more information on the protorelics before we decide to return them.
For now, I propose that we retrieve the artifacts and perform a thorough analysis.
Tell me I didn't dream that shit.
Correct. That was no dream, Cloud! You and I were there together.
Wherever "there" was, that is... I presume it was another dimension.
I, however, am emboldened to solve this mystery!
I only hope that you will assist me in my quest for answers!
I have confirmed that you are in possession of a protorelic.
I've already taken the liberty of scanning it and need only analyze the data.
Should I happen to pick up other protorelic readings, I may request your assistance again.
I was unable to locate you, albeit for only a moment.
Right─back to it! We still have protorelics to find.

I, however, am emboldened to solve this mystery!
I only hope that you will assist me in my quest for answers!
Cloud! After analyzing this latest protorelic...
I've determined that they are armaments composed of an altogether alien substance!
Hehe─ Oh! Sharp increase in heart rate detected!
I must learn more about this phenomenon─and I hope I can continue to count on your assistance!
You did it, Cloud! I commend you for collecting that protorelic.
At this rate, the remaining one will be in our possession in no time.
Right... Yeah. We have to find it─and soon.
I see that you were able to obtain the protorelic. Excellent work.
With five on hand, my analysis should proceed smoothly.
Though I have to assume our favorite interloper will make another appearance...
But when he does, we'll be ready!

Feast your eyes and prepare to be
stupefied by my swordsmanship!

of which legend tells─Excalibur!

By this holy blade shall
your lives be...ended!

Oh, how I've longed to wield thee,
my holy blade!

I shall reward your efforts with a
dazzling display. Watch and be amazed!
You must be...shaking in your boots.

None have mastered this
martial art─none but I.

Come─let us shed the
shackles of reality!

I shall guide you unto
the realm of dreams.
Alas, I fear the end draws nigh.

What's amor fun than a game of Queen's Blood? A puzzle!
Your opponent has laid their cards on the table. Place yours in the right spot at the right time to emerge victorious!

Your partner, Regina, has already completed this challenge. If you complete it as well, the two of you will proceed.

In this three-card challenge, your opponent has laid their cards on the table. Place yours in the right spot at the right time to emerge victorious!

Check a placed card's skill by moving your cursor to its position on the board.
Win Round 1 of the Cards del Amor Challenge

What's amor fun than a game of Queen's Blood? A puzzle!
Your opponent has laid their cards on the table. Herd your chocobos into a single lane to boost your score and find the path to victory!

Your partner, Regina, has already completed this challenge. If you complete it as well, the two of you will proceed.
In this three-card challenge, your opponent has laid their cards on the table. Herd your chocobos into a single lane to boost your score and find the path to victory!
Win Round 2 of the Cards del Amor Challenge

What's amor fun than a game of Queen's Blood? A puzzle!
Your opponent has laid their cards on the table. Have the Moogle Trio summon the Mage and Bard to your hand, then use their unique abilities to come out on top!

Your partner, Regina, has already completed this challenge. If you complete it as well, the two of you will proceed.
In this limited-deck challenge, your opponent has laid their cards on the table. Have the Moogle Trio summon the Mage and Bard to your hand, then use their unique abilities to come out on top!
In this four-card challenge, your opponent has laid their cards on the table. Deploy your Spearhawk and Cactuar cards at the right time to take advantage of bonus spaces and claim victory!

In this limited-deck challenge, your opponent has laid their cards on the table. Beware the Mindflayer at the center of the board: it will sap strength from adjacent cards and destroy them. Sacrifice your Mandragoras in order to enable your Sea Devil's skill and emerge victorious!

In this limited-deck challenge, your opponent has laid their cards on the table. Your mission is to make the board into a minefield laden with cards that self-destruct. Use Dyne to detonate these traps and blow the competition to smithereens─just don't let Phoenix stand in your way!

In this limited-deck challenge, your opponent has laid their cards on the table. Enhance the Jabberwock positioned on the board using cards from your hand, then replace it with Gi Nattak to activate its skill and power your way to victory!

In this limited-deck challenge, your opponent has laid their cards on the table. As your own forces wane, the Tonberry King's power grows. Use this skill to your advantage by destroying your cards with Deathwheel and Mindflayer, then unleashing the king's Karma!

In this limited-deck challenge, your opponent has laid their cards on the table. Once Cloud's power reaches 7, he enhances the cards around him. Use this limit-breaking skill to your advantage and claim victory!
In this limited-deck challenge, your opponent has laid their cards on the table. Barret can drastically enfeeble a card across the board. Use this long-ranged skill to snipe your opponent and win!

In this limited-deck challenge, your opponent has laid their cards on the table. When Tifa wins a duel in a lane, she accrues a large number of bonus points. Use this skill to your advantage and outscore the competition!

In this limited-deck challenge, your opponent has laid their cards on the table. When Aerith is placed in a given lane, she enhances the cards on either side of her. Use this boon to bolster your forces and turn the tide of battle in your favor!
Deepen your relationship with Red XIII

In this limited-deck challenge, your opponent has laid their cards on the table. When Red XIII is enfeebled, he retaliates by enfeebling an opposing card across the board. Unleash vengeance on your foe and emerge victorious!

In this limited-deck challenge, your opponent has laid their cards on the table. Replace one of your cards with Yuffie to destroy it, enfeebling others around it─friend and foe alike. Choose your position wisely and ninja your way to victory!

In this limited-deck challenge, your opponent has laid their cards on the table. Cait Sith can summon his Moogle pal to your hand when played. Put this paw-erful combination to work and prove you're the cat's meow!

In this limited-deck challenge, your opponent has laid their cards on the table. Cid can summon his Tiny Bronco to your hand when played. Soar into battle with this dynamic duo, and watch the competition crash and burn!

In this limited-deck challenge, your opponent has laid their cards on the table. When Vincent is destroyed, he summons the Galian Beast card to your hand. With this monster on your side, it won't be long before the competition joins the marksman in deep, deep slumber!

Practice using the Archdragon's skill to enfeeble your opponent's cards.

・When a card's power reaches 0, it is destroyed.
・Upon destruction, a card's skill is automatically deactivated.
・When a skill-affected space overlaps with an expansion space, you can claim the newly opened space as your own.

Check a placed card's skill by moving your cursor to its position on the board.

Practice activating the Amphidex and Gagighandi's skills to boost the power of your cards while reducing the power of your opponent's.

・Try positioning cards with skills that activate once enhanced to create a chain reaction.
・Remember that some cards' power changes depending on the state of adjacent cards.

Practice using the Desert Sahagin and Reapertail to enhance your other cards when they are enfeebled, then activate the Jabberwock's skill to enfeeble your opponent's cards in turn.

・Try positioning cards with skills that activate once enfeebled to create a chain reaction.
・Remember that some cards' power changes depending on the state of adjacent cards.

Practice replacing other cards with the Grandhorn and Gigantoad to activate their skills upon destruction.

・Replaceable cards can only be placed on top of cards already in play.
・Replacing destroys the card below, activating its skill if applicable.

Some replaceable cards have the ability to transfer the power of a destroyed card to another one still in play. Practice this technique by maxing out your Bloatfloat's power, then replacing it with the Griffon to spread that power around.

Start the match with a Gigantuar, which increases the rank of your positions, in addition to the other cards in your hand.

Revel in the joy of being able to place high-rank cards from the start of battle as you conquer the competition.

Start the match with a Cactrot, which has the ability to enhance allies already in play, as well as the other cards in your hand.

Effectively raise the power of your important cards and victory should be well within your grasp.

You and your opponent's starting positions are swapped.

Your cards with left-facing attacks will finally get a chance to hit the enemy, so savor this turn of events while playing from the perspective of "the big bad."

Start with Chadley, who unleashes a powerful effect when he replaces an ally, in addition to the other cards in your hand.

Channel your inner robotic research assistant by getting the gears in your head turning, expertly analyzing the battlefield, and placing your trump card at exactly the right moment to swing momentum in your favor.

Begin the match with Polygonal Ifrit placed at the center of the battlefield.

This flame-shaping summon puts players through a trial by fire as he enhances any cards─be they allied or enemy─on the affected tiles surrounding him.

Begin the match with high-ranked positions already on the battlefield.

Throw your most powerful troops into the fray right from the start in this overpowered war of attrition.

Start with MAI, who unleashes a powerful effect when she claims an ally, in addition to the other cards in your hand.

Give your enthusiastic AI guide the chance to prove that not only does she not play second fiddle to Chadley, she leads the band.
Support Card: Don't Fear; MAI's Here

Begin the match surrounded by your enemy.

Endure your opponent's relentless onslaught by shoring up your defenses on both sides, thus hopefully buying you enough time to clear a path to victory.

Begin the match with positions on the top and bottom of the battlefield instead of the sides.

Try not to get turned sideways by the change. Instead, make use of the extra space on either side to claim victory. The Alexander placed in each player's territory grows stronger as more of its allied cards are enfeebled; turn this seeming disadvantage into an advantage and overwhelm your opponent.

Begin the match with fewer starting positions than normal.

Keep a cool head in the face of adversity and make for the power-enhancing tiles near the Polygonal Ifrit in the center of the board, and you should still be able to come out on top.
Gimmick Battlefield: Back to the Wall

Compete in a relatively forgiving match spanning three rounds to see how many total points you can accrue. Win and receive a reward based on your point total.

・A support card will be added to your hand at the start of Round 1.
・You will draw five cards at the start of each round.
・You cannot draw cards during the round.

Compete in a tough match spanning three rounds to see how many total points you can accrue. Win and receive a reward based on your point total.

・A support card will be added to your hand at the start of Round 1.
・You will draw five cards at the start of each round.
・You cannot draw cards during the round.

Compete in a grueling match spanning five rounds to see how many total points you can accrue. Win and receive a reward based on your point total.

・You will draw five cards at the start of each round through Round 3.
・You cannot draw cards from Round 4 onward.
・You cannot draw cards during the round.

Deploy robots with elemental affinities to which the enemy is weak, but do not assign them all to the same lane.
Assess any marshmallows that appear so you know how to avoid triggering their powerful attacks.
In order to hit the flying whips, set Gravity Shot or Missile, which will ground them.

Both whips and marshmallows will spawn. Also, the enemy leader can change its elemental affinity, and possesses both enhancing and enfeebling skills. Assess your foes and use their traits against them.
The number of robots you may deploy on this stage is limited, so prioritize more powerful, high-cost actions.
The number of robots you may deploy per type on this stage is limited, so prioritize all-purpose gambits and actions that work for many different situations.

A certain amount of time must pass before you may deploy new robots on this stage. Therefore, try to anticipate when you will need to deploy them, and divvy up roles accordingly to avoid putting too much emphasis on a single robot.
You cannot deploy robots of the same color as the enemy leader, which will change colors when it phase shifts after losing HP. Therefore, controlling the enemy leader's elemental affinity is key.

Grade 0: A cheap bangle made from leather scraps.
Grade I: A thick bangle made with leather from locally hunted game. Available for purchase in the grasslands.
Enhanced Grade I: A souped-up version of the original hunter's bangle.
Grade III: A sturdy bangle made from the armor-like hide of a huge herbivore. Available for purchase in the Junon region.
Enhanced Grade III: A souped-up version of the original elphadunk bangle.
Grade II: An ornate bracer crafted in honor of the hermit philosopher of the forest, Strix.
Grade VI: A finely crafted bracer that evokes the beauty of a bird in flight.
Grade V: A highly sought-after bangle, every piece of the same design was handcrafted by a single goldsmith. Available for purchase in the Corel region.
Enhanced Grade V: A refined variant of the abyssal bangle.
Grade VII: A bangle for rebels and ruffians eager to flaunt their disreputable status. Available for purchase in the Gongaga region.
Enhanced Grade VII: A refined variant of the outlaw bangle.
Grade IX: A stylish silver and leather bangle for bikers born to live free or die. Available for purchase in the Cosmo Canyon region.
Enhanced Grade IX: A revised rendition of the road warrior bangle.
Grade VIII: A leather bracer patterned after one worn by a peerless hunter of beasts.
Enhanced Grade VIII: A revised rendition of the jaeger bracer.
Grade XI: A bangle purportedly made with the pelt of a fearsome fiend who commanded the packs of hell. Available for purchase in the Nibel region.
Enhanced Grade XI: A reimagining of the Garm bangle.
Grade X: A bangle crafted with the hide of a rare fiend and proof of the bearer's prowess.
Enhanced Grade X: A reimagining of the master huntsman's bangle.
Grade XI: A sturdy bangle inspired by a type of ancient armor.
Enhanced Grade XI: An augmented reproduction of the panzer bangle.
Grade XII: An august bangle inspired by the unfathomable rage and destructive power of a dragon.
Enhanced Grade XII: An augmented reproduction of the dragonscale bangle.
Grade XIII: A bracer that embodies the ethos of the Ancients and confers incredible benefits.
Grade 0: A simple bracer wrought from iron in the republic era.
Grade I: A bracer mass-produced during the war.
Enhanced Grade I: A souped-up version of the original copper bracer.
Grade III: A resilient bracer made to withstand life on the high seas.
Enhanced Grade III: A souped-up version of the original sailor's bracer.
Grade III: A simple but functional design favored by republic citizens in the days of the floating city.
Enhanced Grade III: A new and improved version of the steel bangle.
Grade V: A stout standard-issue bracer worn by Shinra riot troopers.
Enhanced Grade V: A new and improved version of the fortress bracer.
Grade IV: A silver bangle once worn by knights sworn to protect their queen regnant.
Grade VII: A reinforced bracer forged with a mixture of metals including iron, copper, and silver.
Enhanced Grade VII: A refined variant of the crucible bracer.
Grade IX: A high-quality bracer customarily worn by Shinra officers.
Enhanced Grade IX: A revised rendition of the commander's bracer.
Grade VIII: A luxurious bangle crafted only with the purest of gold.
Enhanced Grade VIII: A revised rendition of the noble's bangle.
Grade XI: A bracer of such surpassing quality that an appraiser declared it to be beyond compare.
Enhanced Grade XI: A reimagining of the resplendent bracer.
Grade X: A mystical bangle that evokes the boundless majesty and wisdom of the heavens.
Enhanced Grade X: A reimagining of the celestial bangle.
Grade XI: An exquisite bracer formed of snow-white wings that serve as a cradle for the wearer's arm.
Enhanced Grade XI: An augmented reproduction of the angel bracer.
Grade XII: A stunning bangle crafted to capture the glory and divinity of the goddesses drawn to the fires of war.
Enhanced Grade XII: An augmented reproduction of the valkyrian bangle.
Grade XIII: A bangle that embodies the resolute will of the Ancients and confers supreme physical defense.
Grade 0: A crude armband hewn from an old tree of dubious magical power.
Grade II: An avant-garde armband made from the shavings of a beastman's club.
Grade I: An intricately carved armlet blessed by the spirits of the forest.
Enhanced Grade I: A new and improved version of the woodsprite armlet.
Grade VI: A perfectly unassuming armband that proves the wearer has nothing to hide.

Grade IV: The armband of a warrior who swore to overthrow the invaders who conquered his homeland.
Enhanced Grade V: A refined variant of the warmage's armband.
Grade III: An enchanting armlet crafted with rare coral harvested from the depths of the sea.

Grade V: A curious armlet said to have been the treasured keepsake of a fairy-tale witch.
Enhanced Grade V: A revised rendition of the beguiling armlet.
Grade VII: An armlet legend holds was imbued with the witch of the wood's magic.

Enhanced Grade XI: A reimagining of the Star's Repose armband.
Grade X: An armband worn by benevolent souls who labor to grant restless spirits a measure of peace.
Enhanced Grade X: A reimagining of the quietus armband.
Grade IX: An armlet taken from a warrior whose tribe, even in death, cannot escape the fetters which robbed them of their freedom in life.
Enhanced Grade IX: An augmented reproduction of the spiritbound armlet.
Grade XI: A superb armlet said to have been carved from the very wood of the world tree.
Enhanced Grade XI: An augmented reproduction of the Yggdrasill armlet.
Grade XIII: An armband that embodies the vast knowledge of the Ancients and confers supreme magical defense.
Grade I: A smooth bracelet made from sanding down animal remains. Available for purchase in the grasslands.
Enhanced Grade I: A souped-up version of the original bone bracelet.
Grade III: A bracelet designed to ensure its wearer's survival in a dog-eat-dog world. Available for purchase in the Junon region.
Enhanced Grade III: A souped-up version of the original wisefox bracelet.
Grade V: A bracelet made from the fossilized remains of an ancient fiend. Available for purchase in the Corel region.
Enhanced Grade V: A new and improved version of the oldebeast bracelet.
Grade VIII: An imposing bracelet fashioned with a horn taken from a large beast.
Grade VII: A striking bracelet crafted with the claws of a bloodthirsty predator. Available for purchase in the Gongaga region.
Enhanced Grade VII: A new and improved version of the crocodile bracelet.
Grade IX: An unassuming yet beautiful bracelet fashioned from shells unearthed in old ruins. Available for purchase in the Cosmo Canyon region.
Enhanced Grade IX: A refined variant of the snailshell bracelet.
Grade X: A bracelet which incorporates the vertebrae of a fearsome fiend to bolster one's defense.
Enhanced Grade VI: A refined variant of the backbone bracelet.
Grade XI: A stout bracelet that once graced the thewy arm of the Dragon King himself. Available for purchase in the Nibel region.
Enhanced Grade XI: A revised rendition of the Varvados bracelet.
Grade VIII: A disconcerting bracelet from which stone protrusions appear to have grown.
Enhanced Grade VIII: A revised rendition of the stonespike bracelet.
Grade IX: A priceless bracelet found within the ruins of an ancient temple.
Enhanced Grade XI: A reimagining of the temple bracelet.
Grade X: A bracelet fashioned with the pelt, bones, and claws of a mythical fiend that provides protection against the malevolent dead.
Enhanced Grade X: A reimagining of the Managarmr bracelet.
Grade XI: A bracelet made with the bones of a legendary beast of eld that commands a high price.
Enhanced Grade IX: An augmented reproduction of the mythical bracelet.
Grade XII: A terrible armlet created by a conjurer at the behest of a conqueror who sought to triumph over death itself.
Grade XIII: An armlet that embodies the hopes and dreams of the Ancients and unlocks the full potential of materia.
Grade VIII: An armband crafted in the image of the beloved bird whose golden feathers would brighten anyone's day. Triples amount of AP earned for all materia set into this armor.
Grade I: A bangle worn by a wayfarer who left Midgar behind in order to see the wonders of the world.
Grade II: A bracelet crafted with such an inspiring design that anyone who wears it─no matter how timid─gains the courage to explore the world at large.
Grade III: A sophisticated bangle engraved with the Shinra Electric Power Company logo.
Allows you to take items from enemies with Steal.
Allows you to view enemy info with Assess.
Allows you to learn certain enemy techniques and use them as abilities. The Sonic Boom ability can be used by default.

Learning New Abilities
Complete biological intel combat challenges in the simulator to expand your repertoire of abilities.
These abilities can only be used when the enemy skill materia is equipped.
Allows you to restore your own HP and cure Poison with Chakra. The amount restored is relative to damage received─the lower your HP, the more that is restored.
Allows you to restore the party's HP with Pray.
Doubles ATB when activated. Cannot be used continuously. Press <button=ATB-boost> to activate.
Allows you to turn enemies into items with Morph. Enemies whose health has fallen below a certain amount can be defeated in this fashion.
Allows you to consume gil to damage enemies with Spare Change. The more gil you throw, the more damage you will deal to your targets.
Allows you to use items without having to consume ATB after performing a number of actions. This effect will automatically trigger during battle.

Item Economizer Active Notification
When the Item Economizer effect has been triggered and an item can be used without consuming ATB, the Items command will light up.
Allows you to absorb an ally's limit gauge to fill your own with Limit Siphon.
Allows you to leap into the air during battle with Jump. After disappearing into the sky for a time, you will drop down to deal damage.
Allows you to use Darkside. When active, increases the potency of abilities, but causes you to suffer damage when they are used.

The icon will display when Darkside is active. Using Darkside while active will remove the effect.
Magic is unaffected by Darkside.
Allows you to use an ability or spell from the party's equipped materia at random with Gamble. Spells cast with Gamble will consume MP.
Increases your max HP. This bonus cannot exceed +30% when more than one is equipped.
Increases your max MP. This bonus cannot exceed +30% when more than one is equipped.
Increases your magic attack power. This bonus cannot exceed +100% when more than one is equipped.
Increases your luck. This bonus cannot exceed +100% when more than one is equipped.
Increases the amount of gil you earn in battle.
Increases the amount of EXP you earn in battle.
Increases the effectiveness of items used in battle.
Increases ATB when staggering an enemy.
Increases how full the ATB gauge is at the start of battle.
Further decreases enemy damage and fills the ATB gauge faster when guarding.
Slightly fills the ATB gauge when multiple ATB commands are performed.
Slightly fills teammates' ATB gauges when ATB commands are used back-to-back.
Automatically uses Provoke to temporarily draw the enemy's attention when teammates are severely injured. Ineffective against powerful enemies.
Swaps your max HP and MP values.
Swaps your physical attack and magic attack power values.
Swaps your vitality and spirit values.
Transfers any increase in limit gauge to allies. Your own limit gauge will no longer fill.
Increases your speed. This bonus cannot exceed +100% when more than one is equipped.
Increases your strength. This bonus cannot exceed +100% when more than one is equipped.
Increases your spirit. This bonus cannot exceed +100% when more than one is equipped.
Increases your vitality. This bonus cannot exceed +100% when more than one is equipped.

Allows an ally to automatically use unique abilities when not actively controlled during battle.

Tifa will also use Unbridled Strength when not actively controlled if this materia has been equipped.
Allows an ally to automatically use weapon abilities when not actively controlled during battle. Applies to weapon abilities assigned to command shortcuts.
Improves the functionality of blocking with perfect timing.
Slightly increases synergy when other party members use a synergy ability during battle.
Allows you to use healing spells.
Allows you to use curative spells.
Allows you to use revival spells.
Allows you to use fire magic.
Allows you to use ice magic.
Allows you to use lightning magic.
Allows you to use wind magic.
Allows you to use toxin-related spells.
Allows you to use disruptive spells.
Allows you to use time magic.
Allows you to use defensive spells.
Allows you to use subversive spells.
Allows you to use petrification spells.
Allows you to use gravity spells.
Allows you to use celestial spells.
Allows you to use physical and magic attack-strengthening spells. Pairing with warding materia grants resistance to physical and magic attack reduction.
Allows you to use physical and magic defense-strengthening spells. Pairing with warding materia grants resistance to physical and magic defense reduction.
Allows you to use physical and magic attack-reducing spells. Pairing with warding materia grants resistance to physical and magic attack reduction.
Allows you to use physical and magic defense-reducing spells. Pairing with warding materia grants resistance to physical and magic defense reduction.
Allows you to use fire and ice magic.
Allows you to use lightning and wind magic.
Allows you to use toxin-related spells and petrification magic.
Allows you to use magic that can automatically revive allies when they fall in battle.

Allows you to expand the range of spells with the linked materia. To switch back to a single target, press <button=magnify> when selecting a spell.

Adds the element of the linked materia to your equipment, either infusing your attacks with that element or granting resistance to it. When more than one is set, only the materia in the leftmost slot takes effect.

Compatible Materia
Fire / Ice / Lightning / Wind / Fire and Ice / Lightning and Wind
Grants resistance to the linked materia's detrimental status effect.

Compatible Materia
Poison / Binding / Time / Subversion / Petrify / Poison and Petrify / Empowerment / Fortification / Disempowerment / Enervation
Allows you to recover HP when unleashing an attack of the linked materia's type.
Allows you to recover MP when unleashing an attack of the linked materia's type.

Allows an ally to follow the leader's attack command with an attack from linked materia.
(Does not consume ATB charges or MP.)
Increases the amount of AP earned for linked materia.
Increases the potency and duration of spells with the linked materia.
Reduces the MP cost of spells with the linked materia in battle.
Reduces the cast time of spells with the linked materia.
Allows an ally to automatically use spells with the linked materia when not actively controlled during battle.

Increases the level of the linked materia by one.
Has no effect when paired with materia at maximum level.
An identification collar of mythril make. Developed for test subjects in Hojo's research facility.
A collar made during the war as a symbol of revolt.
A collar wrought from a high-quality metal said to ward off magical fiends.
An elegant collar embedded with mystical purple gemstones.
An opulent collar forged from gold found in a forest stream.
A dignified collar once worn by Watchers of the Vale.
An intricate collar crafted using a technology that surpasses modern scientific standards.

Gloves reinforced with metal to pack an extra punch.
Gloves with razor-sharp talons made of magic-infused mythril.
Leather gloves made from the hide of a ferocious beast.
Gloves with a sleek design. Well suited for setting materia.
Gloves that slice through the air to deliver sharp strikes.
Gloves fitted with sharp metal spikes to pack an extra punch.
Gorgeous gloves with a dragonscale design.
Savage gloves inspired by the sharp teeth of a beast of prey.
Gloves studded with gemstones that house magic power.
Gloves embedded with strength-enhancing energy cores.
A custom-order gun commissioned specifically to take down Shinra forces. Barret's longtime right-hand man.
A lethal, sturdy firearm with a large magazine.
A close-combat weapon with steel blades designed to slice enemies to ribbons.
A firearm that boasts unrivaled destructive force. Found on the slums' black market.
A firearm whose accuracy is dependent upon the wielder's emotional state.
A close-combat weapon capable of pulverizing enemies with a sphere of solid steel.
A retro firearm repurposed from a republic-era weapon.
A heavy-artillery firearm equipped with multiple barrels for maximum lethality.
A gunarm that fires faster as its three barrels begin to rotate.
An ostentatious firearm crafted by a reclusive weaponsmith.
A wicked firearm imbued with the rancor of a tribe of fallen warriors.
A destiny-defying firearm imbued with the power of the planet.
A megaphone designed to help a mascot cheer on their comrades.
A sturdy megaphone that provides considerable vocal resonance.
A megaphone that helps its user pour their heart into their cheering.
A megaphone that allows the user's voice to echo out across hill and vale.
A megaphone whose gorgeous gems add a soothing resonance to the user's voice.
A glimmering megaphone used by some to scare off the most ferocious of beasts.
A luxurious megaphone passed down from one Kitty King to the next.
A vintage and well-cared-for staff. Also happens to be eco-friendly.
An elegant staff treated with silver. Perfect for those proficient in magic.
A staff sporting deadly blades on either end. Handle with care.
A rod made of mythril. Said to be a fabled mage's weapon of choice.
A solid and durable staff experimentally produced in Hojo's laboratory.
A staff infused with precious gems the color of twilight. Well suited for materia.
A charming staff carved from a millennia-old tree.
A historied staff once offered as a gift to Her Majesty.
A magical staff once wielded by a formidable spellcaster.
A sacred staff used as part of a ritual prayer to the planet.
A bewitching staff decorated with the feathers of a bird known for its beautiful song.
A superior staff made by the Cetra to help them protect the planet.
An oversized throwing star used by ninjas from Wutai.
A peculiar thrown weapon that was once used to hunt game.
An exceptionally deadly weapon crafted from three scythe blades.
A throwing star modeled after a cactuar.
A sturdy, hardwood throwing weapon boasting a sharp metal blade.
A throwing star that fuses two crescent-shaped sickles into one deadly weapon.
A tricky throwing star wielded by seasoned hunters of the forest.
A bewitching weapon whose blade is studded with smaller daggers.
A throwing star fitted with four sharp, gem-hewn blades.
A legendary throwing star said to soar like the wind, and strike down evil without making a sound.
The legendary blade brandished by a hero across countless battles.
A large broadsword that has inherited the hopes of those who fight.
A greatsword cast from carefully selected iron ore.
A mighty blade able to cleave in one stroke anything foolish enough to stand in the wielder's way.
An immense sword made from magic-infused mythril ore.
A sword forged from two existing blades. Well suited for materia.
A crudely reinforced baseball bat. Designed to beat the living tar out of anything and everything.
A republic-era blade polished into a refined shape and sheen.
A greatsword inscribed with characters from a mystical, ancient script.
A mystifying sword forged from a gem that emits an eerie glow.
A finely honed greatsword hewn from an enormous gemstone.
A curved greatsword forged from hardened volcanic magma.
A greatsword whose power has been greatly enhanced by the mako coursing through its blade.
Deals 500 physical damage to enemies within range.
Though I'm sorry to say we aren't open quite yet, and I'm not even sure when we will be.
Those mooglets are refusing to come back, and we can't do business without them, kupo.
Actually... Maybe you wouldn't mind helping?
The mooglets are having too much fun to come back on their own, so I want you to round them up.
And then we can open up the emporium─and everyone will be happy, kupo!
Fine. I'll see what I can do.
Please bring back all the mooglets for me, kupo!
Would you mind rounding up all the mooglets for me?
The mooglets are all having too much fun playing, and I can't open the shop without them.
I was really hoping to open the emporium.
Those mooglets are such a pawful.
Those mooglets can be a real pain in the pom. Good luck!
I'm counting on you to bring them back, kupo!
Word of warning: they're all huge troublemakers.
Heyyy! Help a moogle out, wouldja!?

Thanks so much, kupo!
Now we can finally open the emporium.
Here you can exchange moogle medals for cool stuff we've found lying around. Everything's great, I promise!
Just so you know, there are six more mogstools out there, kupo.
So be sure to say hi to my friends if you find one.
Also, the more emporiums we open up, the more stuff we'll have for you to buy! That's a win-win situation in my books, kupo!
I really can't thank you enough for bringing all the mooglets back!
It's such a relief the emporium that Mog and Mag built together won't have to close down.
Thanks so much for helping us get this emporium open! You're the best!
Not many people know this, but the emporium's founder Mog had a hard time learning how to fly!
He ate a ton of kupo nuts and practiced every day until his wings finally worked!
It's such an inspiring story, kupo!
You're such a great help, kupo!
As a reward, I'll tell you the story of how Mog and Mag fell in love. It's so romantic!
Even after Mog was fully grown, he still struggled to fly. But he never gave up! He kept on practicing, undeterred.
Eventually, Mag noticed how hard he was working, and decided she would do everything in her power to support him.
As time passed, the two became closer and closer, until one day...
Heh! I'll leave the rest to your imagination!
Thank you so much for gathering all the mooglets, kupo!
After Mog and Mag established the very first moogle emporium way back when, their seven children went on to open up branches all over the world, kupo!
...I wish my mooglets would take a page out of their book.

This emporium is officially open,
and it's all thanks to you!

There's only one more left to go!
We've come so far, kupo.
I hope that you'll see it through!
You're a true hero! Every single emporium is once again open for business, kupo.
It was Mog and Mag's hope that these special shops would bring happiness to folks all throughout the world, kupo.
And that dream lived on─passed down to their children, and their children's children, and so on, for countless generations.

One day, these mooglets will inherit that legacy,
like those before them.
I have a super-duper amazing present for you─to thank you for all your help! You're gonna love it!

Go on now!
Be good hosts and show our guest how it's done!
Now that we've been reunited, the mooglets and I will continue our efforts to spread joy all over the world.
Also, we've found a bunch of rare and exotic items you won't want to miss out on!
Thanks for coming to our moogle emporium.
Anything interesting catch your eye, kupo?
Please shop to your heart's content, kupo!
Feel free to drop by any time!
Did you find anything you like, kupo?
Attempt to take an item while attacking an enemy. Fills the ATB gauge when attack connects. Can use while airborne.
Unleash a wind magic attack. Grants Bravery and Faith. Can use while airborne.
Temporarily imbue attacks with lightning. Deals damage in the surrounding area each time an ATB charge fills.
Temporarily stop moving and gradually restore HP to allies in the surrounding area.
Deal a large amount of damage to enemies in the surrounding area while incapacitating self. Costs 2 ATB.
Unleash a magic attack over a wide area. Significantly increases stagger. Can only be used once per battle. Costs 2 ATB.
Randomly inflicts Silence, Poison, Sleep, Stop, or Petrification over a wide area. Costs 2 ATB.
Conjure a magic shield that fires petrifying shots when struck by an enemy attack. Can use while airborne.
Restore your own HP relative to damage taken. More effective when HP is low. Also removes the Poison status effect.
Restore a small amount of HP to allies. Costs 2 ATB.
Transform a heavily injured foe into an item.
Deal damage based on the amount of gil thrown.
Select the amount of gil to throw. Inventory: <count=0> gil.
Absorb an ally's limit gauge to fill your own.
Leap skyward like a dragoon, then drop down to deal damage after a certain amount of time. Costs 2 ATB.
Applies <button=ankoku>. Increase damage dealt by abilities at the expense of your own HP. Use again to remove status.
Randomly activate an ability or spell from an ally's equipped materia.
Restore a small amount of HP.
Restore a moderate amount of HP.
Restore a large amount of HP.
Revive ally and restore a moderate amount of HP.
Revive ally and restore all HP.
Deal a small amount of fire damage and temporarily imbue attacks with fire.
Deal a small amount of fire damage.
Deal a moderate amount of fire damage and temporarily imbue attacks with fire.
Deal a moderate amount of fire damage.
Deal a large amount of fire damage and temporarily imbue attacks with fire. Costs 2 ATB.
Deal a large amount of fire damage. Costs 2 ATB.
Deal a small amount of ice damage and temporarily imbue attacks with ice.
Deal a small amount of ice damage.
