Shutterbug and card-carrying member of the Association of Photography Aficionados.
Mind if I get a shot of you? For posterity.
You got what it takes to be in front of the camera...
So. Apparently, there's a rather scenic spot not far from here.
Thing is, this terrain's a bit perilous.
At least, for your average photog like me...but maybe not for you?
take a moment to appreciate it. Try to view it as a professional photographer might.
You did me a good turn, so I did you one too.
I convinced the association to make you a member.

Of course, you're starting on the bottom rung,
but you'll work your way up.
And the more locations you find, the faster you'll climb that ladder.

Good going. Association was impressed too.
Bumped you up a rank.
Your technique isn't exactly where it needs to be, but you've got promise, that's for sure.
If you can develop your talents more, I guarantee you'll go places.
Excellent scouting. The Association's dubbed you a "regular frontiersman."
They see your potential─same as I did. You know how and where to find true beauty in this world.

It's a gift, and not everyone's got it.
So don't let yours go to waste.
Very nice! I'd say you're a first-rate photographer now!
If the Association had any lingering doubts about you, this latest shot should've completely dispelled them.
At this rate, you'll outrank me. But hey...friendly competition never hurt anyone!
Great work getting that shot. You really are one shrewd shutterbug.
To quote the Association, your talents are "inimitable."
You've got quite the portfolio now. Can't wait to see how it grows.
Here's something that oughta brighten your day: the Association has bumped you up a rank. Congratulations!
Honestly, you really oughta show off your work.
It bespeaks a beautiful finesse─never seen anything like it.
Some might say it belongs in a gallery!

Well, I'll be...
You've come a long way, friend.

My heartfelt congratulations.
You've earned the Association's highest honor.
Which makes it official: you're a true master of the craft─a force of talent, without peer.
Said it before and I'll say it again─I saw your potential from the start.
Though, if I'm being honest, I didn't think you had this much potential.
It's been an inspiration to see you come into your own. Glad I could be a part of your journey.
Before you go─I made you this.
A little something to commemorate our friendship.
Wherever the road takes you, I hope you walk it, camera in hand. The world deserves to see your art.
You're certainly well traveled. Your body of work is proof of that.
I hope that more people come to recognize your talent.
Imposing yet welcoming... Beautiful yet haunting.
How it keeps the outside world at bay while engendering a sense of community.
A striking work of craftsmanship too. Every detail was seen to with such care.
So we meet again. Why don't you stand there? I'll take your photo with the bailey.
Have you taken a walk around the bailey yet?
So much history is hidden within these walls─it's an endless source of inspiration.
If you find any other scenic locations, let me know.
It's tough to capture something so large in one well-composed shot.
You have to consider the vantage point, the shadows... It can be daunting, but it's a fun challenge.
I'm always looking for new spots, so if you happen to know any...
Hey there. Thank you for tracking down that spot. Quite the view you captured.
The bailey's in fine spirits today, don't you think?
I'm serious. This wall can be very expressive.
It appears as if to be weeping. Like it's recalling an ancient battle that transpired, and the horrors to which it bore witness.
Impossible not to get a little weepy-eyed myself when I see it.
Just imagine the panoramic shots one could get from atop the clock tower.
With a telescopic lens, I could capture the beauty of Midgar at night.
Brittle houses in the sea air, paint chipping and wood bending. Time moving on.
And the light here─the way it bounces off the ocean below and the metal above.
A pastiche of contrasts. The stark, steel beams; the weather-beaten homes; the drying fish...!
Oh. Made your way out here, huh? Mind if I get a shot of you? I've got the perfect backdrop.
Under Junon's a fascinating little town. Their waters especially so. I mean, the color.
This beauty comes at a dangerously high price, though. It's worth documenting before it's gone.
Anyway─if you know any other camera-worthy subjects...
Getting the exposure correct down here can be a bit tricky, what with the lack of sunlight.
As always, I'd welcome tips about other promising spots.
Hey there. Thank you for tracking down that spot. Quite the view you captured.
Though this town may appear to be on its last legs, its people are most certainly not.
There's a fire in them─or rather, an anger.
Not hard to see why─their capital sunk to the depths... Wish I could get a picture.
Each level of Junon is like its own world, with its own unique culture. It's remarkable, really.
I would love to get a shot of the cannon from the ocean. I wonder if I could charter a dinghy for a day.
What a charming inn. Wonder how long it's been here.
A relic from Costa del Sol's time as a fishing village, perhaps?
The crumbling walls, the hole-pocked roof, the rotting beams...
Nature seems poised to reclaim it at any moment...
Tucked away from everything, like it's bashful─trying to hide from someone.
It's changed so much, I almost didn't recognize it.
Rustic charm notwithstanding, I would've never stayed there.
The owner's collection of artifacts could prove interesting subject matter...
Hang loose! Looks like another fine day in paradise. Shall we commemorate it with a photo?
Did this inn catch your eye as well? Figured it might.
While it's a far cry from the five-star hotels on Main Street, it has a certain appeal.
I suspect this area has a plethora of photogenic spots.
Everything seems to shine brighter here.
The sun, the sand, the sea...
The beautiful, spirited dancers. The tropical cuisine...
All of it yearns to be preserved.
Surely there are more lovely sights to be found in this region...
Hey there. Thank you for tracking down that spot. Quite the view you captured.
Costa del Sol is full of visual wonders, but it takes effort to capture that magic on film.
If you don't select your subjects with care, then all your pictures will start to look the same.

That's why I prefer the road less photographed─
places out of the way and off the beaten path.
...So long as I don't get lost, that is.
Could mix things up by snapping some underwater shots.
A lot of the Aficionados are big fans of the aquatic life native to this region.
They always book me to photograph the latest swimsuit line. Wonder what designs they came up with this year.
There's something beautiful about these savage designs... They're cutting-edge─revolutionary, even.
Gives you some real insight into the minds of the folks who ride them.
Almost makes you wonder which came first: the biker or the bike?
Why, hello. Good to see you again. How about a photo to commemorate our reunion?
Folks down here in the Dustbowl make for excellent subjects, let me tell you.
Everyone here is so raw and authentic.
Let me know if you stumble upon any promising spots around here.
Some thugs literally ran me out of town. Made for great action shots.
I've already got solid pictures of the prison, so let me know if you find any other good backdrops.
Hey there. Thank you for tracking down that spot. Quite the view you captured.
The Gold Saucer and the Dustbowl have a uniquely diametrical dynamic.
Shining splendor above, grisly depravity below...
Juxtaposing photos of one against the other brings the true breadth of human desire into relief.
That could make for a neat exhibition.
Around here, I tend to keep my camera "locked and loaded."
I never let my baby out of my sight down here. Too many thieves.
This must be one of Gongaga's famous mushrooms.
These look good enough to eat─and I might just do that!
Conveying flavor through a visual medium is tough, but I'm up for the challenge.
Hey there. Good to see you again. Since you're here, mind if I snap a pic of a fun guy with some fungi?
This restaurant hired me to grab a couple of shots for them to use in their menu.
I'm supposed to shoot "the freshest Gongaga mushrooms I can find."
Gonna get pics of the scenery while I'm here. Make the most of the opportunity and all that.
Let me know if you find anything picturesque.
Feels like time passes slower here, especially compared to the city. Everyone seems so at peace.
I'd love to get a shot that captures the atmosphere.
If you come across a spot that might look good in photos, I'd love to hear about it.
Hey there. Thank you for tracking down that spot. Quite the view you captured.
Flora photography can be difficult for beginners.
The trick is to get on their level.
By lowering your lens to meet the plants, you can get a much more immersive shot of the lush vegetation.
Contrasting your subject against the background can be hard, but it's a lot easier if you squat down before you shoot.
You should give it a try.
Hope that restaurant will comp me a meal or two for my hard work.
...What I wouldn't give for a plate of sautéed Gongaga mushrooms.
Our planet is the greatest artist.
The way the shadows carve out the red stone... It's perfectly balanced.
There's something that's truly magical about the harmony of natural structures.
Fancy running into you here. Say, how about I get a shot of you giving thanks to the planet?

The beauty of this place is unreal.
Pictures can't do it justice.
Wonders such as these have to be experienced in person.
I want to believe I can capture this magic.
I'm looking for spots with a spiritual feel─if you know any.
The canyon's also famous for its unparalleled view of the starry night sky.
I made sure to bring all my night photography equipment along. Can't sleep until I've got the perfect starlit shot!
Just let me know if you find any good photo spots.
Hey there. Thank you for tracking down that spot. Quite the view you captured.
This canyon is a masterpiece of our planet, carved over eons.
As I try to capture that span of time on film, I feel like I become one with the world.
I talk about this a lot with the others...
but we aren't taking pictures of our subjects; they're compelling us to capture their majesty.
And once we attain that clarity? That's when we start producing art.
I bet I could get incredible shots with that observational telescope.
Wonder if ancient people were as amazed by this scenery as we are. Might be human nature.
It cuts a rather stern and imposing figure.
The ragged ridges jutting into the sky... Like something out of a fantastical painting.
I can't imagine the folks in those treatment centers sleep easy with Mt. Nibel looming behind them.
Oh, what a pleasant surprise. Say, why don't you and those robed folks pose for a photo?
It turns out that Shinra's in charge of the treatment facilities here.
Getting permission to take pictures was not easy.
All my photos will be reviewed─and if Shinra sees something they don't like, it's theirs.
Just gotta impress those suits with some nice shots.
If you find a good photo spot, don't hesitate to let me know.
Today's target is none other than Mt. Nibel.
No other natural formation can inspire so much dread. Just looking at it gives me goose bumps!
Gonna get some shots around town too. Not every day I visit Nibelheim.
If you find a place worth shooting, gimme a holler.
Hey there. Thank you for tracking down that spot. Quite the view you captured.
I'm surprised they made the home of the world's first reactor a treatment center rather than a tourist trap.
And the buildings here look pretty new despite the town's age. Doesn't that strike you as a bit odd?
What sort of secrets do you think Shinra's hiding here?
It's probably nothing─but getting the imagination going is part of what makes photography fun.
I managed to get permission to take pictures of every place in town except for one: Shinra Manor.
Hopefully none of my shots get me in trouble.
I'm Dorian─representative of the Piano Outreach Association.
It is my duty to support those who liberate music from the page and bring it to life with their performances.
I hope you will aid me in my humble mission to spread the joy of the piano to every corner of the world.
Would you care to share a performance with me?
How may I be of service to you?
There's no finer sound in all the world than the voice of a humble piano.

Tell Dorian how you performed?
You will earn a reward for achieving an A rank on a song.
I regret that I've nothing to award you at this time. Nevertheless, I trust you will continue on your musical journey.
Mellifluous melodies are all the more pleasing when played on the piano. Thank you for sharing such joy with the world.
I hope you will enchant us with even more splendid performances in time.
So, you've mastered all of our pieces? Well done.
On behalf of the association, I offer you our deepest gratitude─and this token of our appreciation.
I'd like you to have this too─an expression of my own personal admiration.
At a young age, I lost my sense of sight. And so, sounds became my window to the world.
The chirping of birds, the rustling of leaves, the trickling of rain─
Each a ray of light that pierced the darkness and brought color to the pitch-black world in which I had come to live.
By playing the piano, I learned to speak from the heart in the language of music─to share my own light with the world.
And I hope that I may continue sharing that light, spreading the joy of music to all who will listen!
Written on this page is the music that illuminates my world.
I've no doubt that─in time─you will learn to harness its light.
May you grace the ivories with your dexterous touch, and weave your enchanting melody for many years to come.
We've gone to great lengths to distribute our sheet music far and wide.
Should you stumble upon a piece in your travels, I hope you'll take to the keys and give it a try.
Surrender to the music. We are vessels through which it may flow─the melody, our guide.
Become one with the piano, and all will be effortless.
Of course, the path to musical enlightenment is without end.
Which is why I ask your continued assistance in sharing the joy of music with the world.
Oh, it's a wonderful day for a melody, wouldn't you agree?
Where there is music and a piano on which to play, there too is a place for me.
The piano is here for you, that you may add your own unique color to the soundscape of our world.
Whoa, are you like a pro or something?
Didn't really sound like your heart was in it.
You certainly gave it your best.
Well, that was a nice little diversion.
I could do better than that.
Too avant garde for my tastes.
Hold up the camera and Red XIII will get into position. Once you're satisfied, snap a shot.
Your shot doesn't match the theme very well...
Your shot matches the theme perfectly!
Take a picture of Red XIII.
Increase your zoom to 100% and snap the shot.
Red XIII is not in the picture. Try taking another photo.
Capture the moment before it passes you by.
You can sneak a photo of Aerith if you wish─just make sure it's a good one.
Take a picture of the falling stars.

Share your scenic photo with Snaps?
Hello, Cloud. Would you care to assist me with my research?
How goes the hunt for world intel?
Should you require assistance, please do not hesitate to ask.
Seeing you again has elicited quite the emotional response in me...
I must be excited to see your progress!
What a beautiful thing it is, to travel the world.
I only wish that I had been afforded the opportunity to do so sooner.
Checking vitals... It would appear you are in fine health, Cloud─if perhaps a little fatigued. Nothing a good night's sleep can't address though, I'm sure.
Please rest at your earliest convenience.
I assume you saw that broadcast from Wutai? It goes without saying that tensions are running high.
Four years ago, the park underwent extensive renovations, and was outfitted with state-of-the-art technology.
I'm keeping a close watch on Shinra's activities, but it is unclear how the company will respond.
Even today, the Gold Saucer continues to expand, with new attractions currently in the works!
The Gold Saucer is powered by proprietary modular reactors.
the reactors are cycled between active and dormant states to slow Corel's desertification.
Don't concern yourself with our research while you're here, Cloud. Use this time to unwind.
Hmm... These competitors look quite capable.
But I wonder how they'll fare against my latest deck.
I can't wait to get my picture taken.
Though I must say, I didn't anticipate this much competition!
The opportunity to engage in intergalactic warfare is most appealing.
I see you've secured yourself a rather intriguing vessel!
I wonder what powers their spacecraft. Mako, perhaps?
Something about all these couples sets my heart aflutter!
I don't need a partner to ride the Skywheel, do I?
My statistical analysis of the birds is going well.
I've been able to successfully predict the winner of every race!
I'm waiting for one of the actors to come out. I was hoping I could ask them for an autograph.
Their captivating performance turned me into a fan!
Hmm... Who to select as my travel companion...
Appearance is important, yes, but so is tactile sensation!
I hope to create a ship of my own one day─perhaps even an airship! You'll have to join me on its maiden voyage.
This is a considerably dangerous location, so I decided to disguise myself. How did I do?
Costumes like these are known to elicit a calming effect, so I should be safe.
Unfortunately, we can't say the same for Barret.
I'm confident of his innocence, though, and I will do everything in my power to help prove it.
Despite my efforts to conceal my identity with this costume, I can't help but feel ill at ease.
Trying to avoid attention may have had the opposite effect.
That said, any attempts on my life will immediately trigger my defense systems.
I can assure you, any assailants wouldn't stand a chance.
By the way, have you explored the desert?
I attempted to survey the sands on my own, but I found that this costume impeded my locomotion.
Now then, let us get down to business. Our research won't conduct itself!
I caution you not to neglect hydration.
This location once served as a residential area for Gold Saucer staff.
But desertification drew dangerous fiends to the region, so they were all relocated to lodgings on-site.
Unsavory characters claimed the vacated land and transformed it into Corel Prison.
Why hello, Cloud. Did you enjoy your buggy ride?
The tires are reinforced to provide traction in even the most slippery of sands.
Which means you can explore the dunes at your leisure.
This also means you can gather more detailed intel about the desert for me.
I can't say what materia will serve you best, but make sure you're prepared.
The village youth coalition is surprisingly well organized. Their leader must be quite capable!
Indeed, I suspect there is more to Cissnei than meets the eye.
But we can exchange pleasantries some other time. How may I help you?
Have you sampled any Gongaga mushrooms yet?
High-class Midgar restaurants use desiccated ones in their dishes.
Yet here, fresh fungi are a cheap and common staple for the locals!
Have you ridden the local chocobos?
They've adapted to this lush biome...
using the mushrooms for sustenance as well as a means of traversal.
Being trampled helps these fungi spread their spores. It's a fascinating symbiosis!
I see you too have come to do a little avian investigation.
While most chocobos run on land, the birds around here are capable of taking to the skies!
Flying on chocoback must be quite the thrill.
Perhaps the chocobos here developed the ability to glide through the air as a means of crossing the canyon.
Anyway. To what do I owe the pleasure?
Cosmo Canyon is known for its red earth, but did you know the pigment is the product of iron oxide?
The region is also famous for salt deposits.
The salt mined here has a mild yet savory quality─as I'm sure you know.
I bet you're wondering how the people here fulfill their needs for power.
They abstain from mako altogether, and rely instead on a series of wind turbines...
as befits the home of planetology.
We're at the Cosmo Canyon, Cloud! A long-standing dream of mine has finally come true!
Planetology rejects our mako-consuming society, insisting that we have much to learn about this world.
And now we have the opportunity to share in their planetary knowledge!
I see you've made your way back to Kalm!
Hey, Cloud. Have you met with Fellow Bugenhagen?
He's the authority on planetology─a scholar without peer. He even assisted with Shinra's own research!
I'd love to sit in on one of his lectures if I get the chance!
The canyon is an ideal spot for astronomical observation. Care to try?
Perfectly clear skies allow for an excellent view of the stars!
I recommend that you take a look heavenward while you're here!
Have you visited the library? It's filled with all sorts of old tomes unlike any I've ever seen before!
None have been digitized, however, so I'm secretly cataloging them as I browse.

Oh, Cloud! Have you come to brush up
on your bird handling?
As soon as I heard the legendary chocobo sage was here, I knew I had to come.
I was surprised to see a recluse residing in such luxury...
This town's bucolic atmosphere and charming architecture have made it a popular retirement destination for former Shinra employees.
Even hermits enjoy a dip in the pool.
And now that I am here, it is not difficult to see why.
While several breeds can fly, water-walking is a feat unique to this one.
Perhaps the chocobo sage chose this location in order to study these special birds.
I've heard the sage was not only an accomplished breeder, but a talented jockey as well.
Some even say his efforts were instrumental in the development of the modern chocobo industry!
If that is to be believed, he's a remarkable man indeed.
Cloud, are you familiar with chocograss?
It's an unusual plant, often seen floating along warm updrafts generated by solar energy.
Little else is known, though, due to a lack of research.
Well? Care to blaze the scientific trail?
I hear this village is a treatment facility for mako poisoning...
No doubt you've noticed the mako tank.
which explains the abundance of robed patients.
To see so many in one place...
Perhaps those we met previously were making a pilgrimage to this town?
Mt. Nibel strikes an imposing figure.
Without plants to stabilize the soil, the mountainside is prone to collapse.
That treacherous terrain has claimed the lives of many climbers.
In that sense, it is connected to the land of the dead.
Cursory investigation suggests Nibelheim is a quaint, mountain village, yet it feels...off.
Almost all records are highly classified, and it seems Professor Hojo is somehow involved as well.
I should note that the world's first mako reactor was built here in Nibelheim.
Shinra used its energy to conduct a range of experiments.
Is it mere coincidence that this place now hosts a mako poisoning treatment center?
Hello! I'm pleased to see you in good spirits. How may I be of service today?
As the town has no reactor, it relies entirely on the mako Midgar harvests.
How goes the hunt for world intel?
A portion of said yield is retained in this tank as a reserve supply.
Should you require assistance, please do not hesitate to ask.
I can't say what materia will serve you best, but make sure you're prepared.
Cloud! I'm pleased to see you've completed our survey of the grasslands!
I cannot thank you enough for the data you provided─it was as enriching as the lands here are fecund!
Indeed, it has been a valuable learning experience─one I could have never had in Midgar.
I hope we can continue to study this world of ours together.
Cloud! You've completed our survey of the Junon region, I see.
I've learned so much about the Republic of Junon, thanks in no small part to your efforts in these storied lands.
Kalm has a truly fascinating history.
Such insight into our past will invariably help us understand the course Shinra may take in the future.
I cannot thank you enough for partnering with me.
That was excellent work in completing our survey of the Corel region, Cloud!
Through your efforts, the ways in which Shinra shaped these lands for weal and for woe, are now much more clearly understood.
Of special interest is the Gold Saucer's effect on the soil, a testament to the ecological impact of technology.
Thank you so much for your invaluable contributions.
I'm happy to report that your survey of the Gongaga region is complete.
Your discoveries have me all the more convinced that humans have the capacity to coexist with nature.
It was also edifying to observe how the planet so decisively reclaimed the reactor.
Thank you again for providing such priceless insight.
Founded as a way station for travelers in the time of the republic, it grew into a prosperous town...
Well done! Our survey of the Cosmo Canyon region is complete!
My understanding of the planet has deepened considerably thanks to the data you've provided.
This wealth of new and diverse perspectives has certainly broadened my horizons.
I could not have come this far without your help. Thank you.
It would appear you have completed our survey of the Nibel region, Cloud.
One could argue that this is where the Shinra Electric Power Company truly began.
Consequently, it's no surprise that your investigations identified a multitude of concerns.
Let's hope our partnership leads to lasting solutions.
Thanks to your efforts, this area has been fully surveyed.
And yet, this is only the beginning of our adventures together.
and played a pivotal role in Midgar's construction!
I'm excited to see what knowledge awaits us elsewhere.
Cloud! I have news regarding the combat simulator.
Thanks to the monster data you managed to collect, I was able to devise a new challenge for you.
I kindly invite you to give it a try.
Your efforts have yielded an astounding amount of data, Cloud.
Perhaps you would like to use it to develop materia?
Thank you, Cloud, for activating the remnawave towers.
As you are aware, these structures were built by the republic to study the planet...
thus making them an indispensable tool for furthering our pursuit of world intel.
To that end, I ask that you activate any others you come across.
Cloud! Have you heard of "golden plumes"?
They're a variety of chocobo feather noted for their especially unique luster...
According to my research, Shinra rebuilt Kalm from the ground up approximately ten years ago.
and are used for both ornamental and medicinal purposes.
You should pick up any you find, as certain shops might be willing to trade them for goods.
Cloud, have you by chance observed the species of bird that likes to gather at lifesprings?
It's a new one entirely, which I have taken to calling "springseeker owl"!
If you ever have trouble locating a lifespring, I suggest following these creatures.
As a reminder, you can find transmuter chips buried within republic ruins throughout the land.
Analyzing lifesprings may help you pinpoint the precise location of these chips.
You should make an effort to seek out more of them if you wish to obtain new formulas.
Cloud, have you spotted any rabbits nearby?
From what I've observed thus far, the ones in this region have a habit of hoarding trinkets in their burrows.
Curiously, however, records from that time appear to have been erased. What could have necessitated such a large-scale reconstruction?
So if you spot a burrow, you may want to dig it up with a chocobo.
Who knows what sort of things you might find!
Cloud! Have you ever seen a juvenile chocobo lingering in the vicinity of an old stop?
Evidently, these locations still have a particular fragrance that attracts the adolescent birds to them.
If you notice a stray chocobo, you may want to have a look around.
You'll likely find a stop not too far from it!
I heard that you assisted the moogles in opening their shop!
It's said that moogle medals─their unique currency─is imbued with a preternatural power to lift one's spirits.
Perhaps collecting these medals and delivering them to the moogles will bring us that much closer to a planet replete with joy and laughter.
Cloud, are you still gathering resources?
Cloud! Have you been to the Mythril Mine yet?
Remember that you can transmute items with plants, ore, and other materials found the world over.
Some of these materials may help you enhance your combat capabilities.
I strongly suggest collecting all that you find, as they will be a boon to our research efforts.
I have recreated Titan, the mythical colossus of the grasslands, in virtual space!
I encourage you to pit your skills against this summoned entity, so that I might complete its materia.
I have recreated Phoenix, the firebird of reincarnation from Junon legend, within the simulator.
I encourage you to pit your skills against this summoned entity, so that I might complete its materia.
Alexander, the sacred mechanical fortress of Corel, is now available for you to fight.
Though operations were suspended due to a lack of demand quite a while ago...
I encourage you to pit your skills against this summoned entity, so that I might complete its materia.
the mines served as a tourist attraction for some time.
You may now fight Kujata, the phantasmagorical beast of Gongaga legend, in the simulator.
I encourage you to pit your skills against this summoned entity, so that I might complete its materia.
You may now face off against Bahamut Arisen─a winged being possessed of phenomenal powers of destruction.
I encourage you to pit your skills against this summoned entity, so that I might complete its materia.
Odin, the noble knight hailing from the land of the dead, has been recreated within virtual space.
I encourage you to pit your skills against this summoned entity, so that I might complete its materia.
A cavern filled with mythril must be a sight to behold.
Cloud! Congratulations on your victory in the Gold Cup.
I was astounded by the synchronization between you and your chocobo. Pure poetry in motion!
I can only hope that you allow me to ride with you someday.
The chocobos in this region are more docile than most, as you might have noticed.
The grasslands' verdancy may play a role in this.
You can just smell life on the wind here, can't you.
The grasslands' rolling hills have long been used by ranchers to raise all manner of livestock.
Unfortunately, Midgar's mako reactors have impaired the land's ability to sustain life.
but the chocobos here are raised on a diet of feed, seaweed, and fish bone meal.
but the chocobos here have especially muscular legs, allowing them to scale steep inclines with ease.
An adaptation for traversing Junon's rugged terrain.
The topography here piques my interest.
The inlets serve as natural harbors for ships of all sizes to take on and deliver cargo.
Which is why the republic relied so heavily on maritime trade.
Many years ago, shipyards dotted the Junon coastline.
Following the war, though, Shinra allowed these yards to fall into disrepair.
Today, the abandoned facilities and scrapped vessels are monuments to the republic Shinra destroyed.
I see that you've made your way to Under Junon!
This town is quite reminiscent of the Midgar undercity, isn't it? The severe lack of sunlight being one similarity.
Cloud, have you been down to the beach yet?
From there, you can see where the republic's capital once was.
It was a flotilla─a thriving city built across ships.
Alas, the capital now sleeps at the bottom of the ocean─having been sunk in the war.
Have you noticed the unique coloration of the coastal waters?
It would seem that mako pollution is to blame.
The underwater reactor and its waste products pose a dire threat to both the people and the environment.
Not that Shinra would ever admit to such a thing.
Have you had a chance to sample the local cuisine, Cloud?
Under Junon is well known for not only its sun-dried fish, but also its fermented foodstuffs.
I was so curious that I ordered some myself, and found that it...had a very "unique" taste.
But don't take my word for it─try some.

Good day.
Is there something I can help you with?

Cloud!?
Why in the world are you wearing that uniform?
On second thought, forget I asked. The less I know about your undercover pursuits, the better.
Should you require assistance, let me know!

Now then, Captain!
How might I help you today?
Captain! Is there something you need from me?

Shake it, shake it... Loosey-goosey...
Welcome to Costa del Sol!
Have you tried this dance before?

I didn't think myself a dancer,
but I'm starting to see the appeal!
Perhaps you might like to "cut a rug" with me sometime?

Shake it, shake it... Loosey-goosey...
Welcome to Costa del Sol!
I didn't think myself a dancer, but I'm starting to see the appeal!
Perhaps you might like to "cut a rug" with me sometime?
Well, you certainly look ready for the beach!
I've yet to go... You see, I'm afraid of the ocean─embarrassing as that is to admit.
Should I ever muster the courage to get wet, perhaps you might accompany me for support?
I'll be sure to pick out the perfect bathing suit for the occasion!
Well, I'm glad to see that you're making the most of your time here.
Fun in the sun is an essential part of the research process. Never discount the power of a good vacation.
So please, go and enjoy Costa del Sol in my stead.
Cloud, don't tell me... You're participating in Costa del Amor!?
I wish I had known sooner. I would've liked to join you! It's not often the two of us have the opportunity to do anything besides research.
I must find out when this event is going to be held next.
Have you ridden a wheelie yet?
I just took one for a spin, and I must say, they're a delight!
They likely utilize a gyroscopic sensor and attitude control scheme to allow for such mobility...
I have to know what makes them tick!
Costa del Sol was not always a vacation spot.
It served as a military base during the war with the republic.
After which, Shinra redeveloped it into a premier resort.
In doing so, the company buried the scars of the war beneath a monument to gilded excess.
I have some good news, Cloud!
Wall Market's famous materia pops have made the journey to Costa del Sol!
Please allow me to handle any research regarding them. I promise to conduct a thorough analysis of every flavor.
Cloud, have you taken a zipline ride yet?
Originally designed as a means of travel...
the sensation of flying through the air proved so satisfying that it became a popular attraction.
Perhaps you too might find it diverting!
The coal mining industry here was the largest employer and backbone of the local community.
But everything changed with the advent of mako.
As you can see, this village is a casualty of "progress."
I sense hostility from the locals, especially toward your party.
I'm not sure why, but it does give me pause.
If there's anything I can do, please don't hesitate to ask.
Have you been to the Corel mines?
The track they laid there is among the longest in history.
Can you imagine riding down such a meticulously crafted stretch of rail?
According to my research, North Corel was a mining facility that has since become the town we see today.
In fact, there were no residents here at all. These people used to live in the former village of Corel...
which once lay at the foot of the mountain.
Hello there, Cloud! It's not often I see you in the company of a single comrade.

Yes... I believe I understand the situation.
Forgive me, I didn't mean to intrude.

Yes, I...believe I understand the situation now.
My presence is very much unwanted, isn't it?

You're both overdue for a break.
Enjoy yourselves tonight.

You're both overdue for a break.
Enjoy yourselves tonight.
Hello there, Cloud! Oh...where is everyone else?
Ah, of course... Forgive me, I should have realized. We all need our alone time.
But know that I'm here, if you find yourself feeling lonely!
Hello there, Cloud! Are you enjoying yourself here at the Gold Saucer?
I wish you all the best in your ongoing hunt for world intel.
If there's anything else I can do for you, please let me know. I'm always happy to help.
I look forward to seeing what new discoveries you make in your travels.
I can't help but wonder where we'll meet next. So many fascinating possibilities...
Needless to say, many hazards await you on the road, so take care.
I hope you won't mind my mentioning, but...I've observed that world intel collection has stalled of late.
I'm certain, however, a veteran mercenary like you would never abandon a task.
I know you must be busy, but I'd appreciate your help.
Have you made any progress lately in the hunt for that protorelic I mentioned before?
If not, don't worry. I'm sure you have more pressing matters to attend to.
I was wondering if you might have time to study the unique fiend we identified earlier.
Engaging it may yield valuable data.
While combat does have its risks, with due preparation, I'm certain you would be up to the task.
Congratulations on toppling Titan! Though legendary, his earth-shattering strength was no match for your own.
I'm sure he'll provide you with steadfast support. You're in good hands now.
And rather large ones, at that!
That was a masterful victory over Phoenix!
The flames it conjured were so captivating... I could hardly look away!
With an immortal ally like that at your side, you've nothing to fear─not even death!
Congratulations on defeating Alexander! You rejected his judgment and rendered your own. Well done.
And now his divine protection is yours to call upon on your adventures! A great comfort, I'm sure.
To think that anyone could tame a beast of so many affinities!
I cannot say where this wild steed might lead you, but I encourage you to find out!
Bahamut Arisen has fallen. Well done!
I had no idea the god of destruction could evolve further. But I now suspect it could surpass even these limits.
With this crimson terror at your command...
I almost pity anyone who is foolish enough to try and stand in your way!
Besting Odin... You've done the unthinkable!
A single mistake could have spelled certain doom, but your persistence paid off in the end.
With his mighty Zantetsuken, this master of the blade will certainly help you cut a path to victory!
With that, you've completed all of the combat trials I prepared for you.
Though I didn't doubt for a moment that you would.
Rest assured that I will make the most of the invaluable data you've provided.
Congratulations, and thank you for your hard work!
Oh, right! I'll leave the simulator online in case you wish to continue honing your skills in combat.

This data is incredible!
Thank you for your contribution.
You made short work of that simulation.
Are my trials not challenging enough?
I gather from your expression that you're eager for more.
Thanks to you, my archives are filling up with combat data.
I encourage you to try again sometime.
Endless replayability is the simulator's greatest strength.
Analyzing one's failures can prove instructive.
Don't worry, even incomplete trials can provide me with useful data.
Good news. I was able to compile all relevant world intel data. I can't thank you enough.
Good news. I was able to compile all relevant world intel data. I can't thank you enough.
Good news. I was able to compile all relevant world intel data. I can't thank you enough.
Now that the work is done, I can show you the fruits of our labor.
Now that the work is done, I can show you the fruits of our labor.
Now that the work is done, I can show you the fruits of our labor.
The sum total of our intel. The world we call home.
Hey─remember those monstrosities, Cloud? Would've been a real handful without my help!
Like that one─and that one! And that one!
Ah, just look at them all! So many wonderful memories to treasure. Wouldn't you agree, Cloud?

Please refrain from interrupting me.
This is important.
The real reason I asked you to gather so much data was so that I could archive it.
For a project I call "the Ark Library."
As you know, the planet is in a precarious position.
Shinra's mako reactors are draining the world dry...
Wutai and the SRC speak of war...
No one knows what the future holds for us.
Indeed, it could be that our annihilation is imminent.
So I want to preserve all I can.

Everything, from the quotidian to the extraordinary;
it all deserves to be remembered.
It's not going anywhere. We will save the planet.

Right, I'm sure you will.
I have every faith in you, Cloud.

To protect this world of ours,
I will support you to the bitter end.
You have gone above and beyond.
The wealth of data you've provided will surely open up new avenues of research.
It may even lead us to unexplored corners of our planet, where more discoveries no doubt await!
Our quest for knowledge is far from over!
The value of your assistance cannot be overstated, Cloud.
Though I have no more to ask of you for now, I hope that we can continue our partnership!
If you need anything, you know where to find me!
It's so good to see you again, Cloud.
I've been traveling from town to town, searching for an ideal location in which I might continue my research.
But I'm having some difficulty narrowing it down.
The intel you have gathered has paid dividends.
I've begun to see the planet in a whole new light!
The more I learn about our world, the more rewarding it is to explore it.
Cloud! How go your travels? Well, I hope?
Hello! I hope you're doing well.
My research is proceeding smoothly, thanks to the intel you collected. You have my gratitude.
Hmm... Kalm would be a peaceful and pleasant place to conduct research.
Though perhaps so pleasant that I might not get any work done. What do you think, Cloud?
The presence of chocobos might aid my research.
Perhaps I should consider analyzing their cries.
I'm quite surprised at how well the scent of chocobos blends with that of the salty sea breeze.
Perhaps such a fragrance would enhance my research.
I intend to take this opportunity to study the waters here.
I hope to help facilitate the restoration of the environment for the dolphins.
Are you taking a brief vacation as well, Cloud? Currently, I'm weighing the pros and cons of engaging in sunbathing.
Hmm... This may be a good occasion to evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of coal.
It would be prudent to not rely solely on mako energy.
I admit, the Gold Saucer is not well suited to research. It's too easy to be distracted here.
This is a good place from which to investigate the desert.
Though I may require your aid if I do decide to set out.
I couldn't ask for a quieter place to conduct my research. And it has great mushrooms.
I'm considering obtaining a sky chocobo for myself as well.
I hope I can count on you to teach me how to ride it sometime.
Planetology is fascinating, but I may need an update to fully comprehend it.
I plan to preserve such knowledge for the benefit of future generations.
It requires a great deal of patience to learn from the chocobo sage.
Professor Hojo has certainly left his mark on this town, hasn't he?
I suppose that makes it a fitting place for me to endeavor to surpass his research.
If there is nothing else, then I wish you good luck in your travels.
There may be no more intel to collect, but I hope we can still meet from time to time.
Obtaining all that intel has only stoked my desire to learn more.
If I could visit other continents...
Hey, Cloud! It seems that a transmuter chip is buried nearby!
You should be able to "sniff it out" with the aid of a chocobo.
Once you pinpoint its location, you can ask your bird to dig it up.
With that, let the treasure hunt begin!
If you're searching for a transmuter chip, you should summon a chocobo.
If you're struggling to locate the chip, you could rely on your chocobo's sense of smell.
Look at that─you've stumbled upon a lifespring!
Why don't you try scanning it─see what you uncover.
Accessing the planet's figurative database should help us learn about the area.
Lifesprings such as this can be discovered in every region.
Their potential energy output is far too minuscule for Shinra to exploit.
But to us, they're fonts of intel.
I encourage you to seek out more of these lifesprings.

Hey, Cloud. Do you notice any
sparkling minerals nearby?
These are known as "guidestones"─crystals that direct travelers to shrines to the divine.
The stones emit light when they shatter, producing an illuminated path. If ever you're lost, try smashing one!
Following the light should lead you to a sanctuary said to honor the tutelary deity of a given region.
The shrines contain untold divine knowledge, slumbering within massive crystals.
I can use this knowledge to strengthen your summoning materia, so I encourage you to seek out said sanctuaries.
Hey, Cloud. I believe that there is a sanctuary in your vicinity.
If you see a guidestone, shatter it.
I'm detecting divine wavelengths nearby. I suggest you prepare for crystalline analysis.
High energy readings up ahead, Cloud. I suspect this means you're approaching a divine shrine.
I'm detecting peculiar reverberations. Survey the area and see if there's a sanctuary nearby.
Crystal frequency detected. This may be an opportunity to glean new divine knowledge!
Cloud, do you see a guidestone nearby? If so, you can use it to locate a sanctuary!
This is positively incredible, Cloud! I can't recall ever seeing a crystal of this caliber before!

To think the secrets of the divine dwell within...
I cannot wait to see what sort of intel our analysis will yield!
You'll need to synchronize with the crystal before I can extract data on the deiform entity.
Analysis complete! I managed to extract the necessary data from the crystal.
This should allow me to strengthen your materia.
Thanks to you, Cloud, I was able to successfully extract data on the deity.
Excellent work! I hope we can procure data from other crystals as well.
That was perfect! Thanks to your hard work, I've obtained invaluable divine intel!
Splendid synchronization! Let's hope our investigation of other shrines goes as smoothly.
That was incredible... It was as if you and the crystal were actually communicating with one another!
You've fallen out of favor with the crystal.
I'm confident you'll succeed next time!
Take a deep breath, and pay close attention to the pattern.
This cliff appears to be insurmountable without a mountain chocobo.
If you wish to proceed any further, you'll need a hearty mountain chocobo.
Did you know, Cloud, that forest chocobos use mushrooms as springboards?
You know, a forest chocobo would allow you to traverse those vines with ease.
Perhaps you would be able to cross if you were riding a sky chocobo.
I believe a sky chocobo would be able to glide across the thermal updrafts.
Sorry, Cloud, but I'm afraid you can't proceed without an ocean chocobo.
If you can believe it, an ocean chocobo would let you fly across the water!
Hey, Cloud. I believe this terrain is best traversed by buggy.
Careful, Cloud. Only the buggy can cross quicksand.
Keep your wits about you, Cloud.
Beyond this cave lies the land that appeared during our protorelic pursuit:
There's no telling what trials await.
Hawww... Can't this wait? I was enjoying such a restful sleep mode.
I need you to run an analysis of fiends in the area.
No hits... I can't offer any guidance!
I'm detecting the signals from all the protorelics we've discovered thus far at the coordinates up ahead.
It would seem our quest for these artifacts is drawing to a close.
I wish you the best of luck, Cloud!
Cloud! That data has revealed an intriguing site!
The nest of the quetzalcoatl, a rare bird native to these lands!
So rare, in fact, that few have ever seen it. This is a prime research opportunity for us!
I should also mention that you'll need its talons to transmute the part the windmill requires.
Mildred is anxiously awaiting your return, so I recommend subduing the creature with haste.
Cloud! By analyzing the lifespring data...
I was able to locate an old republic transmuter chip.
This chip likely contains an exceptionally rare formula.
Upon analyzing the data from the lifespring, I was able to locate a new transmuter chip.
It's among the refuse left over from the pipeline's construction.
Though a touch far from your current location, it's a rather short chocobo ride.
That was a very impressive battle just now!
Based on the battle data you provided...
I was able to generate a new virtual combat trial.
Feel free to try it whenever the mood takes you.
Cloud! I see that you completed that challenge with grace and panache!
Don't you know it's rude to interrupt?
Why, I did no such thing!
I've analyzed the battle data you sent and constructed a new virtual combat trial.
I hope it's to your liking.
Bravo! That was an extraordinary display!
The data you collected will prove invaluable!
In fact, we've already used it to produce a new combat trial! Check it out!
Wha─!? I see that MAI has already covered everything. Which means, I have nothing to add at this time.
The grasslands are home to Titan's sanctuaries.
In the age of myths, when Titan rose from his subterranean prison, he created a massive earthquake.
Thus did a vast swath of land rise from the sea, becoming the grasslands.
According to local legends, Titan possesses earth-shattering strength.
He is capable of crushing whole mountains with his fist.
Perhaps we have him to thank for the rolling hills and verdant plains that comprise this region of the planet.
The people of the grasslands once believed that earthquakes would occur if they angered Titan.
Kalm's present-day harvest festival most likely originated as a ritual offering of crops meant to appease him.
That concludes our analysis of the grasslands summon crystals. Thank you.
Now Titan will become an even more formidable ally. Congratulations.
Though you have yet to obtain the requisite materia, as I recall.
You'll first need to confront the divine via the combat simulator!
Your combat data has revealed the location of the mindflayer lurking in the Junon region.
It's said this eldritch horror devours the brains of its victims.
We cannot turn a blind eye to this threat!
Cloud! Congratulations on dispatching the mindflayer!
I was concerned the fiend might feast upon your brains, but I'm glad to see my fears were unfounded.
Only a true hero could ever have defeated such a malevolent evil.
Your valiant efforts today have brought the world one step closer to peace!
Cloud! By analyzing the lifespring data...
I was able to locate an old republic transmuter chip.
It can be found within a derelict structure that sits upon the coastline.
This area is mottled with craters resulting from intense warfare between the republic and Shinra.
Do mind your step as you proceed.
Most excellent work, Cloud. Did that battle prove a fitting test of your prowess?
Your dissatisfied expression says it all.
Oh yes, I noticed that as well!
You aren't equipped with that functionality.
Anyway, with the data from your latest bout, I created a new virtual combat trial.
It will prove a real test!
Nice! You've successfully completed all Junon combat assignments.
Oh, is something the matter? Perhaps you're fatigued from your battles?
Then allow me to provide a massage!
And how do you plan to do that?
Why, by way of resonance, of course! I can use my gorgeous vocal vibrations! Ahem! Like sooo!
Hahaha. Alright, MAI. You've had your fun.
Now then, your latest triumph has allowed me to create a new combat trial. I hope you enjoy it.
Junon is home to the summoned entity Phoenix.
Though Ifrit is often associated with fire, Phoenix's flames are no less potent.
In fact, the conflagrations of this undying bird are said to imbue those it touches with renewed life.
Perhaps it will offer you its grace.
Many legends about Phoenix have been passed down.
One tells of the great bird scouring the coast in search of a final resting place.
A fisherman bade it share the warmth of his fire.
Phoenix dipped its feathers in the proffered flames, thereby rekindling its fading life force.
The legend also tells of the gifts Phoenix bestowed on the kind angler.
As thanks for his fire, the great bird brought forth myriad fish into the world.
So when next you partake of the region's seafood, remember to praise Phoenix!
Well done! You've located and analyzed all the crystals in the Junon region.
Thanks to you, Phoenix's flames will no doubt be that much more radiant!
Though you have yet to obtain the requisite materia, as I recall.
You'll first need to confront the divine via the combat simulator!
I've ascertained the whereabouts of the sovereign of all tonberries─the Tonberry King!
Now is our chance to learn his royal secrets.
Rumor has it that this king wears a most beautiful crown. Why not take this opportunity to relieve him of it?
You did it, Cloud! I now dub thee the new king of the tonberries!
By analyzing the king's biometrics, we can better understand tonberry social structures.
Our research proceeds apace. Thank you, Cloud!
Cloud! By analyzing the lifespring data...
I was able to locate an old republic transmuter chip.
This one appears to be within a derelict factory.
Abandoned after the republic's fall, the facility is in a rather poor state.
Exploring old ruins... Isn't it exciting?
Upon analyzing the data from the lifespring, I was able to locate a new transmuter chip.
The chip can be found in a village abandoned due to desertification.
This erosion will spread if left unchecked, and eventually the entire village will be swallowed by the sands.
Do try to collect the chip before that happens.
That was very impressive work, Cloud!
Using the data from your battles, I've devised a new trial for the simulator.
I think you'll find it to be a most fascinating scenario, so please do give it a try.
Cloud, I've analyzed the data from your latest bout and graded your performance. You've earned...a ten out of ten!
Apologies, MAI is speaking out of turn. Pay her no mind.
You get a three out of ten.
I what!? Those sound like questionable metrics.
Never mind. We'll discuss this later.
Cloud, I've come up with a new combat trial for you. Why not give it a go?
Well done, Cloud! You've managed to complete all combat assignments in the Corel region.
What assignments they were! You faced so many fiends!
Anyway, I've added a new combat trial to the simulator, Cloud.
It's been some time since you were last here, so let me refresh your memory.
To access the modular reactors, you need to locate cactuar rocks.
Look for a cactuar statue nearby. Hold it aloft and follow the light to find the rock you need.
In order to obtain the protorelic, you'll have to overcome the cactuar trial.
Kid G awaits you inside the modular reactor. I wish you good luck!
Corel's divine sanctuaries contain knowledge of the summoned entity Alexander.
Long ago, a great but wicked nation prospered in Corel.
Legend tells that it was wiped out overnight by a giant mechanical construct.
According to legends passed down in Corel...
whenever humanity strays from the proper course, Alexander appears to render his righteous judgment.
His pronouncements are absolute and cannot be defied.
Parents sometimes tell misbehaving children that Alexander might come and smite them if they refuse to shape up!
You know, Cloud, just between you and me...
I mean, who wouldn't? A giant robot!
I sometimes contemplate doing something wicked in the hopes I might get to see him up close!
Suffice it to say, I await your next exciting discovery with bated breath.
Well done! That concludes our thrilling analysis of the Corel summon crystals.
I can't tell you how grateful I am for everything you've helped me learn about Alexander! Thank you!
Though you have yet to obtain the requisite materia, as I recall.
You'll first need to confront the divine via the combat simulator!
Good news, Cloud. I've unearthed information about a particularly rare monster!

Deep in the forest lurks a fiend so fo─
Uh, pardon me.
So foul the mere mention of it induces nausea.
This noxious pest may be negatively impacting the biome. I suggest you expedite its removal.
And regarding your request from Kyrie...
this expedition might yield some materials you require for the bait.
One good deed could in turn help you carry out another. Isn't that great?
That malodorous monstrosity has been sent back to the jungle depths from whence it came.
That's a considerably rare material, Cloud. I suspect it will prove useful in crafting new creations.
I suggest you hold on to it.
With this, you should be able to craft the legendary bait Kyrie spoke of.
Those fiends befouling the beaches of Costa del Sol won't be able to resist it.
Head to the off-limits beach and take care of those monsters when you can.
I believe this is one of the materials required to craft Kyrie's legendary bait.
But to lure those monsters out of the water, you'll need to acquire the other one first.
Cloud! By analyzing the lifespring data...
I was able to locate an old republic transmuter chip.
It appears to be in the pass leading to the reactor.
The terrain you will need to traverse is littered with scrap metal and other such debris.
Upon analyzing the data from the lifespring, I was able to locate a new transmuter chip.
If my readings are correct, these mysterious structures predate even the republic!
That was a very impressive showing!
So impressive, in fact, that I was able to devise a new combat trial for you.
And I was in charge of calibrating its difficulty level! We put a lot of thought into this, so give it a try!
We've amassed a considerable amount of data on the fiends within the Gongaga region.
On Chadley's behalf, allow me to express my gratitude.
MAI, I must insist that you not put words in my mouth! Oh─but I am grateful, of course.
And to prove it, I have made a new combat trial so that you may test your might.
A fitting gift, I should think!
You have completed all battle assignments within the Gongaga region.
I've added a new trial to the simulator, which you may undertake at your leisure.
"At your leisure"? Cheeky, considering you're not risking life and limb.
Know that I am ever aware of the hazards you must face, Cloud.
I will endeavor to not only assist you, but ease the weight─
If MAI begins to grate, I'll gladly tweak her AI.
The divine sanctuaries of Gongaga hold knowledge of Kujata.
According to folklore, this fantastical being is the tutelary of the forest.
Thus, when disaster struck the mako reactor...
many believed it the result of Kujata's bestial wrath.
Legend holds that each time Kujata appears before humans, it takes on a different form.
It's been seen wreathed in raging flame, cloaked in chilling ice, and bathed in crackling lightning.
For this reason, the people of Gongaga have worshipped it as an embodiment of nature itself for generations.
As many local residents would attest...
Kujata can harness and wield the elements of fire, ice, and lightning.
Furthermore, it can strike down its foes with the combined might of all three.
A shocking, chilling, and burning attack!
That concludes our analysis of the Gongaga summon crystals. Thank you.
I suspect Kujata is quite pleased to have joined your cause!
Though you have yet to obtain the requisite materia, as I recall.
You'll first need to confront the divine via the combat simulator!
You're in luck, Cloud! I've uncovered the location of a dangerous fiend.
A vicious dragon seems to have awakened in the Cosmo Canyon region.
You must slay it ere the ferric earth is dyed an even darker red!
Excellent work out there, Cloud! Thanks to you, we have obtained invaluable intel.
The study of such ancient creatures will surely provide insight into the region's history.
...All you ever care about is your intel. It wouldn't kill you to show a little concern for Cloud's well-being, you know.
You aren't hurt, are you, Cloud?
Heh... You worry too much, MAI.
Rest assured that I always keep a close eye on him.
I can tell at a glance if he has suffered any injuries.
In fact, Cloud, I guarantee that I know more about your physical condition than you do!
Cloud! By analyzing the lifespring data...
I was able to locate an old republic transmuter chip.
First, look for a weathered old ship, then scour the surrounding area.
I trust you'll have no trouble finding this distinctive landmark.
Upon analyzing the data from the lifespring, I was able to locate a new transmuter chip.
It's buried in some nearby mountain ruins.
Currently, a survey of these ruins is in progress...
but we suspect they were built by the Ancients or others like them.
Perhaps you could conduct an investigation of your own while looking for the transmuter chip?
I knew you'd come through, Cloud.
After processing the intel you gathered and importing it into our simulator─
I designed a combat trial─just for you!
While it is true that you provided assistance, MAI, I am the one who created it.
At any rate, please give it a try.
Have this region's fiends proved a fitting challenge?
One glance at the data will tell you they are clearly no match for him.
If you haven't noticed, I'm trying to have a conversation with Cloud.
If you're in need of a challenge, know that another combat trial awaits you.
Very impressive work, Cloud. You've completed this region's combat assignments.
Such harsh environs as these are bound to engender fiends as brutal as their habitat.
They might've gotten the better of you, if not for my informative and entertaining guidance.
The data we've collected from the fiends you fought has helped us create a new combat trial.
I hope you'll find it useful.
There are sites here dedicated to a Bahamut variant.
A variant known as Bahamut Arisen.
With armored scales red as the canyon's soil, and an engine born of flesh mounted on its back...
its capacity for destruction far surpasses that of the original Bahamut.
According to one of the canyon's legends...
Bahamut once took shelter somewhere in these lands after being severely wounded in a fierce battle.
Its scarlet hue is said to represent the divine protection the earth bestowed upon it during the entity's long convalescence.
One local folktale goes like this:
Rejuvenated, the crimson wyrm gave forth a mighty roar.
Thus was the very land rent in twain, and the canyon born.
Truly a tale befitting a god of destruction, don't you think?
You have now analyzed all the summon crystals in the Cosmo Canyon region. Good work.
I must confess I have reservations about making Bahamut Arisen any stronger.
I cannot decide if this development is positive or terrifying.
Though you have yet to obtain the requisite materia, as I recall.
You'll first need to confront the divine via the combat simulator!
Good news, Cloud. That lifespring yielded information on a very rare fiend!
The king zu rules the skies of Nibel, and now we know where it roosts!
Seeing as this taloned terror has been causing trouble for the black robes, I suggest that you clip its wings.
Excellent work dethroning the king zu!
Attempting to prey upon you proved his undoing─and without that winged terror flying around, the skies are clear once more.
Those robed folks must be breathing a collective sigh of relief!
Cloud! By analyzing the lifespring data...
I was able to locate an old republic transmuter chip.
It should be on a nearby island.
Once they discovered mako in the area, Shinra established an offshore outpost.
Oh, but they've long since vacated the isle, so I doubt you'll run afoul of their forces.
Stellar performance, Cloud! I can't thank you enough for providing such valuable combat intel.
I'll use this data to further enhance my guidance functionality!
That would be a grave misuse of our resources.
In any case, I've utilized the data for a new challenge.
Feel free to access it via the combat simulator when you have the time!
Well done! You've completed all combat assignments in Nibel─no doubt thanks to my quality guidance.
Or in spite of your excessive chatter. I need to adjust the speech frequency setting...
No! Stop him, Cloud! He's trying to silence me!
Anyway, thanks to your hard work, Cloud, I was able to devise another combat trial.
I'm confident this one will pose quite a challenge.
It's been some time since you were last here, so let me refresh your memory.
A black-robed individual on this island is in possession of a protorelic.
You need only locate and secure it to see our Nibelheim investigation to its conclusion.
Slumbering within the Nibel sanctuaries is Odin, the patron knight of war and death.
He rides in from the land of the dead astride his steed, Sleipnir...
claiming the souls of fallen warriors as his own─or so the stories say.
Odin's Zantetsuken is capable of cleaving anything in two...
be it the fabric of creation or the time between the seconds.
not to compare swords, but his might trump yours.
It has been said that the land of the dead lies just beyond Mt. Nibel.
From this belief arises the conception of Odin as a gatekeeper of the afterlife...
one who turns away all whose time has not yet come.
I've managed to analyze all the crystals located in Nibel. Thank you for your help!
Odin will serve as a powerful ally, whisking your foes away to the land of the dead.
Though you have yet to obtain the requisite materia, as I recall.
You'll first need to confront the divine via the combat simulator!

Congratulations, Cloud.
You have attained the rank of Blood Squire.
As such, I have information that may be of interest.
A talented player by the name of Cameron is looking for opponents within the Crow's Nest.

I believe that you would find
him to be a suitable challenge.
Perhaps you ought to seek him out.

Congratulations, Cloud.
You have attained the rank of Blood Knight.
And I have obtained intel on a new opponent for you.
There is a somewhat mysterious player by the name of Navalan in North Corel.

Having proven yourself as a Knight,
I believe you can defeat this formidable foe.

Congratulations.
You have attained the rank of Blood Captain.
Wize─the AI you met on the ferry─has undergone a software update.
It presently resides in the Dustbowl.
I advise you to challenge it, and gauge its new and improved capabilities.
As such, allow me to brief you on another promising player.
An advanced Queen's Blood AI named Wize can be found in the Dustbowl.
I suspect it might prove a worthy opponent.

Congratulations, Cloud.
You have attained the rank of Blood Tactician.
I've received intel that Regina─the card game maven you met on the Shinra-8─is in Gongaga.
A clash between two players of your caliber would surely be one for the ages!

Congratulations, Cloud.
You have risen to the rank of Blood Marquis.
By the way, I recently received a letter addressed to you.
It read: "I'll be waiting for you at the hotel in the Gold Saucer. From, a friendly specter."
Are they inviting you to play Queen's Blood with them? I wonder.

Congratulations, Cloud.
You have attained the rank of Blood Sovereign.

This is it. Only one opponent remains:
"the monster of chaos."

I know nothing of their skills,
but I have faith that yours are superior.

Vanquish this fiend and
the witch's card will be yours!
I see you've successfully obtained the Emerald Witch.

I noticed the card was radiating energy,
which I took the liberty of analyzing.
It revealed the location of the queen.
Evidently, she resides within some ruins in the Gongaga region.
The climax of this saga is nigh.

And only you, the Blood Executioner,
can bring it to a close.
Dangerous fiend detected in your vicinity. Please ensure you are prepared before engaging.
...My sensors are picking up some understandable confusion.
It's a pleasure to meet you, Cloud.
I am your personal Monster Assessment Instrument. But since that's a mouthful, you can call me "MAI"!
Chadley programmed me to assist you by providing detailed analyses of the fiends you encounter.
I hope I can be of service to you in the many battles ahead!
With that out of the way... I'm picking up unusual fiend activity nearby.
To procure the biological data that we require, you'll need to complete specific objectives during combat.
But don't worry, because I'll be here to help you succeed. Good luck!
With that out of the way... You've entered the territory of a unique fiend.
However, it appears to be in hiding.
Before seeking to instigate a confrontation, I recommend taking a moment to ensure that you're prepared.
I will do everything in my power to help you succeed. Good luck!
Dangerous fiend detected in the vicinity. Please ensure that you are well prepared, everyone!
My sensors indicate a unique fiend is nearby. Time to survey the area!
Be on your guard, everyone. I'm picking up a monstrous signal.
Currently gathering combat data on target...
I know you can do this!
Just know I'm cheering for you!
No fiend can stand against you!
Wow. I almost feel sorry for them...
Oh no! What do I do!?
Just take a deep breath! You can do it!
You can still turn this around!
Congratulations! You managed to complete all intel objectives!
All objectives completed. We've accrued a lot of great data─thanks to you!
Battle objectives completed. I knew you had it in you! Way to go!
Excellent work completing our combat objectives! Though I suspect it wasn't much of a challenge.
Well fought! Though perhaps you could polish off those objectives next time?
Threat eliminated! Next time, see if you can clear all the objectives too!
Though it was quite the victory, you were unable to complete all the objectives. Might you try again?
While that was glorious, I can't give you full marks. Objectives yet remain!
I see you haven't completed your objectives for that battle... Well, you're always welcome to make another attempt!
Data collection complete. Most expertly done, everyone! You made that look like child's play!
That was a smashing victory! Thanks to you, we've obtained some eye-opening data!
Wonderful work! I trust my guidance was crucial to your success?
What fascinating data this is! I'm certain Chadley will be over the moon!
Cloud! You have arrived in the lair of the majestic quetzalcoatl.
Make certain you're prepared before attempting to challenge it!
A cross between a dragon and a bird, the solitary quetzalcoatl is simply breathtaking.
Indeed, it's little wonder that the ancient peoples of this region revered it as a god.
While the creature typically prefers to keep to its hunting grounds and nest, it's been sighted near agrarian communities in recent years.
Mako's deleterious effects on its habitat have likely driven it to prey on livestock.
Gaining more intel on it may help us discover a way in which we can coexist once more.
The grasslands' ecosystem is in your hands!
The pungent odor that these fiends release when threatened is so effective at driving away predators that their population has exploded.
This particular variant is extremely dangerous, capable of spitting toxic fluids on its prey before attacking en masse.
Such tactics allow them to hunt creatures as large as elphadunks.
Imagine something like that creeping into every corner it can find, and you'll understand why they're considered such a menace.
With any luck, the data we collect here will aid us in finding a way to reduce their numbers.
The docile disposition of the elphadunk led to its widespread adoption as a beast of burden. Applications included agriculture, transportation, and even warfare.
Variants like these, however, were valued as a source of hides and tusks used for arts and crafts.
Unfortunately, they are a notoriously difficult creature to raise in captivity, and were usurped by the now-ubiquitous chocobo.
At present, the only remaining wild elphadunks can be found here in the grasslands.
Which is why we must study them thoroughly, before they become a threat to both animals and humans.
The ever-vigilant mu possesses an incredible memory, meaning that once you've trespassed on its territory, it can and will track you down in order to exact revenge.
The mu have a massive underground network through which they exchange information on food sources and predators. Frankly, it rivals Chadley's own network!
So don't you be deceived by their adorably twitchy tails and unassuming demeanor!
Further analysis of these crafty creatures will no doubt shed light on their communication methods─and maybe help us to improve ours as well!
It may look like nothing more than a wriggling plant, but don't be fooled!
Mandragora roots are capable of functioning as legs, allowing them to actively pursue sunlit locations as they shift throughout the day.
In case you didn't know, chocobos seem to adore feasting on the fiend's seeds. I can't help but wonder what this variant's might taste like.
Further research may prove beneficial to any chocobo-raising activities.
So for the sake of your feathered friends, mow those mandragoras down!
These impressive legs not only allow it to run down prey in the blink of an eye, but also hurl rocks with tremendous force.
And if that doesn't scare you, this variant is capable of spewing a toxin that transforms its quarry into a frog─its favorite snack!
Whether this qualifies it as a true gourmet or merely a picky eater is still a matter of contention.
Whatever the case may be, further research could help us to understand how its diet sustains its physique.
So get in there and give it a good beating! Without being KO'd, of course.
See the way that its mane stands on end?
The electricity coursing through its body and keeping its hair upright is the product of overexposure to mako.
This has also contributed to a significant increase in aggression, agility, and speed.
In fact, eyewitnesses report that it is capable of catching prey with lightning quickness.
By studying this predator's hunting habits, perhaps we too will be able to develop swifter, more efficient ways of felling fiends!
Now hurry and collect our data, before that nimble wolf gets the best of you!
Beware, Cloud. You've entered the mindflayer's natural habitat.
There's still much we don't know about this creature, so make sure you're well prepared before proceeding!
There are several theories as to the mindflayer's origin.
One posits that it's the mutated form of a scholar who devoured fiends' brains as part of an experiment. He supposedly ate so many, he became a fiend himself.
The mindflayer's affinity for magic─and its preference for consuming the brains of its victims─lends some credence to this assertion.
Please, eliminate this fiend at once! Not only for the sake of the Junon region, but for this poor AI's peace of mind!
During this time of year, tonadus migrate to the Junon region to seek out mates.
They build their nests far from civilization and raise their young in pairs. In terms of duties, it often falls to the males to search for food.
Unfortunately, when food is scarce, they may occasionally venture into towns and cities, where they have been known to attack humans.
As Shinra's activities continue to disrupt the ecosystem, such attacks will only grow more frequent.
On that note, please take care not to become a snack during your investigation.
Zemzeletts are known as the "sages of the skies," not only because of their intelligence, but also their remarkable feathers that make them both elegant and lethal.
These feathers have been prized by all manner of craftsmen since antiquity for their beauty and resilience.
Arrows fashioned from them are particularly valuable. They're said to slice through the air so quickly, they're capable of piercing even solid stone.
Oh, but take care not to be so entranced by their abilities that you lose focus!
As their size puts them at the lower end of the food chain, they're exceptionally skittish creatures.
In addition, they can actively regulate their body temperature, thus allowing them to emit heat as a defense against predators.
There are theories that these fiery displays may also be employed in mating rituals.
After all, nature is said to be a "survival of the fittest."
May we too pursue our objective with a passion that burns as bright as the ignilisk's scales.
Fleetwings are also known as "stalkers of the skies."
When hunting, they descend so rapidly that their unsuspecting prey has no time to react, let alone fight back.
To that end, barbecuing within their territory is not advisable...unless you want your food to vanish before your very eyes.
As it happens, fleetwings are so perfectly adapted to life in the skies that their anatomy has inspired several aeronautical designs.
Continued research into this aerodynamic wonder will surely pave the way for humanity's flight-filled future.
You'll be soaring through the clouds before you know it!
Cloud! It appears that you've arrived at the lair of the Tonberry King.
That crown belongs on a far statelier head than his─namely yours!
I'd say it's high time we divest him of it!
In times now long past, this continent was home to the kingdom of the tonberries─a realm once bright with promise.
But it would not last. The humans came─and brought with them death and destruction.
Many tonberries perished in the war.
To revenge himself upon those who razed his kingdom, the Tonberry King swore upon his knife to hunt their descendants.
Please bear in mind that this is all based on fables and folklore.
As the accounts are both ancient and apocryphal, who can say what's really true?
Though this much is for certain─that hat of his would make anyone feel like royalty.
Heavy is the head that wears the crown, but I'd say your neck is more than up to the task!
The shoalopod's tentacles are considered a delicacy by many.
True gourmands, however, hold that the flavor of these variants is a cut above their more ubiquitous brethren.
Unfortunately, this palatability has made them the preferred prey of many predators. To deter such threats, they've evolved a rock-hard exoskeleton replete with spikes.
Certainly would make me think twice.
Is the taste worth the risks their shells pose? There's only one way to find out!
Terpsicolts, whose males carry their eggs to term, are symbols of both familial bliss and fertility.
In fact, it was customary for ancient peoples of this region to present their household leaders with terpsicolt spines.
Those of this variant are so beautiful and sought-after that their value rivals that of precious gems.
Their dazzling coloration is likely due to the nutrient-rich food found in this area.
...Imagine being gifted something so gorgeous. I know I would certainly be over the moon...
Anyway, good luck, Cloud! And make sure not to damage those spines─for my sake!
Look closely. What appears to be a beak at first blush is, in fact, a sharp, helix-shaped bone protruding from the forehead.
It's not for show. While most predatory birds use their talons to hunt, the spearhawk uses its horn.
With one clean thrust, they can skewer their quarry, then slice and dice it with ease.
Careful now. We don't want that beautiful face of yours to be poked full of holes!
Their eyes having long since atrophied, these creatures rely on their sense of smell to hunt.
Their digestive system has also deteriorated, forcing them to ingest rocks to break down food and absorb nutrients.
Referred to as "the undertakers of the desert," these fiends subsist almost exclusively on carrion.
Extreme hunger, however, can drive them to attack living prey.
The Gold Saucer has led to a steady increase in foot traffic...and, as you might imagine, a corresponding increase in landworm-related deaths.
To protect these travelers, we must understand what makes this variant tick!
The dune-dwelling sandspitter subsists on a diet of desert insects, which it ingests along with a heaping helping of grit and rock.
Note that it doesn't immediately regurgitate this excess. The creature holds it in reserve as a weapon to fell more prey.
