Save your progress by going to the main menu and selecting
Save / Load → Save.

Autosave
Your progress is automatically saved at every break in the story.

Shortcut
Go to the main menu and press .

Warning!
Do not turn off power to your device while saving data, as it may cause the data to be corrupted.

Attack Power
Value that determines physical damage dealt with blades, guns, fists, and claws. Modified by weapon and strength values.

Magic Attack Power
Value that determines magic damage dealt with spells and abilities. Modified by weapon and magic values.

Defense
Value that determines physical damage resisted. Modified by armor and vitality values.

Magic Defense
Value that determines magic damage resisted. Modified by armor and spirit values.

Strength
The higher the value, the stronger your attack power.

Magic
The higher the value, the stronger your magic attack power.

Vitality
The higher the value, the stronger your defense.

Spirit
The higher the value, the stronger your magic defense.

Luck
The higher the value, the better your chances of dealing a critical hit or successfully stealing from enemies.

Speed
The higher the value, the faster your ATB gauge charges.

Critical Hit Rate
The chance of dealing a critical hit.

Critical Hit Damage
The damage increase when dealing a critical hit.

ATB Charge Bonus
Increases ATB gauge accumulation when performing basic attacks and other actions.

Max Limit Level
The highest available limit break level.
You can use abilities in battle by equipping weapons or setting command materia.

Weapon Abilities
Each weapon has a distinct ability that can be used when equipped. For example, when Cloud equips the buster sword, he gains access to the Focused Thrust ability.

Once you reach maximum proficiency in a weapon ability, you can use that ability without needing to wield its weapon.

Materia Abilities
Setting command materia lets you use those commands in battle.

For example, setting the Assess materia allows you to use Assess, a command that helps identify enemy weaknesses and other useful information.

ATB Gauge
The ATB gauge fills as time passes, as you attack enemies, or as you successfully block attacks.

When all charges are filled, use them to unleash a powerful ability, or save one for recovery when your HP gets low.

The gauge normally has a maximum of two charges, but United Refocus can increase that number to three, allowing for even more devastating attacks.

Types of Abilities
: Launches the character into the air to strike airborne foes.
: Can be used while airborne.
: Grants the character synergy.

Types of Synergy Ability Buffs
: Increases damage to staggered foes and extends stagger duration.
: Increases limit break levels.
: Grants unlimited MP.
: Adds an additional third ATB charge.
The ATB Gauge and Battle Commands

Many spells and abilities are infused with the four main elements: Fire with fire, Blizzard with ice, Thunder with lightning, and Aero with wind.

Some enemies are weak against certain elements, so unleashing attacks infused with those elements will allow you to deal massive damage.
To change your party leader, go to the <color=orange>Combat Settings</color> section of the main menu, then select a character and press <button=triangle> to designate them as the new leader.

Spells and items can be used to apply beneficial status effects to party members.

Bravery: Increases attack power
Faith: Increases magic attack power
Protect: Increases defense
Shell: Increases magic defense
Barrier: Reduces physical damage taken
Manaward: Reduces magic damage taken
Shield: Nullifies physical damage taken
Reflect: Reflects magic spells
Haste: Quickens the rate at which the ATB gauge fills
Resist: Prevents detrimental status effects
Regen: Gradually restores HP
Auto-Life: Revives target from incapacitation once during battle

You can view a list of these effects and their icons during battle by pressing and then .
The moogle's HP gauge is displayed next to Cait Sith's.

If a battle looks hopeless, fleeing is an option. Run in the opposite direction until the enemy stops giving chase.

When you are about to escape a battle, the word "Fleeing" will display. Note that you cannot flee from certain battles.
Set magic materia in your weapon or armor to gain access to spells. Casting spells consumes an ATB charge as well as MP (magic points).

Offensive Spells
Some spells are infused with elements such as fire, ice, lightning, and wind, and are useful for attacking enemies from a distance. The spell Fire, for example, launches a fiery burst at the target.

Remedial Spells
Spells such as Cure and Esuna can be used to restore HP and cure detrimental status effects.

Support Spells
Some spells are used to strengthen your party and debilitate your enemy. Haste helps charge your ATB gauge faster, Slow decreases the rate at which an enemy's ATB gauge charges, and Barrier helps protect against physical damage.

Each character has unique abilities that can be unleashed by pressing . While there is no ATB cost, some abilities require time to execute.

Unique Abilities
Cloud: Punisher and Operator modes
Barret: Overcharge
Tifa: Whirling Uppercut, Rise and Fall, and Omnistrike
Aerith: Ward Shift
Red XIII: Vengeance Mode

Ally Shortcuts
To enable the use of shortcuts in battle, you must first open the main menu, select System > Options > Gameplay > Issuing Commands, and change the setting to Command Shortcuts.

To activate them on a controller, hold or and press the button that corresponds to the desired shortcut.

On mouse and keyboard, each input corresponds to a single shortcut for a specific ally, as follows:
Ally 1
, , , or

Ally 2
, , , or

Enemies can inflict detrimental status effects with spells and abilities. Use items such as antidotes or spells such as Esuna before it's too late.

Poison: Gradually saps HP
Silence: Unable to cast spells
Sleep: Unable to act
Slow: Decreases the rate at which the ATB gauge fills
Stop: Unable to act (remove with Esuna)
Stun: Unable to act (remove with Esuna)
Toad: Greatly lowers battle capabilities
Debrave: Reduces attack power
Defaith: Reduces magic attack power
Petrify: Slowly turn to stone (KO'd when fully petrified)
Berserk: Increases damage dealt and received
Fury: Quickens limit break gauge charge, but become more vulnerable to damage
Sedate: Become less vulnerable to damage, but slows limit break gauge charge

Detrimental status effects disappear over time or when the battle ends.

You can view a list of these effects and their icons during battle by pressing and then .
You can use items such as potions and grenades. Items can be purchased from shops, found in chests, or transmuted from materials.

Restorative Items
HP-restoring items such as potions and MP-restoring items such as bottles of ether are useful in battle.

Battle Items
Items such as grenades deal damage to multiple enemies at once. These items are useful for when your MP is low, or in situations where you cannot use magic.
Accessories have various effects such as preventing Poison or Sleep, or being in a constant state of Berserk. Some even revive you from incapacitation.
Note that you can change the accessories of characters that are <color=orange>currently absent</color> from your party.

Armor boosts defense and magic defense. The higher the armor grade, the better its stats.

Take note of the armor's type.
Bangles are effective against physical attacks, while bracelets and armbands offer protection from magic attacks. Bracers strike a balance between defense and magic defense, and armlets are outfitted with more materia slots.
Note that you can change the armor of characters that are <color=orange>currently absent</color> from your party.

Manuscripts provide characters with extra skill points (SP). These unique items can be earned from odd jobs or purchased at moogle emporiums.

Note that each character has their own manuscript:
Cloud: The Art of Swordplay
Barret: Sharpshooter's Companion
Tifa: Way of the Fist
Aerith: Telluric Scriptures
Red XIII: Tale of the Red Warrior
etc.

Toggle the <color=orange>auto-upgrade function</color> to automatically allocate weapon skills as you acquire them. Three settings are available: prioritize offense, prioritize defense, or strike a balance between the two.

When equipped, weapons boost attack power and magic attack power. They also allow the use of weapon abilities, unique combat skills tied to each weapon.

New weapons can be obtained from treasure chests or purchased from vendors. Be sure to explore thoroughly and check shops frequently.

Use a weapon ability repeatedly to become more proficient with it. Max out your proficiency to learn said ability, allowing use of it even when you do not have its corresponding weapon equipped.

Meeting a weapon ability's proficiency bonus requirements will allow you to learn it more quickly. These requirements are displayed under Ability Info when you select the weapon on the Materia & Equipment menu.
Progress through the story and complete certain odd jobs to connect the regions of the world, allowing for more convenient fast-travel.
Breakable objects often contain <color=orange>moogle medals</color> or <color=orange>transmutation materials</color>.

You can check the locations of objectives with the tracker or minimap.

From the main menu, select System → Options → Gameplay → World Navigation Display to choose from Tracker, Minimap, or None.
The <color=yellow>tracker</color> shows the direction of the objective's location.
The <color=yellow>minimap</color> shows a chart of the area as well as the objective's location.

Press to open the map and get your bearings.

While story markers () will be automatically added to the map, you can place your own destination marker pins () by pressing .

There are also markers for quests () and discoveries (), which are optional adventures that do not affect the main scenario. At certain points in the story, discovery objectives may become temporarily inaccessible.
Open the map with <button=map-menu> and access <color=orange>Story</color> to check your progress, revisit past events, or glean hints on how to proceed.

Use to open chests or doors, talk to people, or switch on various machinery.

Situations in which the word "Hold" displays require a longer input.

Setting command materia allows you to use a variety of abilities.

・Steal: Take items from the enemy.
・Assess: View enemy information.

Setting magic materia allows you to use both offensive and defensive spells.

・Fire: Grants access to fire-based spells such as Fire.
・Ice: Grants access to ice-based spells such as Blizzard.
・Poison: Grants access to poison spells such as Bio.
・Healing: Grants access to restorative spells such as Cure.
・Barrier: Grants access to defensive spells such as Barrier.

Setting complete materia grants positive effects even when not paired with other materia. For example:

・HP Up: Increases maximum HP.
・Magic Up: Increases magic.
・Gil Up: Increases gil looted from enemies.

While in the Materia & Equipment section of the main menu, press to set materia into your equipment.
Setting materia grants access to new spells and abilities, or boosts basic stats like HP. Elemental materia imbues weapons with elemental damage and armor with elemental resistances.

Press to set materia for your whole party at once.

Setting summoning materia allows you to invoke summons in battle. These materia, which can only be set into weapons, also boost your stats.

Some summoning materia will grow more powerful as you visit their summons' respective sanctuaries and analyze the crystals therein.

Note that summons can only be invoked during certain battles.

Setting support materia allows you to enhance the materia with which they are linked.

・Elemental: Adds the element of the linked materia to your equipment.
・Magnify: Increases the range of spells.

Magnifying spells decreases their potency. Use to toggle between multi- and single-target spells.

When using magic, use or to adjust the potency of the spell you cast.

Some folio abilities will grant access to elemental attacks that cost no MP but deal reduced damage. They will also provide access to more powerful α-versions of your regular elemental spells, expanding your arsenal even further.

Queen's Blood is a card game where each player takes turns placing a card in one of the three horizontal "lanes."

Within these lanes, players may place cards on a tile that is both highlighted yellow and adorned with a pawn that matches their color.

Once a card is placed, its power is added to that player's lane total. Furthermore, the player will be able to place cards in new positions on the board.

The yellow number in the top-right corner of a card is its power, while the positions a card will open up are indicated by the yellow squares in the graphic at the bottom.

Card Anatomy

Top-Left Pawn Icon: The card's rank. The more pawns, the higher the rank. Cards can only be placed in positions of ranks equal to or higher than their own.

Top-Right Number: The card's power, which contributes to your score should you win the lane.

Bottom-Middle Diagram: Position and ability markers. The yellow squares are the positions a card will open up on the board, and the red boxes are tiles its ability will affect.

: Denotes that a card has an ability.

When one of your cards' position tiles overlaps with a position you control, the position rises in rank.

Cards can only be played on positions equal to or higher than their rank. Thus, in order to play more powerful cards, you will have to raise the rank of your positions.

You can tell a position's rank by the number of pawns on it, and a card's rank by the number of pawns in its top-left corner.

When one of your cards' positions overlaps with one of your opponent's, you claim that position as yours.

Note, however, that claiming a position will not raise its rank.

You can keep track of who is winning a lane by looking at the point totals on each side of the board. The numbers on the left represent your power, while ones on the right represent your opponent's.

You may notice that some cards have tiles with red borders. These are the tiles that are affected by the card's ability. Place cards effectively to make the most of their abilities and amass more power in more lanes than your opponent.

In the event you cannot place a card, you can pass with . When both players pass consecutively, the game will end.

Once the game is over, each player's score is tabulated. Only the player with the higher power in a lane has their power added to their score.

In other words, no matter how high your power in a lane may be, if it is less than your opponent's power in the same lane, it will not count toward your score.

After calculating the winner for each lane and adding their lane scores up, the player with the higher total score wins.

There are many other players (denoted by the icon) all around the world just waiting to play against you. Should you challenge one and win, they will likely give you a new card for your collection.

Ranks aren't only for positions and cards, however; you as a player have a rank as well. The higher your rank, the stronger the opponents you can challenge. Should you wish to rise in rank, you will first have to defeat especially formidable foes called "Keepers of the Cruor."

Enhancement abilities raise the power of cards on the board and consist of two types: ones that activate when placed, and ones that remain active while their card is on the board.

As cards with abilities can drastically alter the course of the game, when you play one, make sure to take into account not only what other cards are placed on what tiles, but also whether or not you can get more out of the card if you wait to play it.

Enfeeblement abilities do the opposite of enhancement ones; they lower the power of cards on the board.

When a card's power is reduced to zero, it is destroyed and the position it was occupying becomes empty again. Some cards have abilities that activate when they are destroyed or when they are enfeebled, so it sometimes benefits you to use enfeeblement abilities on your own cards rather than your opponent's.

These cards can only be placed on top of an ally card already on the board, effectively "replacing" them.

Replacement cards have two major benefits:
1) They do not require a rank to place them.
2) They can trigger cards whose abilities only activate when destroyed.

Some even have abilities that absorb the destroyed card's power.

Replacement cards are strong enough to turn the tide of battle if used correctly, so think long and hard about when and where you will play them.

Fort Condor is a board game come to life, in which Cloud, Tifa, and Barret must lead the Condor Cavalry to victory over the attacking Shinra forces.

Formulate a plan of attack and decide which hero units to deploy before engaging the enemy.

Information regarding enemies you've encountered can be found in Enemy Intel. Use Assess during battle to find out more about your foes.

During battle, press to check the intel.
<color=orange>Beast Battleground</color> in the Dustbowl offers a range of challenges, from team trials to solo bouts.

Each region is home to its own unique breed of chocobo. Follow a given bird's tracks to find where it roosts, and then wrangle it.

Once wrangled, you can call the chocobo to your side at any time while exploring the world.

Steer
/ Dash (press again to Sprint)
Jump

Protorelics are artifacts of unknown origin that emit a unique energy signal. Chadley is keen to discover their mysteries. Be warned, however: they seem to alter space-time, and are known to cause strange phenomena to occur.

These relics are hidden throughout the world─but with the aid of activated remnawave towers, Chadley should be able to point you in their direction.
Purchase FINAL FANTASY VII REBIRTH from PlayStation™Store.

Press to attack with Cloud's sword. Holding the button will allow you to follow up with a sweeping slash.

Press the button after dodging to launch a ranged attack, or hold the button to unleash an aerial combo.

Press to open the commands menu.

From there, you can expend ATB charges to activate abilities, cast spells, or use items.

The ATB gauge will gradually fill as time passes, as well as whenever you attack foes with .

Press to block incoming attacks, or press to move out of harm's way.

Successfully blocking an attack will reduce the amount of damage taken and fill your ATB gauge.

Block with perfect timing to render the attack ineffective.
Press <button=target-lock> to lock onto a specific enemy. Use <button=RS> to switch targets, or press <button=target-lock> to disengage.

Press to activate a character's unique ability.

Cloud, for example, can switch modes while fighting, alternating between the balanced Operator Mode and the offense-oriented Punisher Mode.

In Punisher Mode, Cloud moves more slowly, but can unleash a more powerful attack than usual.

In addition, Cloud launches a counterblow every time he guards against an enemy's melee attack.

He cannot, however, guard against ranged attacks or magic. When you evade such attacks, you will switch back to Operator Mode.

Switching to a different character can provide an advantage in battle.
Alternatively, you can order your allies to attack while controlling the same character.

Use or to switch characters.
Use or to issue commands to allies.

Note that you can also switch characters while guarding.

Press to slash with the Masamune, or hold to unleash a ranged attack.

Landing a certain number of attacks will allow you to perform branching finishers like Pierce or Sword Dance with , filling your limit gauge.

Press to enter Retaliation Stance. While in this stance, press at the right time to parry an incoming attack.

Inflicting enough damage or exploiting an elemental weakness will place the enemy in a pressured state, making it easier for you to fill the stagger gauge below its HP bar.

Once the gauge is full, the enemy will become momentarily staggered, leaving it defenseless.

Use the Assess ability on an enemy to discover its vulnerabilities.

Enemies that have been staggered are left defenseless and take more damage.

Striking staggered foes with unique abilities will quickly fill your ATB gauge, allowing you to unleash devastating skills to finish off your opponent.

Taking damage and staggering enemies fills your limit gauge.

When the gauge is full, you can use limit breaks, which are extremely powerful attacks.

You do not need to spend ATB charges to use these attacks.

Some enemies will occasionally bind your party members with unblockable attacks.

If your character is bound and unable to act, quickly switch to a different character with or .
The game will end when all party members' HP reaches 0. Be sure to use potions and healing spells to regenerate HP before it is too late.

When the combat style is set to Classic, the player-controlled character will engage enemies in battle automatically─attacking, defending, and evading as appropriate.

With this mode active, you can simply wait until your ATB gauge has filled and press to execute commands and dictate the flow of combat.

Note that you can always control the player-controlled character.

When an enemy is about to use an attack that cannot be guarded against, the symbol will appear.

Take evasive action when that mark displays next to an opponent's skill name.

When in the throes of battle, the entity slumbering within an equipped summoning materia may begin to stir, prompting the summon gauge to appear.

When this gauge has completely filled, you can call upon this deiform entity for assistance.

Summons fight alongside you for a brief period, and their remaining time is indicated by their gradually decreasing gauge.

These beings have a will of their own and engage the enemy as they see fit. However, you can command them to unleash unique attacks by expending your party members' ATB charges.

When the summon gauge is completely depleted, a summon will execute a devastating ultimate attack before it departs.

Pressing one of the four action buttons while guarding with will execute a synergy skill.

Each of these skills functions differently, and may require you to hold down the corresponding button or tap it in quick succession. Pressing while guarding will provide information on these skills.

If you are using a mouse and keyboard instead of a controller, you can activate these skills by simply pressing , , , or .

These commands do not consume ATB, but rather help fill party members' ATB gauges. Furthermore, performing synergy skills for the first time with Cloud will improve his relationship with his teammate.

Utilizing ATB commands marked with will grant characters synergy. When two characters share enough synergy, you can activate their synergy abilities.

These abilities not only deal tremendous damage, they also apply unique buffs, such as increasing limit break levels , granting unlimited MP , or extending the duration enemies are staggered .

Note that repeated use of a synergy ability will increase the amount of synergy required to activate it.
Use Assess on an enemy to reveal its elemental weaknesses, as well as effective strategies to use against it, then exploit those to pressure and ultimately stagger your foe.

Barret specializes in ranged attacks, allowing him to strike enemies that Cloud cannot reach with his sword.

Holding down releases a sustained burst of automatic fire.

Pressing will unleash his powerful Overcharge ability, greatly filling his ATB gauge. Press again to charge the depleted gauge.

Pressing after using an ability or a standard attack will greatly fill the Overcharge gauge.

Tifa excels at close-range combat and uses quick combos to deal damage.

Press to execute a normal attack, or hold it down to deliver a single powerful blow.

Unbridled Strength can be used to temporarily enhance her unique ability up to three times, as well as increase the number of attacks that can be chained together.

Use on staggered foes to increase the damage multiplier.

Aerith is adept at long-range magic attacks.

Press to unleash magic attacks capable of hitting multiple targets.

Hold down to charge the Tempest skill. Striking an enemy with this skill fully charged will summon a Fleeting Familiar to assist you in combat.

Press to instantaneously warp between any magic wards Aerith has conjured.

Red XIII can deftly take down enemies with his razor-sharp claws and fangs.

Press to swipe at foes, or hold it down to unleash a whirling slash.

Successfully guarding against attacks fills the Vengeance Gauge, which can be consumed with to enter Vengeance Mode, increasing Red XIII's attack power and dodge speed.

Vengeance Mode can be activated at any time, but it will last longer according to how full the gauge is.

Yuffie specializes in both close and ranged combat with her throwing star and ninja skills.

Press to strike a foe with her throwing star. Hold it down to continue attacking while putting distance between her and the enemy.

Use to launch her throwing star at an enemy. While it is launched, press to activate Yuffie's ninjutsu. Change the elemental affinity of this ranged attack with her Elemental Ninjutsu ability.

The throwing star will return automatically after a certain amount of time, but can be retrieved earlier by pressing again, or holding .

Cait Sith fights with a megaphone and his trusty moogle mount. Press to attack, or summon his moogle with the Let's Ride! ability, which will unlock more of Cait Sith's ATB commands.

As the moogle attacks, its meter will steadily fill. Press the button to deplete the meter and activate Moogle Abilities like Fight! or Defense!

While astride the moogle, hold down to attack alongside your fuzzy pal. Press to dismount, and to remount.

The moogle will withdraw from the fight once its HP reaches 0, but can be summoned again at will.

Sephiroth is the current party leader, meaning you will control him at the start of combat.

To change your party leader, go to the Combat Settings section of the main menu, then select a character and press to designate them as the new leader.
Certain enemies may have individual body parts that you can target and attack. Destroying these discrete parts can pressure your foe or prevent it from unleashing powerful abilities.

Turn the tables on the beast of the mountain with a coordinated attack from Cloud and Sephiroth.

Use their Double Helix synergy ability from the commands menu to bring the materia guardian crashing down to the cave floor.

Your materia has improved enough that a more potent spell is available. For example, in the case of the Fire spell, the potency increases from Fire to Fira and finally to the most powerful Firaga.

To access the more powerful spells, press with the command selected.

Remember that more powerful magic consumes more MP.

While guarding with , you can team up with allies to perform a variety of synergy skills, useful abilities that do not consume ATB charges.

The available skills differ depending on which character is being actively controlled.

Press while guarding to view descriptions of these skills.

If you are using a mouse and keyboard instead of a controller, you can activate these skills by simply pressing , , , or .

As Aerith absorbs the lifestream, she will begin combat with the following beneficial status effects:

Stage 1: Faith
Stage 2: Faith, Regen
Stage 3: Faith, Regen, Manawall

You have been petrified. Taking a certain amount of damage while in this state will turn you to stone, rendering you incapacitated.

Avoid damage until the status wears off, or cure the ailment with Esuna, remedies, or other spells or items with similar effects.
Detrimental Status Effects: Petrify and Stone

Press to slash with the buster sword. Hold the button to launch enemies into the air or bring them crashing down.

Charge up power with to enhance the Chain Slash and Meteor Shots abilities up to Level III. Press after attacking to perform a more effective Quick Charge.

Participate in the combat simulator's training exercises to learn not only the ins and outs of battle, but also how best to utilize each party member.

More such exercises will become available as new allies join your team.

Note that some of these simulations will allow you to use abilities you may not have learned yet.

When your current party members are in dire straits, you can call upon your other comrades to execute a synergy ability once per battle.

Open the commands menu with and press Backline Command to select an ability.

Certain synergy abilities can raise a character's limit level, which will in turn unlock more powerful limit break attacks.

For example, Cloud can perform Cross-Slash at limit level 1 and Ascension at level 2.

You can also unlock level 3 limit break attacks through your characters' folios.

You have been turned into a toad, greatly reducing your combat capabilities.

In this state, you can only use standard attacks, the HP-restoring Bubble Breath, and the Leapfrog ability.

To remove the status effect, either use the Esuna spell or items such as maiden's kisses or remedies.

Press to attack an enemy, dealing damage and filling the ATB gauge.

Press to block incoming attacks, or use to move out of harm's way.

Successfully blocking an attack will reduce the amount of damage taken and fill your ATB gauge.

Block with perfect timing to render the attack ineffective.
Battle Basics: Attacking, Guarding, and Evading

Your ATB gauge will gradually fill over time, but landing attacks will make it fill faster. You can store up to two ATB charges.

Press to open the commands menu and expend ATB charges to activate abilities, cast spells, or use items.

Opening the commands menu will activate Tactical Mode, slowing down time and allowing you to choose commands at your leisure.
Battle Basics: ATB Gauge and Commands

Quickly use the spell or ability set to a shortcut by pressing its corresponding input, which varies slightly depending on whether you are using a controller or mouse and keyboard.

Controller
Hold , then press , , , or .

Mouse & Keyboard
Press , , , or .
allows you to view what spell or ability is set to each shortcut.

Shortcuts can be set in the Combat Settings section of the main menu.

Press <button=target-lock> to lock onto a specific target, such as airborne enemies or those difficult to draw a bead on due to their speed. Use <button=RS> to switch targets, or press <button=target-lock> to disengage.

Inflicting enough damage or exploiting an elemental weakness will place the enemy in a pressured state.

When this happens, pelt them with magic and abilities to quickly fill the stagger gauge, which is located under their life bar.

To discover an enemy's weaknesses, use Assess.
Certain abilities─such as Cloud's Focused Thrust, Barret's Focused Shot, and Tifa's Focused Strike─can <color=orange>quickly fill the stagger gauge</color>, especially when used on a pressured foe.

Filling the stagger gauge will immobilize your foe momentarily, leaving them defenseless and more susceptible to damage.

Use unique abilities on staggered enemies to quickly fill your ATB gauge. Once you have the ATB charges you need, unleash devastating attacks to finish them off.

Switching to a different character will sometimes provide an advantage in battle.
Alternatively, you can continue controlling the same character while ordering your allies to attack.

Press or to switch characters.
Press or to issue commands to allies.
Note that you can switch characters even while guarding.

To change who you control at the start of combat, go to the Combat Settings in the main menu, select a character, and press to designate them as the party leader.

Press to attack with Cloud's sword. Holding the button will allow you to follow up with a sweeping slash.

Press the button after dodging to launch a ranged attack, or hold the button to unleash an aerial combo.

Cloud's unique ability is switching modes while fighting, alternating between the balanced Operator Mode and the offense-oriented Punisher Mode.

He will always begin battle in Operator Mode.

Try weakening the enemy with Operator Mode, then quickly finishing them off with Punisher Mode.

In Punisher Mode, Cloud moves more slowly, but can unleash a more powerful attack than usual.

In addition, Cloud will launch a counterstrike every time he guards against an enemy's melee attack.

He cannot, however, guard against ranged attacks or magic. When you evade such attacks, you will switch back to Operator Mode.

Cloud's initial abilities are Braver and Triple Slash.

With Braver, Cloud can deliver a heavy swing of his blade, which becomes even more potent while airborne─a perfect finisher for a staggered foe.

Triple Slash allows Cloud to deliver three consecutive strikes on multiple foes, even airborne ones, and grows more potent the more enemies he hits.

Barret specializes in ranged attacks, allowing him to strike enemies that Cloud cannot reach with his sword.

Press to shoot, or hold the button down to release a sustained burst of automatic fire.

Lock onto a distant foe with to blast them from a safe distance.

Pressing will unleash Barret's powerful Overcharge ability, dealing massive damage and greatly filling his ATB gauge.

Once used, it will need some time to recharge before it can be unleashed again.

Press again while it is recharging to fill the Overcharge gauge faster. Pressing after using an ability or a standard attack will greatly fill the gauge.

Barret's initial abilities are Steelskin and Maximum Fury.

Steelskin temporarily reduces damage taken, and makes Barret less likely to be interrupted while unleashing an attack.

Maximum Fury consumes all available ATB charges and unleashes a hail of bullets. The more ATB charges consumed, the more potent it becomes.

Tifa excels at close-range combat and uses quick combos to deal damage.

Press to execute a normal attack, or hold it down to deliver a single powerful blow.

Attack after dodging to unleash a sweeping strike capable of hitting multiple targets.

Pressing will unleash one of Tifa's martial arts techniques, such as Whirling Uppercut.

The Unbridled Strength ability increases Tifa's chi level, making more advanced techniques available for use: Omnistrike with two levels of chi, and Rise and Fall with three. Utilizing an advanced technique expends one level of chi.

Hitting staggered foes with advanced techniques will increase the damage multiplier.

Tifa's initial abilities are Unbridled Strength and Focused Strike.

Unbridled Strength increases her chi level and grants temporary access to more techniques. Higher chi levels increase the number of standard attacks Tifa can chain together, as well as improve her evasion.

With Focused Strike, Tifa leaps backwards out of harm's way and then deals a powerful strike that fills a foe's stagger gauge. Successfully dodging an attack will fill her ATB gauge.

Note that Tifa will use Unbridled Strength when equipped with the auto-unique ability materia.

Tifa has a variety of abilities that can increase the damage multiplier on staggered foes.

Pressing will unleash her Whirling Uppercut, Omnistrike, or Rise and Fall unique abilities which can increase the stagger damage bonus.

Try staggering a foe by landing a Focused Strike or exploiting their weakness, then going in for the kill with an advanced technique.

Press to unleash long-range magic attacks capable of hitting multiple targets.

Hold down to charge the Tempest skill. Striking an enemy with this skill fully charged will summon a Fleeting Familiar to assist you in combat.

Fleeting Familiar is a fairy friend that increases the potency of Aerith's spells and automatically attacks foes she is targeting.

Aerith's initial abilities are Soul Drain and Sorcerous Storm.

Soul Drain siphons MP from opponents, absorbing additional MP from staggered foes.

Sorcerous Storm is a devastating magical attack that harms all opponents in Aerith's immediate vicinity. Get up close to a group of enemies to hit multiple targets at once.

Some of Aerith's abilities conjure beneficial magic wards.

Arcane Ward, for example, automatically casts attack spells twice, helping you conserve ATB charges. The extra spell still costs MP, but casting two spells in rapid succession essentially doubles your magical offense.

Aerith can also instantaneously warp to a conjured ward by pressing . Note that warping requires full concentration and thus cannot be performed in rapid succession.

Press to swipe at foes, or hold it down to unleash a whirling slash capable of hitting multiple targets.

Successfully guarding against attacks with fills the Vengeance Gauge, allowing you to turn the tide of battle.

After successfully blocking an attack, let down your guard and press to perform Counterspin and lunge back at the target.

Successfully guarding against attacks fills the Vengeance Gauge, which can be consumed with to enter Vengeance Mode, increasing Red XIII's attack power and dodge speed.

While in Vengeance Mode, press to use Siphon Fang, damaging an opponent and absorbing their HP.

Vengeance Mode can be activated at any time, but it will last longer depending on how full the gauge is.

Red XIII's initial abilities are Sidewinder and Sentinel Stance.

Sidewinder sends Red XIII spinning into the enemy, dealing massive damage─a perfect finishing move.

Guarding against attacks while Sentinel Stance is active greatly fills the Vengeance Gauge. Red XIII cannot move during this time, but pressing will break the stance and strike an enemy.
Press <button=attack> to strike a foe with Yuffie's throwing star. Hold it down to continue attacking while putting distance between her and the enemy.

Yuffie can launch her throwing star at a distant enemy with Throw. The weapon will remain aloft, continuously damaging the target, and return automatically after some time. Press again or hold to retrieve it sooner.

While her throwing star is away, press to unleash long-range ninjutsu. This skill starts as a non-elemental magic attack.

Yuffie's initial abilities are Art of War and Elemental Ninjutsu.

Art of War buffets an enemy with blows and enhances all subsequent attacks. While this effect is active, the ability will transform into Supreme Art of War, dealing even more damage.

Elemental Ninjutsu changes the elemental affinity of Yuffie's ninjutsu () while her weapon is away. Pressing while the ability is highlighted will alter the affinity.

Use Elemental Ninjutsu to exploit your enemies' weaknesses and pound them into submission.

Press to perform combo attacks with Cait Sith's megaphone. Hold it down to unleash a magical soundwave that harms nearby opponents. Pressing after dodging will also unleash a magical soundwave.

Press while Cait Sith is by himself to execute Kitty Wallop, a pouncing attack.

He can also summon a moogle to fight alongside him.

Let's Ride! summons a giant moogle to fight alongside Cait Sith.

While on the field, the moogle will attack enemies independently. It will withdraw from the battle once its HP reaches 0, but can be summoned again at will.

Using Let's Ride! while the moogle is summoned will fully restore its HP and remount Cait Sith if he is not already mounted.

Some of Cait Sith's abilities─including his limit break─can only be used while the moogle is on the field. Activating one of these moogle abilities will cause Cait Sith to automatically hop aboard his plush pal.

Cait Sith will immediately hop onto his moogle once it is summoned, but can dismount by pressing , and remount with .

While riding the moogle, press to attack alongside your plush pal. Hold it down to initiate a combo.

Targeting the same foe while mounted will increase the power of your attacks and fill the ATB gauge faster. Dismounting will allow you to choose separate targets.
Cait Sith: Fighting with the Moogle

As the moogle attacks, the Moogle Meter will continue to fill. Press while mounted to deplete the meter and activate a Moogle Ability.

The default level 1 ability is Dropkick, a powerful physical attack.

When the Moogle Meter gains one charge, Cait Sith can activate support abilities such as:
・Fight!: Grants the party Bravery and Faith.
・Defense!: Grants the party Protect and Shell.
・Go Wild!: Grants the party Berserk.

At two charges, he can activate enfeebling abilities, such as:
・Silence Slam: Inflicts Silence.
・Stop Strike: Inflicts Stop or Slow.
・Toxic Tackle: Inflicts Poison.
・Petrify Piledrive: Inflicts Petrify.

These abilities will be made available at random.

Cait Sith can learn other abilities as well, including:

Dodge 'n' Dive
Evade an attack, then counter with a reckless charge, after which the moogle will withdraw. Can only use while the moogle is on the field.

Roll o' the Dice
Roll a die. The resulting effect varies depending on which number appears.

: Fire & Thunder
: Hypurr Beam
: Aero & Blizzard
: Total Outrage
: Regenerative Aura
: Expansive Shield

Press to slash with the Masamune, or hold to unleash a ranged attack.

While guarding with , press at the right time to parry an incoming attack. Press again to resume a fighting stance.

Use to dodge incoming attacks, or to instantly approach a target.

Press immediately after performing certain actions to expend your Aura Charge and unleash a branching finisher, filling the limit gauge.

・Basic Attack → Pierce / Sword Dance
・Ability → Zanshin Rising / Infernal Gate
・Parry → Counter
・Limit Break → Octaslash Prime

Note that these finishers cannot be performed without a full Aura Charge. Landing basic attacks will generate charge, and getting stunned will deplete it.
Press <button=attack> to swing the buster sword. Hold to switch between aerial and grounded attacks.

Charge up power with to enhance Zack's Chain Slash and Meteor Shots abilities up to three times.

Press after attacking to perform a more effective Quick Charge.

High Braver can be executed at Charge Level III. Press with the right timing to unleash up to three consecutive strikes.

While guarding with , you can team up with allies to perform a variety of synergy skills.

If you are using a mouse and keyboard instead of a controller, you can activate these skills by simply pressing , , , or .

Utilizing synergy skills does not consume ATB charges, but instead fills the ATB gauge when they connect.

The available skills differ depending on which character is being actively controlled, and can range from powerful attacks to defensive maneuvers. To see more information on how these skills function, press while guarding.

Different synergy skills may also have different button inputs.

Combo skills like Bullet Batter, for example, can be activated immediately with a single button press. Repeatedly press the button to continue the combo.

Other skills like Power Cleave, however, require you to hold down the button to charge up power, then release to execute the attack.

Press the button just as an enemy attacks to activate skills like Counterfire.

Utilizing ATB commands marked with will grant characters synergy. When two characters share enough synergy, you can activate their synergy abilities.

These abilities not only deal tremendous damage, they also apply unique buffs, such as increasing limit break levels , granting unlimited MP , or extending the duration enemies are staggered .

Repeated use of a synergy ability will increase the amount of synergy required to activate it. Thus it is in your interest to use a variety of these commands, rather than concentrate on just one.

Synergy abilities apply unique buffs when activated. For example:

Partners in Pain raises Cloud's and Barret's limit levels by 1.

Synchro Cyclone temporarily grants Cloud and Tifa unlimited MP.

Relentless Rush boasts increased potency against staggered foes and extends the duration of their stagger.

Keep these added effects in mind as you fight, and try to make the most of them when an opportunity arises.

The synergy ability United Refocus can temporarily partition characters' ATB gauges into three segments.

This allows ATB commands to be used more freely, expanding the range of strategies available to you.

Try using it when you need to turn the tide of battle, or when other synergy abilities cannot be used effectively.

Certain abilities, such as Cloud's Triple Slash and Tifa's Focused Strike, can be used to take down foes in midair.

Commands marked with can be utilized while airborne, as well as those marked with , which launch a grounded character into the air.

Note that not all of your party members can fight while airborne.

Your success in the simulator has granted you the ability to challenge a new enemy: Phoenix.

Emerge victorious against this legendary firebird to be rewarded with its summoning materia.

Note that in the final game, you will only be able to reduce the difficulty of battles against summons by completing certain world intel objectives.

Assess enemies across various regions to unlock special challenges in the combat simulator, then complete these challenges to learn new enemy skills.

The default skill, Sonic Boom (deals wind magic damage / grants Bravery and Faith), will always be available as long as the materia is equipped.

Emerge victorious against these mighty entities in the combat simulator to be rewarded with their summoning materia.

If an entity is proving too difficult, you can gain an advantage in battle by analyzing its corresponding summon crystals found around the world.

Once upon a time, a group of moogles discovered an enormous kupo nut, and danced with joy. When some local humans caught a glimpse, they felt compelled to mimic the moogles' beautiful, swaying movements─and so Costa del Sol's traditional dance was born.

Trace the strange energy signals to their source and retrieve the protorelic.

Upon entering the modular reactor, Cloud and the others are confronted by the guardians of the protorelic: a veritable army of cactuars and their spokesgoblin, Kid G. Though Yuffie passes their trial with flying colors, the succulent sentinels only relinquish a single piece of the relic, with the next supposedly housed within another reactor.
Protorelic detected. Proceed to Modular Reactor 3 and face the trial that awaits.

Although the sand giant and the Corneo Family also join the search for the protorelic, it is Yuffie who succeeds in winning the third piece. Kid G then challenges Cloud and company to seek him out for the final trial.

Aerith proves herself more than a match for the cactuars, thereby earning Kid G's approval and the second piece of the protorelic. Though there are two more pieces to be claimed, Cloud and the others have no choice but to return to the desert, where the enigmatic sand giant yet lurks...
Activate the newly discovered remnawave tower.

You obtained biological data on the silver chimera, a rare variant of the chimera. This many-headed species's origins can be traced back to antiquity, and it remains a formidable opponent to this day.
You have gained planetary wisdom by analyzing the lifespring, and now possess more information on your surroundings.
Protorelic detected. Proceed to Modular Reactor 4 and face the trial that awaits.

With Aerith earning the fourth and final piece, the protorelic is made whole once more. However, Don Corneo and the sand giant arrive barely a moment later, each party hoping to claim the treasure. Luckily, Kid G and his cactuar friends intervene, and see off the would-be thieves. After a quick sparring match, the petite goblin declares Cloud the "bladesman of legend" and gladly grants him the relic.
You located a mogstool─and a moogle merchant in desperate need of assistance, kupo.

Once upon a time, the king of the moogles had wandered into the desert, but was luckily guided to safety by a passing tonberry. To express his gratitude and mark their newfound friendship, the moogle king granted the tonberry a wondrous crown.
You located a mogstool─and a moogle merchant in desperate need of assistance, kupo.
Investigate the newly detected dangerous species.
You obtained biological data on the Tonberry King. While his glimmering crown, golden knife, and immense size set him apart from his subjects, he shares their undying hatred for mankind.

The mysterious landmass that has risen from the fathoms: Gilgamesh Island. It is here that the final protorelic investigation─and the bladesman of legend himself─awaits Cloud and his compatriots.

With his Genji armaments and memories restored, Gilgamesh crosses swords with Cloud in a duel to end all duels. Ultimately, Gilgamesh is bested by the mercenary, and returns whence he came to settle the score with an old rival.
Phenomenon Intel 1: Fare Thee Well, Gilgamesh
Reforge the protorelics─or rather, the Genji armaments─in the crucible of combat at the Shrine of the Hazy Moon.

Gilgamesh─the very swordsman whose tales have graced the pages of not only the Book of Kings, but myriad other tomes─has at last revealed himself. Interestingly, his name has recently reentered the zeitgeist thanks to one of the attractions at the Gold Saucer.
Phenomenon Intel 2: Shrine of the Hazy Moon
Phenomenon Intel 2: The Bladesman of Legend
Reforge the protorelics─or rather, the Genji armaments─in the crucible of combat at the Shrine of the Moonbow.

The Genji armaments, which Gilgamesh covets, are enigmas wrapped in mystery. Forged using alien materials and methods, they are imbued with a power equally unknowable. All that can be said of them is that they serve as the source of Gilgamesh's might.
Phenomenon Intel 3: Shrine of the Moonbow
Reforge the protorelics─or rather, the Genji armaments─in the crucible of combat at the Shrine of the Full Moon.

Though it appears to have sprung up from the ocean depths, Gilgamesh Island likely exists in a separate dimension. Using the protorelics as a conduit, Gilgamesh is able to make contact with Cloud, beckoning him to the isle.
Phenomenon Intel 4: Shrine of the Full Moon
Phenomenon Intel 4: Isle Out of Space-time

to your weapons and armor.

Upgrading Weapons

By accessing the latent power in your gear,
you can set weapon skills to further enhance your abilities and attributes.

Try augmenting the buster sword.
From the <color=yellow>Upgrade Weapons</color> screen, you can enhance a weapon and see its stats.
Here you can see your party's current equipment, their weapon levels, and the amount of skill points (SP) needed to reach the next level.
A weapon's attributes and acquired skills are displayed here.
Now try equipping a weapon skill.
The nodes in which you can equip skills are displayed here.

Here, you will find a list of available skills.

Select Weapon Ability Damage +5% to equip it.

As you increase your weapon level, you will learn more skills and unlock more nodes in which to set them.

In addition to the Upgrade Weapons screen, you can also tweak your skill loadout by going to the
Materia & Equipment screen, selecting a character, and pressing Set Materia.
If you would prefer a more streamlined experience, you can opt to <color=green>automatically allocate weapon skills</color>.
This can be done from the Auto-Upgrade Settings menu.
You can choose how to auto-optimize your weapon skills using the three available options: prioritizing attack, defense, or striking a balance between the two.

As you accrue more weapon skills and nodes, the game will continue to automatically adjust your loadout based on your upgrade settings.

For now, this setting will be left on Manual.
Automatically equips weapon skills that strike a balance between defense and offense.
Automatically equips weapon skills that bolster offense.
Automatically equips weapon skills that bolster defense.

New skill cores can now be unlocked!

Customizing Folios

Unlocking skill cores in a character's folio increases their stats or teaches them new abilities, including synergy abilities.
The orange <color=orange>skill cores</color> can be unlocked by spending skill points (SP).

Move the cursor over a skill core to see what it does.

For now, move to the skill core on the upper left.
This displays the ability granted and SP cost.
Now to unlock the skill core.
You have mastered a new <color=orange>synergy ability</color>!

As you unlock skill cores, adjacent cores become available in turn.

You are free to choose which skill cores to unlock and when, adapting a character's strengths to suit your play style.

Increasing the party level creates more skill cores.

A character will earn SP when they level up or when they acquire manuscripts such as The Art of Swordplay.

Unlocked skill cores can be reset at any time, and the SP spent will be returned, so feel free to experiment with different combinations.

This deck contains cards that allow even new players to jump right in and play. Secure positions with your low-rank cards, then place your Magic Pot to power up your other cards for a come-from-behind victory.

Revolves around cards with low power that raise your positions' ranks by 2. Fill empty positions before your opponent can claim yours and expand your domain as far as possible. Once you feel you have expanded far enough, play Shiva to fill your empty positions and power up your territory.

Includes cards that─when enfeebled─trigger game-changing abilities. Find the right moment to sacrifice them, and you can easily turn the tide of battle. To aid you in this endeavor is Jabberwock, which lowers the power of its allies, thereby allowing them to unleash their true potential.

Composed mainly of cards that enhance their allies, such as: Magic Pot, which can raise the power of up to four allies if placed correctly; and Chocobo & Moogle, whose power grows larger the more enhanced cards you have on the battlefield.

Most of the cards in this deck have low power, but in turn gradually lower the power of your opponent's cards until they are destroyed. It also contains Midgardsormr, which grows in power the more cards are destroyed.

Composed of cards that either weaken or destroy other cards, regardless of affiliation. Once you've cleared the battlefield, use Mandragoras to add cards to your hand and secure positions for your army, all the while growing your Sea Devil's power.

This deck contains many cards with powerful abilities that activate when destroyed. Make the most of it by lowering your own cards' power to zero with Capparwire, thus destroying them and allowing their abilities to trigger. This strategy works particularly well with the Tonberry King, whose power increases when allied cards are destroyed.

Composed of cards that can only be played on top of allies, thus "replacing" them. Replaced cards are destroyed, but as long as they have abilities that trigger when this happens, it should be a boon rather than a hindrance. Strategize your way to victory by effectively employing Grandhorn and Gigantoad in addition to the rest of your arsenal.

Features various cards that, when enhanced, unleash powerful abilities. Beware, as these abilities only activate once, so the order in which you play your cards is vital to your success. Correctly determine when to play Stone Golem, however, and you will gain a rock-hard grip on the match.

This deck employs cards that─when destroyed─enhance or enfeeble other cards. While powerful, they are worthless if poorly placed. Lastly, using cards like Griffon and Gi Specter late in the game will help you take control of lanes and lead you to victory.

Reared in the verdant grasslands, this chocobo is well-suited to just about any track.
Born and bred in the rugged mountains near Junon, this sturdy bird holds her own on any course─as well as when push comes to shove.
Commonly referred to as the Corel region's "getaway bird," she is both light on her feet and incredibly skilled.
Reared in the densely wooded forests of Gongaga, Fango is one of the fastest and sturdiest chocobos around.
As she trained by balancing on the open waters of the Nibel region, Selena is able to hold her own when hit. She is not, however, adept at accelerating or rounding corners.
At home darting about the skies over Cosmo Canyon, she can round corners and accelerate with ease, but has trouble standing her ground when bumped.
The Gold Saucer's mechanical chocobo, it is capable of both reaching incredible speeds at a rapid pace, and rounding tight corners with ease.
A leisurely race that always leaves its jockeys feeling refreshed. That said, watch out for the hairpin turn at the end. <color=blue>Boost your speed by stepping on the dash panels!</color>
Takes jockeys on a kupo-sedly kweh-ctacular jaunt through a forest where moogles once frolicked. <color=blue>The conveyor belts help or hinder depending on which way their arrows point.</color>
Held on the grounds where many a cactuar trained their famously fast legs. <color=blue>Watch which way the saucers spin to keep your speed up!</color>
Like the bombs that detonated themselves and widened the track for this explosive event, <color=blue>bomb balloons will explode and slow you down if you get too close</color>!
Possibly the most noxious race on the circuit. Be nice to your bird and put a mask on its beak! <color=blue>Also, avoid the cushions, unless you want to be bounced backwards.</color>
Even a single "doink" on the final stretch can spell disaster, but one last spurt should keep you clear of knifepoint...<color=blue>unless you run into a closed cactuar gate</color>.
This cat-eat-cat race features power-hungry competitors, turns as sharp as claws, and <color=blue>spinning rods with metal orbs attached that should be avoided at all costs</color>.
A race famous for its bestial brawls. To make sure your bird isn't tossed around, make sure it's weighted down with the right gear! <color=blue>Also make sure to dodge the sliding boxes.</color>
The "ultima" test for both jockey and bird, this race should only be run by those who have truly honed their racing skills. <color=blue>Use the jump panels to make your own shortcuts.</color>
The perfect showcase for those who are red-hot passionate about winning. <color=blue>Hop on the circular springboards to soar over any pesky obstacles!</color>
A race designed for strategists with ice in their veins and drifting on the brain. <color=blue>If you find the chilling water troublesome, use the ramps to jump over it.</color>
A race with lead changes as volatile as tempestuous ocean swells. <color=blue>Memorize the placement of each obstacle</color> to navigate these rough waters with ease.
A race that rewards chocobos who are as quick as lightning. Zip past the competition by <color=blue>keeping an eye on the track's many hazards</color>!
A race made possible by the rending of the earth. Split yourself from the rest of the field by <color=blue>taking note of what and where each obstacle is</color>.
Everyone will be pushed to their limits during this race. Its hairpin turns require impeccable drifting skills, while <color=blue>the numerous obstacles demand split-second decision-making</color>.
Held on the track where Sleipnir is said to have run. Make like the mythical horse and ride like the wind, all the while <color=blue>deftly navigating the myriad hazards that dot the course</color>.
A race as challenging as it is imposing. Storm the gates and lay waste to the competition by <color=blue>evading each obstacle and leaving them in the dust</color>.
Run on a track that, like its namesake, veritably arose from the ashes. Survive this trial by fire─<color=blue>and overcome the many obstacles placed throughout</color>─to become a living legend.
Rising to the challenge in this race─held on the site of an ancient draconic power struggle─requires expertly-honed skills and <color=blue>an intricate knowledge of obstacle placement</color>.
