Fall of a Hero in Nibelheim
Dawn of a New Era in Junon
Certain gameplay aspects have been designed specifically for these demos and will differ in the final game.
Choose which of the two demos you would like to play.
Fall of a Hero in Nibelheim

Experience part of Sephiroth and Cloud's story.

Five years ago, Sephiroth and Cloud were dispatched to Nibelheim as part of a survey team. They were tasked with investigating the Nibel Mako Reactor and discovering why it had malfunctioned, but to reach their destination, the two would first have to climb Mt. Nibel.

Completing the demo will allow you to skip this portion of the story in the full release.
Dawn of a New Era in Junon

Discover a piece of what the Junon region has to offer.

Cloud and company follow a group of robed individuals through the Mythril Mine. As they exit, they are greeted by the expansive Junon region. Traverse the rocky terrain atop the mountain chocobo Belle as you investigate sightings of hostile creatures in the area.

Elements of this region have been redesigned specifically for the demo and will differ from the final game.

Discover a piece of what the Junon region has to offer.

Cloud and company follow a group of robed individuals through the Mythril Mine. As they exit, they are greeted by the expansive Junon region. Traverse the rocky terrain atop the mountain chocobo Belle as you investigate sightings of hostile creatures in the area.

This portion of the demo will be made available in a forthcoming update. Check our official website for more information.
Select Graphics Mode to prioritize visual fidelity, or Performance Mode to ensure the game runs at a smooth 60 fps.
Follow the map to find the treasure.
The party collects all the fragments and reassembles the pirate king's compass.
Unable to make heads or tails of the map, the party fails to unearth the pirate king's treasure.
The party alights on the northern continent and sets out for the temple, said to be nestled somewhere deep in the forest.
The party visits Broden's friend on the farm, and discovers that he too doesn't think very highly of Shinra.
The party opts not to visit Broden's friend at the nearby farm.
Visit Broden's acquaintance on the farm.
Now that Cloud is in possession of chocobo gear, he can avail himself of the chocoboutique's services.
Though Cloud obtains golden plumes, he doesn't trade them for chocobo gear.
Collect golden plumes and exchange them for chocobo gear at Chloe's shop.
The chocoboutique allows a rider to outfit their bird with all manner of gear.
Though Cloud has acquired gear for Piko, he opts not to use the chocoboutique.
Equip riding gear at Bill's chocoboutique stable.
It looks like the townspeople of Kalm are in need of a hand-for-hire.
Though there appears to be jobs available in Kalm, Cloud decides not to check out the noticeboard.
Check Kalm's community noticeboard to see if any odd jobs are available.
After fleeing from the Shinra search party that descended on Kalm, the party crosses the vast plains for a secluded place to hunker down.
Put distance between you and Kalm.
To cross the swamplands, the party will need chocobos, which can be procured at a nearby ranch.
Find a place to lie low until the heat is off.
In exchange for information about catching a runaway chocobo, Billy asks the party to stop by the shop.
Head to the local ranch to rent chocobos.
After receiving Piko's favorite greens from Chloe, the party sets off to wrangle the runaway.
See what Chloe has on offer.
Cloud was able to wrangle Piko and the party follows the bird back to Bill's ranch.
Piko has returned to Bill's ranch. While the bird is busy enjoying his lunch, the party decides to take a stroll about the grounds.
Follow Piko back to Bill's ranch.
The party is reunited with Chadley, who has a request to make of Cloud: activate the nearby remnawave tower.
Head outside to wait for Piko to finish his meal.
Use the device provided by Chadley to activate the remnawave tower.
Cloud activates the remnawave tower, granting Chadley─and Cloud, by extension─the ability to gather world intel.
Follow Chadley to the remnawave tower.
Piko is in fine fettle after his meal and is ready for any potential riders.
Billy instructs Cloud to use the chocowhistle to call Piko.
Follow Billy to the training grounds.
Feeling comfortable on chocoback, the party leaves Bill's ranch.
Take a ride around the training grounds with Piko.

After defeating Midgardsormr, the party follows the mysterious robed individuals into the mines. Their journey is tinged with worry, however, as the party cannot help but sense something strange about Cloud's disposition.
Cross the swamp on chocoback and head for the Mythril Mine.
Tifa says she needs to talk...but not here, so Cloud leaves his room behind and follows her.
Open the door and hear what Tifa has to say.
Cloud tries to open up to Tifa about what happened in Nibelheim, but ends up complicating matters further.
Concern lays heavy in Kalm's night air as Cloud and Tifa return to bed, unable to resolve their differences about what transpired in their hometown five years prior.
Return to your room and get some rest.

After a long night, Cloud and company awake in the morning to the sleepy, bucolic town of Kalm. Aware that a long journey lies ahead of them, they decide to take advantage of this quiet moment to prepare for what awaits.

After a long night, Cloud and company awake in the morning to the sleepy, bucolic town of Kalm. Aware that a long journey lies ahead of them, they decide to take advantage of this quiet moment to prepare for what awaits.

The chocobo Piko will not be available until you wrangle him.
The others have left the inn and are out exploring the town. At Broden's urging, Cloud decides to take in the sights too.
Find out where the others went.
Now that he is prepared for the long road ahead, Cloud catches up with Aerith, who is waiting for him at the clock tower.
Check on the others while exploring the town.
Cloud visits Maghnata Books where he learns how to augment the folios in his possession.
Head to the bookstore to augment the party's folios.
Cloud visits the local weapons vendor and learns how to optimize the party's equipment.
Head to the weapons vendor and ensure the party's equipment is in order.
After reuniting with Aerith at the base of the clock tower, she and Cloud climb up to the observation deck.
Meet Aerith at the clock tower.
Take in the view with Aerith.
Having reached the observation deck, Cloud and Aerith try to catch a glimpse of Midgar.
Follow Aerith up the clock tower.
A Shinra search party suddenly descends on the town, forcing Cloud and Aerith to flee the clock tower.
Take in the view with Aerith.
As Cloud and Aerith exit the clock tower, the innkeeper, Broden, stops them.
Flee the clock tower with Aerith.
Cloud and Aerith hurry inside the inn to regroup with the others.
Avoid the troopers and return to the inn.
Thanks to Broden's quick thinking, Cloud and Aerith were able to reach the inn without incident.
Use the town's scaffolding to avoid detection.
Cloud and Aerith climb the scaffolding to avoid detection by the Shinra troopers.
Use the town's scaffolding to avoid detection.
The party leaves the air-raid shelter and discovers the wider world that awaits them. With a sense of adventure in their hearts, they take their first steps on their new journey.
Drop down into the underground passage.

The team proceeds into the Mythril Mine to pursue Sephiroth. Once famous for the eponymous ore it produced, the site is now nothing more than a fiend-filled monument to a world that was destroyed by Shinra's greed.
With the team now separated, Cloud, Aerith, and Tifa press on to follow the black-robed figures through the mine.
Proceed through the mine in search of Sephiroth.
Barret and Red XIII enter the cave system below to help the black-robed figures who have fallen off the path.
Deep within the cave, Cloud, Aerith, and Tifa come across the Turks, who are also in pursuit of the black-robed figures. After a heated battle, the party is once again separated.
Follow the robed individuals deeper into the mine.
The team moves the minecart and proceeds into the large mineshaft.
Move the minecart blocking the way.
Cloud, Aerith, and Tifa reach the upper levels of the mine, but there is still no sign of the black robes.
Find a way up to the structure that may lead to the exit.
The team repurposes a minecart as a means to climb higher.
Look for a way onto the bridge.
As they make their way through the cave system, Barret and Red XIII run into Cloud and the others.
Climb higher in search of the exit.
With the help of conveniently placed vegetation, Barret and Red XIII are able to climb out of the depths.
Use the large root to reach the top of the cave.
Barret is able to roll a minecart into a position that allows him and Red XIII to reach the landing.
Look for something that might help the team reach the landing.
With the bridge in place, Cloud and the others are able to reach the exit. Barret and Red XIII proceed through the mine to meet up with them.
Find a way to repair the bridge for Cloud and the others.
Barret drops a minecart onto the container, which dislodges it and fixes the bridge for the others.
Look for a way to dislodge the container.
Reunited, the party exits the cave with trepidation, concerned that Shinra may be waiting for them just outside.
Head for the mine exit to link up with the others.

At the mouth of the cave, the team finds a coffle of black robes at an abandoned rest stop, as if waiting for a bus that will never come. What are these enigmatic figures searching for─and why are they so desperate to find it? As if in silent answer, they set out walking toward the city of Junon.
Exit the cave to continue following the mysterious robed men.
Ch. 4: Dawn of a New Era

The party exits the Mythril Mine to discover the Junon region, a windswept coastal territory where the shadow of Shinra looms large. Once a symbol of republic freedom, this land now stands as a testament to Shinra's prosperity─and the carnage wrought to achieve it.
The party follows the coast into Under Junon, an impoverished fishing village located in the shadow of the city above.
Follow the robed individuals to Junon.
The party arrives in Under Junon and meets Rhonda, who offers them a place to lie low despite their status as wanted criminals.
After exploring the town and gleaning what little information he could, Cloud heads to the inn.
Check to see if the others have heard anything about the black-robed figures.
Just as Cloud is about to book rooms for the night, a little girl runs into the town square, crying for help.
Head to the inn to reconvene with the others.
After defeating the Terror of the Deep, the team hurries to the unconscious Yuffie.
Follow Priscilla down to the cove.
Yuffie is resuscitated by Rhonda, and the party breathes a collective sigh of relief.
Yuffie, in awe of the splinter cell, railroads the team into meeting her the following morning.
Though misunderstandings still linger between Tifa and Cloud, the mercenary turns in for the night.
Cloud hears a voice he doesn't recognize coming from Aerith's room. However, when he checks in on her, he finds only Red XIII and the flower seller.
See whom Aerith is talking to.
Cloud is awoken by a knock the next morning, and in waltzes Yuffie, who divulges to the party her plan to assassinate Rufus Shinra.
Rhonda has sold the team out, and Roche has come to collect. Mercifully, he departs with the simple promise of meeting again soon, in the city above.
Leave the inn before the obnoxious interloper draws too much attention.
The team learns of a way to get topside. All that remains is to ensure their preparations are complete, and to enact Priscilla's plan.
Ask Priscilla for a way to get topside.
Now that the team is ready for what lies ahead, Cloud follows the dolphin out into the cove.
Cloud reaches the control room with panache, and makes to lower the tanker for the others.
Reach the control room with the help of Mr. Dolphin.
Once the others make it safely topside with the tanker, Cloud leaves the control room to reunite with them.
Enter the control room and lower the tanker.

Cloud and company continue their pursuit of the robed individuals aboard a cruise ship. Their destination: Costa del Sol, a seaside resort where summer never ends and the party never stops. Though arrival in paradise is not until the next morning, the onboard festivities have already begun.
Leave the hold and head toward the lounge.
A special card tournament is nigh underway, and Cloud and his comrades decide to throw their hats into the ring.
Having patiently waited his turn, Cloud completes his registration and prepares to take part in the Queen's Blood tournament.
Talk with Aerith while waiting to register.
After a friendly bit of pre-tourney banter, Aerith gets herself registered for the main event.
Talk with Tifa while waiting to register.
After a friendly bit of pre-tourney banter, Tifa gets herself registered for the main event.
Talk with Barret while waiting to register.
After a friendly bit of pre-tourney banter, Barret gets himself registered for the main event.
Talk with Red XIII while waiting to register.
After a friendly bit of pre-tourney banter, Red XIII attempts to register for the event, but is denied the chance.
Battle your first opponent and report your results.
Cloud emerges victorious in his first match and proceeds to Round 2.
Just as Cloud brings his tournament run to a premature end, a new, mysterious challenger steps into the ring.
Report the results of your match.
With one match down, Cloud seeks his next opponent.
Having bowed out of the competition, Cloud sees no need to report his results.
Battle your second opponent and report your results.
Cloud emerges victorious in his second match and proceeds to Round 3.
Just as Cloud brings his tournament run to a premature end, a new, mysterious challenger steps into the ring.
Report the results of your match.
With two matches down, Cloud seeks his next opponent.
Having bowed out of the competition, Cloud sees no need to report his results.
Battle your third opponent and report your results.
Cloud emerges victorious in his third match and proceeds to Round 4.
Just as Cloud brings his tournament run to a premature end, a new, mysterious challenger steps into the ring.
Report the results of your match.
With three matches down, Cloud seeks his next opponent.
Having bowed out of the competition, Cloud sees no need to report his results.
Battle your fourth opponent and report your results.
Cloud emerges victorious in his fourth match and proceeds to the finals.
Just as Cloud brings his tournament run to a premature end, a new, mysterious challenger steps into the ring.
Cloud trounces whom he thought to be his final opponent─but before he can claim the title of "champion," a new, mysterious challenger steps into the ring.
Just as Cloud brings his tournament run to a premature end, a new, mysterious challenger steps into the ring.
Return to the registration booth if you wish to forfeit.
Cloud waves goodbye to his chance at the title of Queen's Blood champion.
Refusing to throw in the towel, Cloud continues his quest to become the Queen's Blood champion.
Return to your cabin and rest in the hammock.
The party takes a breather after the day's festivities, but their moment of respite is cut short by a blaring emergency broadcast.
At Captain Titov's request, the party assembles on the deck to discover that fiends have assailed the ship.
Pursue the fiends that have invaded the ship.
Cloud clears out the lounge and makes his way toward the passenger cabins.
Cloud is able to keep one of the crewmates safe, but now the fiends have infiltrated the cabin floors.
Pursue the fiends that have invaded the cabins.
Cloud and Tifa proceed through the ship in pursuit of the infiltrating fiends.
Cloud heads through the door and continues his pursuit.
The party fells the incarnation of Jenova born of the fusion of robed individuals. Though the ship sails smoothly once more, its passengers remain considerably shaken.
Following Barret, the duo reaches the ship's engine room and finds a group of injured crew members.
Help Barret protect the robed individuals.
Cloud and Tifa reunite with Barret and are met by another familiar face─Captain Titov, holding a gun.

As they leave Costa del Sol, the party bids farewell to the sun and fun in exchange for a new member: Yuffie. With this energetic ninja in tow, they follow the black robes in the direction of Mt. Corel─a once-thriving coal mine, and a location that evokes more than a few emotions in Barret.
Cloud and company arrive at the Mt. Corel trailhead and begin their climb, hoping to catch up with the black robes.
Head to Mt. Corel in search of the black robes.
This being her first hike, Aerith struggles to keep up with the group. To accommodate her, the group splits in two.
Cloud's group has made it halfway up the mountain, but still must rendezvous with Barret's.
Match Aerith's pace as she climbs.
The helicopter they saw is piloted by the Turks, who are here to drop off a few unruly robed passengers.
Avoid detection by Shinra as you proceed.
Having reconvened at the summit, the group continues tracking the black robes to the reactor.
Meet up with Barret's group at the summit.
With the gate unlocked, Cloud and company are free to continue on their way up the mountain.
Pull the lever and unlock the gate.
Cloud's team rendezvouses with Yuffie and the others, but it appears the black robes have already moved on.
The party arrives at the Corel Mako Reactor. After hearing how the black robes are Shinra victims, Yuffie cannot help but compare them with Wutaians.
Having seen a Weapon─and learning they are tutelary creatures that appear when the world is in danger─the group redoubles its resolve to fight for the planet.
Thanks to Yuffie's impeccable guidance, the party is able to reach the reactor's mako storage area.
Everyone boards the elevator on the other side of the reactor, eventually arriving at the entrance to a mine.
Having come upon an abandoned mine, the group sees the robed individuals lumber on without a thought to the dangers around them.
Press on in search of the robed individuals.
Yuffie and company head from the preparation plant into the railway control tower in search of the drawbridge's control panel.
Brave the mine to find the control panel for the drawbridge.
With the conveyor powered on, the team rides one up.
Turn the conveyor on and ride one to the upper levels of the mine.
Yuffie manages to get a hold of a grappling hook, which she must now use to reach the generator.
Thanks to her trusty grappling hook, Yuffie manages to access the generator and switch it on.
Use your grappling hook to reach the generator.
Yuffie succeeds in unlocking the elevator, and both Barret and Tifa rejoin her.
Operate the elevator control unit and unlock the elevator.
With a path to the next control unit secure, Yuffie endeavors yet again to unlock the elevator.
Use the grappling hook to move to the upper levels, where the next elevator control unit lies.
The party finally arrives at the peak where the control room is, and they promptly make for the console.
Continue your search for the drawbridge control panel.
Yuffie reaches the latest generator and activates it, which sends power to the conveyor.
Make use of your grappling hook to reach the generator.
After Yuffie successfully unlocks the elevator, Barret and Tifa rejoin her.
Operate the control unit to unlock the elevator.
Yuffie, Barret, and Tifa defeat the gigatrice. The chicks it was attacking seem none the worse for wear.
Dispatch the oversized bird blocking access to the control panel.
Having lowered the drawbridge, Yuffie's group contacts Cloud's and sets a rendezvous point.
Lower the drawbridge via the control panel.
Cloud's team reaches the suspension bridge and contacts Yuffie's team.
Choose which path the mining cart will take down the mountain as you make your way to the suspension bridge.
After a leisurely (harrowing?) mining cart ride, the party is reunited, allowing them to continue their pursuit of the black robes.
Ride the cart down to the suspension bridge.
Arriving at the village across the bridge, Barret's face begins to darken.
Follow the black robes across the bridge.
Armed with new information from Dr. Sheiran─namely the black robes' destination─the party sets off for the Gold Saucer.
Walk through the village in search of the robed individuals.
Tifa reunites with Dr. Sheiran, the man who saved her life years ago. Coincidentally, he is currently studying the robed individuals.
Follow Tifa as she pays a visit to someone.
Barret still blames himself for what happened to his village, but he tries to put those feelings aside as the group approaches the Gold Saucer.
Make for the ropeway to the Gold Saucer.
Take advantage of the guide moogle's services.
The Gold Saucer's guide moogles offer instantaneous transportation, allowing for a better, more convenient park experience.

Following in the robed individuals' footsteps, the party leaves the down-at-heel settlement of North Corel for the glittering opulence of the Gold Saucer─the theme park that never sleeps. Rising high above the wastelands, it has truly earned its sobriquet as the "gilded paradise."
Follow the others to the ticket gate.
Ticket in hand, the party enters the park. However, Cloud's fun is cut short when he is beset by a sudden headache─and a disturbing vision.
Away from the Glitz and Glamour
Head to the hotel with Barret.
Cloud and Barret arrive to discover the hotel is fully booked. However, a timely intervention from Cait Sith nets them two suites.
Take the elevator to the fourth floor and rest in the Tonberry Suite.
Barret leaves on a walk, allowing Cloud a quiet moment to rest up.
Picking up on his comrade's concern, Cloud decides to rest. The moment his head hits the pillow, he is out. Perhaps he really was tired.
See who is at the door.
Cloud takes his comrade up on the invitation, and the two hit the Gold Saucer.
Now that Cloud is awake, he decides to take in the Gold Saucer.
There has been a shooting in the lobby of Musclehead Colosseum, and the perpetrator has "a gun for an arm."
Cloud visits Wonderment Square and finds it replete with numerous games and activities.
See if there are any shows going on.
Cloud visits Event Square where he finds a portrait of Jessie from before she joined Avalanche.
Cloud visits Speed Square, home to the popular attraction "Galactic Saviors."
Participate in a match or two at Musclehead Colosseum.
Cloud visits Battle Square, which features the battle arena known as Musclehead Colosseum.
Participate in one of the chocobo races.
Cloud visits Chocobo Square and discovers that participation is for members only.
Come back later when the square is accepting more guests.
Cloud is about to board the Skywheel, but is stopped short by staff members asking all guests to evacuate the area immediately due to "technical difficulties."
Hurry to Musclehead Colosseum where the shooting took place.
The party discovers a grisly scene at the colosseum. To clear Barret's name, they journey beneath the Gold Saucer in search of the true culprit.
Use the guide moogle to avoid the crowds.
Cloud arrives in Battle Square via the guide moogle and heads to the site of the shooting.
Cait Sith leads the team onto the elevator that will take them to the Dustbowl, where the culprit was last spotted.

The party discovers that in order to access the Temple of the Ancients─in which rests the black materia─they will need the keystone, a relic last seen at the Gold Saucer. Meanwhile, war is brewing in the world. Wutai has publicly declared their intent to topple Shinra and the city of Midgar, yet the company is unfazed. Their focus remains locked on one thing only─reaching the temple and discovering the promised land.
Head to Costa del Sol to continue the trek on foot.
The team disembarks at Costa del Sol and continues on to the Gold Saucer on foot.
Head to the Gold Saucer to speak with Dio.
The party arrives at the Gold Saucer and splits up to search for Dio.
Check to see if the others have any information about Dio's whereabouts.
In exchange for the keystone, Cloud agrees to battle on Dio's behalf in the Fight for Naming Rights.
Cloud finds Barret in Event Square, but there is no sign of Dio.
Cloud finds Vincent in Ghost Square, but there is no sign of Dio.
Cloud finds Yuffie in Wonderment Square, but there is no sign of Dio.
Cloud finds Tifa in Skywheel Square, but there is no sign of Dio.
Cloud finds Red XIII in Chocobo Square, but there is no sign of Dio.
Cloud finds Cid in Speed Square, but there is no sign of Dio.
Cloud, Aerith, and Cait Sith find Dio in the colosseum, battered and bruised.
Ensure the team is ready for the big match tomorrow, then rest at the Haunted Hotel.
Cloud turns in early to ensure he is ready for the big match.
See who is at the door.
Cloud is awoken by his comrade, who invites him to attend the play Loveless.
After an impressive performance of Loveless, it's time to head to Skywheel Square.
After a tender moment in the skies above the Gold Saucer, Cloud and his comrades are ready for the battles to come.
Speak with the colosseum staff member once your preparations are complete.
After successfully registering with a member of the staff, Cloud and his comrades manage to "claim their crown" in the Fight for Naming Rights.
Defeat the Turks and reclaim the keystone from Cait Sith.
After besting both the Turks and Rufus Shinra, Cloud, Aerith, and Tifa race off to recover the stolen keystone.
Speak with Dio once the party is prepared for the next bout.
After a quick break, the team faces off against the Turks.
Cloud finds Cait Sith hiding amongst stuffed toys. He evades the team's grasp and takes off.
Cait Sith flees Battle Square to hide in Park Central.
The team manages to find Cait Sith, but he eludes their capture attempts, and flees into the night.
Cait Sith is able to shake off his pursuers for long enough to deliver the keystone to the Turks.
Return to the Tiny Bronco to find out where the Turks are headed.
Though the shock of Cait Sith's betrayal still weighs heavy on the party, time is not on their side. They return to the Tiny Bronco and follow Shinra to the Temple of the Ancients.
Make preparations, then head into the underground passage.
Proceed through the underground passage and head for the scrapyard.
On the other side of underground passage, the party finds a vulture awaiting them.
Follow Gus's vulture to the scrapyard.
A sandstorm catches the party unawares, but Barret appears to lead them to safety.
Head to the makeshift cell in the scrapyard.
The party arrives at the scrapyard, and Barret enters to confront Dyne alone.
Barret reunites with his friend Dyne, only to discover that their bond is broken beyond repair.
Thanks to Dio's intervention, the party escapes both Shinra and Corel Prison, but a dark cloud of guilt and regret hangs heavy over them.
Cloud spends his downtime practicing on the simulator in preparation for the race.
Cloud opts to not practice on the simulator, and instead simply awaits the start of the race.
Bide your time until the race begins.
An announcement has called for all jockeys to head for the paddock.
Use the racing simulator to practice.
Cloud spent his time practicing on the simulator in preparation for the real thing.
Participate in the chocobo race and claim victory.
Cloud is able to win the chocobo race, free the party from Gus's jail, and learns where the "gun-armed man" is being held.
Watch for signs of danger as you press on.
The party has been kidnapped by Gus, who will only release them once Cloud wins one of the Gold Saucer's chocobo races.
Cloud is reunited with Billy and the two begin to search for feed that will see Piko healthy again.
Feed Piko the greens found throughout the Dustbowl.
Speak with Garth once preparations are complete.
Now that Piko's health is restored, both he and Cloud are ready to participate in the races.
Exchange produce for chocobo gear at Esther's shop.
Cloud claimed every item available in Esther's shop.
Cloud decides not to obtain all of the chocobo gear from Esther's shop.
Compete in Desert Rush to procure the greens on offer.
After competing in Desert Rush, Cloud collects the greens on offer.
Cloud is unable to win the greens from Desert Rush.
Find a deserted spot where you can rough up the thugs tailing you.
Cloud lures the stalkers into a back alley, where he teaches them a lesson. As an apology, the thugs gift him produce for Piko.
Cloud is unable to shake the stalkers.
Hear what the aspirant swindlers have to say and figure out which one is telling the truth.
Caglio awards Cloud the chocobo feed for correctly guessing which of the aspirant swindlers was telling the truth.
Cloud is unable to correctly guess which of the aspirant swindlers was telling the truth.
Compete in a series of bouts to earn the chocobo feed.
Cloud claims victory in the Beast Battleground and wins the chocobo feed.
Cloud is unable to obtain the chocobo feed from Beast Battleground.
Defeat the Queen's Blood players in the Card Casino and report back to the card collector.
Cloud defeats the Queen's Blood players in the Card Casino and receives chocobo feed as a reward.
Cloud is unable to obtain the produce from the card collector.
Collect the produce from the abandoned vegetable patch at the top of the cliff.
After receiving permission from the bartender, Cloud reaches the abandoned vegetable patch and reclaims the stolen produce.
Cloud forgoes the produce from the bartender's vegetable patch.
Follow Esther up to the Gold Saucer's racetrack.
Cloud, Billy, and Esther arrive at Chocobo Square and proceed to the jockeys' lounge.
Following a painful goodbye, the party resumes their journey─though to where, none of them can say. For the moment, they push southward, away from Corel.

Following a painful goodbye, the party resumes their journey─though to where, none of them can say. For the moment, they push southward, away from Corel.

The chocobo Fango will not be available until you have obtained him in the story.
Put as much distance as possible between the party and Corel.
The team pulls over to give the carsick Yuffie a moment to breathe. A complimentary fortune from Cait Sith offers inspiration for their next destination: a nearby dilapidated reactor.
Travel south to reach the dilapidated mako reactor.
The team crosses the shallows and enters the Gongaga region. They continue on foot through the jungle, making for the village Cait Sith spoke of.
Continue through the jungle to reach the village.
No sooner has the team entered the village than they meet Cissnei─the captain of Gongaga's Youth Coalition. Following a tense first encounter, she welcomes them into town.
After learning what transpired at the mako reactor, the team decides to take a breather before heading to the ruins.
Explore the town and speak with the party.
When the conversation turns to Zack, a headache grips Cloud. He decides to rest up at Cissnei's house to shake it off.
Aerith and Cloud visit the Fairs. Much to the couple's disappointment, Cloud cannot recall anyone by the name of Zack, which strikes both Aerith and Tifa as odd.
Cloud is awoken from his rest by a low roar emanating from the mako reactor.
Find out what is making that noise.
The party realizes that the howling likely belongs to a Weapon, and they split into two teams─one to investigate the reactor, and the other to watch over the village.
Follow Yuffie up to the memorial.
Cloud joins the others at the memorial to check on the reactor.
Head to the reactor to investigate.
At the reactor entrance, the team encounters a fog of Whispers. The enigmatic figures disappear deeper into the facility, as if to guide Cloud and the others.
Exit through the south gate to reach the mako reactor.
Cissnei has called ahead to open the south gate, which the party uses to press on toward the reactor.
Follow the Whispers through the reactor.
The team follows the Whispers into the reactor core just as Shinra's military arrives.
Restore power to the gate to continue through the reactor.
With the power restored, the gate unlocks, and the party is able to advance.
Find a way across and follow the Whispers.
The team reaches the passageway where the Whispers were last seen, and the four continue their pursuit.
Locate the controls that will adjust the water level.
Restore power to the control system and adjust the water level.
By raising the water level, the team is able to follow the Whispers down the passageway.
Restore power to the system to access the controls.
With the power restored, the party is able to adjust the facility's water level.
Scarlet and a complement of troopers have come to retrieve the magnus materia. She quickly gains the upper hand against the team, putting them in dire straits.
Leave through the south gate once the team is prepared.
With Cissnei's help, Tifa, Aerith, and Yuffie ride out on chocoback to offer aid to Cloud and the others.
Hurry to the Gongaga mako reactor.
Tifa, Aerith, and Yuffie race to the reactor to offer their support.
Use the grappling gun to enter the facility.
The team uses Cissnei's grappling guns to enter the reactor.
Hurry to the reactor core to reunite with the others.
The team fends off the Crimson Mare Mk. II, but Scarlet is undeterred, and the division director redoubles her efforts to claim the materia.
Restore power to the generator and continue onward.
With the power restored, the gate unlocks, and the team is able to advance.
Reach Scarlet before she is able to claim the magnus materia.
The Shinra forces abandon the materia and flee the reactor. Meanwhile, Cloud is driven into a frenzy by the mako, attacking Tifa and sending her hurtling into the pool below.
Swim to Barret and the others.
A Weapon drags Tifa down into the depths of the planet─into the lifestream itself─where she witnesses the war the planet is waging.
A Weapon returns Tifa to the others before slipping back into the mako pool.
Speak with the others in the living room.
Given all that Tifa witnessed in the lifestream, the team decides to visit the birthplace of planetology: Cosmo Canyon.
The team arrives at the airstrip to find it fresh out of both pilots and planes. There is, however, a telephone booth.
Exit through the south gate to reach the republic airstrip.
The team puts the village of Gongaga behind them and makes for the airstrip, where a freeflier pilot awaits to take them to Cosmo Canyon.
Cloud spies a flyer plastered to the outside of the booth with the words "Send up smoke, and we'll be right with you, folks."
The team takes to the skies in Cid Highwind's plane, the Tiny Bronco; their destination Cosmo Canyon─Red XIII's home and the birthplace of planetology.
In a display of generosity, Bugenhagen opens his storeroom and insists the party takes whatever they need.
Bugenhagen kindly opens his storeroom, but the party does not avail themselves of his offer.
Red XIII scours the cave, retracing the steps of those who fought here forty-five years ago and unearthing a Watcher's weapon in the process.
Red XIII searches the cave, but fails to unearth anything of interest.
Search the cave for signs of the battle.

As the scale of the conflict continues to swell, the party cannot help but feel they are embroiled in a battle for the future of the planet. Thus, where better to seek guidance than Cosmo Canyon, the home of planetology?
Back in his natural habitat after quite some time, Red XIII surprises the party by revealing another, more youthful side of himself.
Red XIII announces he will serve as a Watcher of the Vale. Saddened by this sudden departure, the party takes a stroll around the village.
Bugenhagen welcomes the party to his observatory and invites them inside for a tour of the facility.
The party follows Red XIII up to the cliff and finds themselves face-to-face with Bugenhagen, the authority on planetology.
Head up to the cliff and check on Red XIII.
Following a cursory inspection of the devices in the observatory, the party follows Bugenhagen to another room.
A mountain of old books teeters in a corner of the room, ready to topple over at the slightest touch.
Preserved for research purposes, this crystalline sphere is said to contain the planet's memories.
The scribblings produced by this device represent fluctuations in planetary activity.
The dust covering this model of the planet and the surrounding stars suggests it has seen little recent use.
This device is the first of its kind─developed by Bugenhagen himself─but sounds to be out of commission at the moment.
This device, which harnesses wind power to create new air currents, is frequently employed at chocobo gliding ranges.
The video footage contained in this device shows a young Red XIII, energetic as ever.
Allegedly the largest in the world, this optic aid is out of order due to a clouded lens.
A noise resounds from the tube. Bugenhagen calls it "the cry of the planet," but Tifa insists it is the voice of the Weapon she heard.
Bugenhagen recounts the basic principles of planetology, encouraging Tifa to participate in a seminar for further guidance.
Having shared her testimony about the planet's struggle, Tifa heads off to take part in the River of Lights ceremony, and her friends follow.
Participate in the seminar with Tifa and Aerith.
Tifa and Aerith arrive at the seminar room, and Cloud goes to join them.
Follow the mentor to the seminar room.
The attendees open their hearts to one another, then set lanterns aloft in honor of people they've lost, forming a veritable lifestream in the sky.
Attend the ceremony at the Torch.
Bugenhagen leads the party to the Sealed Door, behind which awaits a series of trials Red XIII must undertake.
Unsealing the door, Bugenhagen directs the party into the cavernous depths beyond.
Speak with Bugenhagen once you are prepared.
Red XIII arrives at the underground cavern where the trial will take place and─begrudgingly─accepts Barret as his witness.
Less than half a century ago, the Gi attempted to invade the vale─and proof of the ensuing battle lies just ahead.
Red XIII successfully opens the door and, Barret at his side, proceeds onward.
Cut the rope and proceed through the door.
Red XIII unearths a Gi statue. Heeding the call of their spirits, he carries it forth.
Investigate the cave and discern what happened here.
With all three statues returned to their rightful places, the altar door opens, and Red XIII continues onward in search of answers.
The door may open if you cut the rope.
Put the correct statue on the altar.
Red XIII places the statue atop the altar, and a lantern lights up as if to signal the Gi's approval.
Find the ruby Gi statue and place it on the altar.
Red XIII retrieves the statue and places it on its altar.
Retrieve the statue and place it on the altar.
Red XIII places the statue atop the altar, and a lantern lights up as if to signal the Gi's approval.
Find the emerald Gi statue and place it on the altar.
Red XIII places the statue atop the altar, and a lantern lights up as if to signal the Gi's approval.
Find the amber Gi statue and place it on the altar.
Place the statues as the voices ordain.
To Thine Own Self Be True
Though Red XIII succeeds in quelling the restless spirits of the Gi, his fate in these trials rests with a certain Watcher.
Red XIII manages to open the first gate, but further trials yet await.
Red XIII unseals the Gate of Anger and heads through.
Find a way to open the gate.
Red XIII opens the second gate blocking his path, but his trials continue.
Red XIII unseals the Gate of Rancor and heads through.
Find a way to open the gate.
Red XIII manages to open the third gate and proceeds onward, the end of his trials now in sight.
Red XIII finds a place to rest his paws and heads to the other side of the pond.
Red XIII finds a new hook and attaches it to the pedestal, allowing him to pull the chain and open the gate.
Find the hook and attach it to the pedestal.
Proceed through the cave in search of answers.
Red XIII is met with the heroic visage of his father, Seto. Following this emotional reunion, Gi Nattak leads the party through a secret stoneway.
Proceed to receive your trial verdict.
The party arrives at an inlet, from which they board a boat bound for the Village of the Gi.
Gi Nattak entrusts the party with his people's last wish: to retrieve their stolen black materia. The village fades away, and the party is returned to the vale.
Yuffie races through the village, her materia senses tingling. The party gives chase.
Safely back above ground, the party starts gathering information about the fabled temple of the Cetra.
The attendant guides the party out of the caves and back to the Sealed Door.

A curious name crosses the robed individual's lips: "Nibelheim," a village that burned to the ground five years ago─and Cloud and Tifa's hometown. With uneasy hearts, the party sets it as their next destination.
The party takes flight as if drawn by some unseen force─toward the Gi's stolen materia, toward the migrant robed flock, and now toward the mountain village of Nibelheim.
Return to the airstrip and head for Nibelheim.
Beyond the forest lies the fabled Temple of the Ancients. Aerith warns of her forebears' displeasure, but the party nevertheless proceeds inside.
Head for the entrance to the temple.
Summoning her strength, Aerith successfully fills all the vessels on Mercy's Altar.
The party proceeds without filling all the vessels.
Channel the lifestream into the vessels on the altar.
Summoning her strength, Aerith successfully fills all the vessels on Order's Altar.
The party proceeds without filling all the vessels.
Channel the lifestream into the vessels on the altar.
The party wanders into the temple to discover a labyrinth laid out before their very eyes.
Search the temple for the black materia.
Having slain the red dragon and safely escaped the labyrinth, the party continues their search for the black materia deeper within the temple.
Search the temple for the black materia.
The party catches up to the Shinra troopers, takes them down, and continues through the temple.
The party steels their resolve and takes a leap of faith down the waterfall.
Follow the Shinra troopers down the waterfall.
Aerith attempts to harness the lifestream, but when her concentration falters for a moment, the entire temple shakes, and the party ends up split in two.
Search the temple for the black materia.
The party crosses paths with Reno and Rude, who halt them in their tracks and force them to find a detour.
Search the temple for the black materia.
The party successfully stems the lifestream's torrent and proceeds through the temple.
While the party manages to ambush some troopers laying traps, Barret and Tifa express concern over Cloud's unrelenting aggression.
Take down the Shinra troopers lurking nearby.
Though Aerith's efforts to restore the temple prove fruitful, they take a toll on her mind and body, so Yuffie and Red XIII propose a short rest.
Aerith's second attempt to harness the lifestream is a success, and the temple's terrain is returned to its original state.
Channel the lifestream into the vessel.
The floor gives way during a heated battle with the Turks─leading to a fortuitous reunion with Aerith and the others.
Search the temple for the black materia.
Cloud and company chase after the Turks and end up going toe-to-toe with Reno and Rude.
The party safely alights on the other side and continues onward.
Secure a way across the lifestream.
The party safely alights on the other side and continues onward.
Secure a way across the lifestream.
The party employs the ironclad to topple the monument on their behalf, thus securing themselves a way across.
Topple the monument and use it to get across.
After a harrowing trek through the temple and a tussle with the Turks, the party is reunited at last. They chase after Tseng in hopes of reaching the black materia before him.
Aerith's attempt to harness the lifestream once more is thwarted by some pesky fiends.
Channel the lifestream into the vessel.
Aerith and her comrades make quick work of the fiends and resume their restoration effort.
Aerith and her comrades make quick work of the other fiends and resume their restoration effort.
Undeterred by the fiendly diversion, Aerith channels the lifestream into the vessel, and the temple's terrain is returned to its original state.
Return to the altar and channel the lifestream into the vessel.
The party pursues Tseng into the lower tier of the temple, unaware of the trials that await.
Having overcome their respective trials, the party reconvenes, now more determined than ever to find the black materia and put a stop to Sephiroth's plot.
Search the temple for the black materia.
Tseng questions if the temple is truly the "promised land" that Rufus seeks; Aerith simply shakes her head. Crestfallen yet confident in her response, he shuffles off to regroup with his contingent.
Aerith raises her hand to the pedestal, and the entire room illuminates in response. Their paths forward now clear, the party proceeds to undertake their trials.
Guided by the pedestal, each member of the party heads through a separate door, accosted by memories of their past upon crossing the threshold.
Head through the door indicated by the pedestal.
Red XIII howls in anger as memories of his torturous time in Professor Hojo's lab come flooding back. Nevertheless, he perseveres and overcomes the trial.
Tifa weeps for her late father, forced to relive his murder and the tragedy that befell her hometown five years ago. Nevertheless, she perseveres and overcomes the trial.
Though memories of losing her partner Sonon remain fresh in her mind, Yuffie's wounds are opened anew. Nevertheless, she perseveres and overcomes the trial.
Images of his halcyon life in Corel Village crumble before his eyes as Barret relives his trauma. Nevertheless, he perseveres and overcomes the trial.
Aerith pleads for help, but her cries fall on deaf ears as her mother Ifalna fades away, leaving her all alone. Nevertheless, she perseveres and overcomes the trial.
The party safely navigates the corridor and continues their search for the black materia deeper within the temple.
Pass through the corridor and search for the black materia.
Though granted an initial reprieve, Cloud faces a challenge of his own in the form of Sephiroth. He loses control of himself, but his comrades manage to rein him in.
The party fells the demon gates and escapes the Corridor of Apocalypse, allowing them to continue their search for the black materia.
Search the temple for the black materia.
Images painted on the wall spring to life as the battle between mankind and the Cetra plays out before the party's eyes.
Images painted on the wall spring to life as the party bears witness to the advent of Jenova and the chaos she wrought.
Images painted on the wall prophesy a grim future: one in which a meteor, brought forth through the black materia, destroys the planet and all life upon it.
A devilish smirk crosses Cloud's face as he takes the black materia in his hand─but the others are not smiling when the temple begins crumbling around them.
Thanks to Cait Sith's noble sacrifice, the party escapes the temple in the nick of time. Yet their relief is short-lived as they immediately find themselves face-to-face with Sephiroth.
Follow Vincent out of the temple.
In a moment of weakness, Cloud succumbs to Sephiroth's control and hands over the black materia. Just as he comes to his senses, he and Aerith tumble into the abyss below.
Having entrusted Cloud with her white materia, Aerith ventures alone into the depths of the Sleeping Forest, determined to put a stop to Sephiroth's plans.
Beyond the forest lies the forgotten capital, ancient city of the Cetra. With no initial sign of Aerith, the party enters the ruins in search of the altar.
Follow Aerith to the ancient Cetran city.
Though the Whispers block his path, Cloud manages to break through their barrier with the aid of his comrades. Now on his own, he continues onward to reunite with Aerith.
Head toward the altar in search of Aerith.

Bidding farewell to Aerith, the party boards the Tiny Bronco and sets off into the sky. Higher and higher they soar, while Aerith's faintly glowing prayer sinks deeper and deeper into the murky depths of the planet.
Head toward the altar in search of Aerith.

With a heavily mako-poisoned Cloud in tow, Zack has beaten the odds and returned to Midgar alive─yet a strange, ominous pall hangs over the City of Mako. This is not the same world the SOLDIER once knew.
Zack saves Aerith from the downed helicopter, only to find her unconscious and barely clinging to life.
Concerned for Aerith, Elmyra barges in and flies up the stairs.
See who is at the door.
Elmyra is beside herself to see her daughter in such a state. To better look after both Aerith and Cloud, she and Zack carry the two to the Gainsborough house.
Follow Elmyra up to the second floor.
Neither Aerith nor Cloud show any sign of recovery at the moment, so Zack heads downstairs.
Zack learns that a man named Biggs has been coming by the house as of late. Hoping to raise Marlene's spirits, he promises to bring the wanted fugitive back to see her.
Zack's hunt for Biggs is proving fruitless─until an explosion rocks the Sector 5 undercity.
Finding Biggs before a smoldering wreck, Zack hurries over.
Locate the source of the blast.
Biggs shows Zack an Avalanche recruitment flyer, asking potential candidates to meet at the lot off Petal Lane. Doubtful that anyone will actually show, the two nevertheless head over.
Disheartened by the lack of recruits, Biggs turns to leave, but Zack stops him and offers words of comfort.
Follow Biggs to the empty lot.
After returning to Aerith's house, Zack checks on the comatose flower peddler one more time.
Zack is unsettled by what Marlene tells him: that a "scary man" is going to kill Aerith.
Head upstairs to care for Cloud.
Zack discovers a note from Biggs and rushes back to Elmyra.
Ask Hojo about a possible way to cure Cloud.
Cloud joins Aerith on a stroll through the Sector 5 undercity, but something about her demeanor seems strange.
At the church, Aerith says goodbye to Cloud. Meanwhile, Zack crosses through the boundaries between worlds.

After a harrowing battle in Midgar with an otherworldly twist, the group continues their pursuit of Sephiroth. They make a stop in the village of Kalm, where Cloud reveals his connection to their uncanny enemy and what happened on that fateful day in Nibelheim five years ago.
Rest at the inn when you're done exploring.
Having explored his hometown to his heart's content, Cloud returns to the inn and prepares for an early start the next day.
Cloud stops by his childhood home and spends some quality time with his mother.
Cloud stops by his childhood home, but keeps the details of his visit close to his chest.
Cloud visits Tifa's home, but is unable to see her.
Cloud goes to Tifa's house, but leaves before she returns.
Cloud climbs the water tower and reminisces about his youth.
Cloud considers climbing the town's water tower, but ultimately decides against it.
Take a look around the inn.
Cloud meets Tifa's martial arts instructor, Rashard Zangan, who offers to take him under his wing. Cloud not-so-politely declines.
Cloud finds a peculiar-looking man at the inn, but opts not to speak with him.
The party arrives at the base of Mt. Nibel and begins their climb to the mako reactor.
Though the party is waylaid by fiends, Cloud succeeds in dispatching them.
Cloud comes to a dead end, but is called back down by Tifa, who knows a detour.
Go on ahead and remove the fiends from the party's path.
The group leaves the mako gas-filled facility and continues their climb up Mt. Nibel.
Head to the reactor via Tifa's detour.
Unable to cross the ravine due to the bridge across it no longer being there, the survey team is forced to make a detour through a Shinra facility.
Follow Tifa to get around the destroyed bridge.
With the elevator operational again, the party heads to the upper levels of the facility.
Clear the mako gas in order to operate the elevator.
Lightning strikes, causing the bridge to snap, and the party falls into the river below. Though they sadly lose a member of their team, they cannot afford to halt their mission.
Cross the suspension bridge and enter the reactor.

Though they encountered a few setbacks, the party manages to reach the reactor.
Now the survey can begin in earnest.
The party successfully scales the cliffside and resumes their trek toward the mako reactor.
Scale the cliff and get back on the trail.
After taking a moment to admire the miraculous crystal formation that towers over the mako spring, the team presses on.
Head for the spring while avoiding the mako gas.
With the elevator operational again, the party heads to the upper levels of the facility.
Clear the mako gas in order to operate the elevator.
With the door unlocked, the air purification unit can now reach all the mako gas.
Find a path within the cord's reach.
Sephiroth says the malfunction is causing the pods to depressurize.
Enter the reactor and find what is causing the malfunction.
Cloud does as Sephiroth asks and closes the valve, which turns off the air.
Close the valve outside the room with pods.
After discovering evidence of the horrific experiments that took place in the reactor, Sephiroth begins to question his own origins.
Return to the room where Sephiroth is.
As Sephiroth has supposedly gone to Shinra Manor, Cloud heads there too.
Cloud arrives at Shinra Manor and enters in search of Sephiroth.
The villagers go as far as the manor gates, but Cloud continues on.
Cloud does search the manor, but cannot find any sign of Sephiroth.
Cloud finds Sephiroth in the basement of the manor, poring over a journal. He tries to help, but Sephiroth wants only to be left alone.
Upon returning to the village, Cloud sees it is engulfed in flames. He worries for his mother's safety.
Find out what's happening in the village.
As she succumbs to the flames, Cloud's mother tells him, "You have to live." Wracked by grief and guilt, the wounded Cloud doggedly pursues Sephiroth.
Go to your mother's house to ensure she is safe.
Cloud remembers coming face-to-face with Sephiroth in the Nibel reactor, but nothing after that.
Cloud reunites with the party, and together they enter the heavily-fortified city.
The team finds themselves on Shinra's airstrip. Seeing no sign of any black robes─or a boat that will carry them off the continent─they continue into the city below.
Continue the search for the black robes.
After weighing their options, the team decides to get to the bottom of things by going straight to the source─Rufus Shinra.
Enter Junon proper to find the robed individuals and procure a ship.
The team boards an elevator in the aerodrome's hangar that brings them down to the city below.
Ride the elevator down to enter the city.
On the elevator ride down into the city, the party spies a complement of troopers about to participate in the inauguration parade.
Ride the elevator down to enter the city.
Cloud, Tifa, and Aerith find a locker room with spare Shinra fatigues.
Look for spare fatigues with Tifa and Aerith.
Now that Cloud, Tifa, and Aerith are dressed the part, it is time to start acting it too.
Change into one of the spare uniforms.
Cloud dons his uniform, and cannot help but reminisce on his days in the service.
Change into the newly procured fatigues.
In a serendipitous twist of fate, Cloud is made captain of Midgar's Seventh Infantry drill team, and tasked with assembling his unit.
Leave the locker room and find a way to infiltrate the inauguration parade.
Cloud leads the Seventh Infantry to victory and wins the presidential commendation, securing the team the opportunity to get close to Rufus.
Locate the members of the Seventh Infantry in Larboard Junon and report to the commander.
Cloud assembles the disparate Seventh Infantry troopers─and not a moment too soon, as the parade is about to begin.
Find the members of the Seventh Infantry.
Yuffie's attempt on Rufus's life ends in failure, and raises the alarm among Shinra's military.
Find a secure location to carry out the assassination.
Unbeknownst to the masses below, Yuffie begins her ascent in search of a location from which to assassinate the new president.
Scale the buildings to find a vantage point.
Cloud stumbles across Roche, who is waiting for him in the training ground. After an explosive battle, Cloud emerges victorious.
Report the latest intel on the assassin to those who will listen and continue to the port.
Cloud says goodbye to the Seventh Infantry and makes for the ferry.
Ride the elevator down to the port.
With the chaos of Rufus's attempted assassination behind them, the team is together once again, and they search for a way onto the Shinra-8.
Reunite with the others at the port.
Despite the bedlam caused by Yuffie's attempt on the president's life, the Shinra-8 bound for Costa del Sol departs right on schedule and without incident.
Try the rear entrance of the ship.
After an unexpectedly eventful voyage, the cruise ship drops anchor at the resort paradise of Costa del Sol. Seeking respite among the sun and sand, the party makes way for the city center.
Ch. 11: The Long Shadow of Shinra

The party makes its way to Nibelheim on Cait Sith's word that there will be a Shinra terminal via which they can ascertain the temple's location. Though Cloud and Tifa agree to the plan, they hold out little hope as they approach the village Sephiroth burned to the ground five years ago.
Collect chocograss and bring it to the chocobo sage's assistant.
Cloud and company collect all the chocograss in the area, thus earning all the rewards the sage's assistant has to give.
Cloud and company are rewarded by the chocobo sage's assistant for bringing him chocograss, but they are unable to earn all the rewards.
Try the series of practical exams added to the mako research facility combat simulator.
Cloud and company pass all the practical exams offered in the mako research facility combat simulator.
Cloud and company do not pass all the practical exams offered in the mako research facility combat simulator.
Head to Nibelheim to find the Shinra terminal.

The party arrives to find that Nibelheim has been rebuilt─so well, in fact, it looks almost exactly how it did before the incident. The group cannot hide their shock as they make their way into this pristine replica of a village.
While Cait Sith visits the town hall for terminal-related matters, the rest of the party takes a stroll around the village, which has been repurposed as a mako poisoning treatment facility.
Walk around the village and see how the others are doing.
Check in on Cait Sith at the town hall.

Apparently the town hall terminal has only limited access to Shinra's database...but the one in Shinra Manor should be free of restrictions. In order to enter the manor, however, they must first find Deputy Commissioner Murasaki, who is up surveying the reactor.
Go to the second floor of the inn.
Upon entering the room in which he stayed five years ago, Cloud is assaulted with memories of his friend Zack, who accompanied him on the mission.
Follow Cait Sith out of the village.
Talk to Yuffie when you are ready to leave.
With preparations now complete, the party makes its way to the Nibel reactor in search of Deputy Commissioner Murasaki.
Make for the Nibel reactor to find Mr. Murasaki.
The group eventually arrives at the entrance to the reactor, where they are greeted by the aftermath of a skirmish between Shinra and Wutai.
Cross the newly erected bridge and head for the reactor.
Following Cait Sith's intel, they cross the new bridge and begin their climb of Mt. Nibel.
Pass over the Gunnthra River and continue on toward the reactor.
The group crosses over the Gunnthra River─into which Cloud and Tifa fell five years ago─and approaches the mako spring.
Beware of mako gas while making your way to the spring.
Cloud describes the spring with much the same words Sephiroth used five years ago─which gives Tifa pause, to say the least.
Slide down the pipes to continue your trek.
After finishing their slide down the pipes, the party members continue on to the reactor.
Find another way inside the facility.
Cloud and company are able to scale the fence and resume their trek to the Nibel reactor.
Find a way to climb over the fence.
Cloud places a metal contraption next to a broken part of the fence, allowing the party to scale it.
Search the reactor for any sign of Mr. Murasaki.
The party retrieves Mr. Murasaki's keycard from his corpse, and─thanks to Cait Sith's techno wizardry─can now unlock the gates to Shinra Manor.
Head to Shinra Manor, where the terminal with unlimited access awaits.
Having already unlocked the gates remotely, Cait Sith and company enter the grounds of Shinra Manor.
Search the manor and find the terminal.
The group stumbles upon an AI program modeled after Hojo in an underground cave system. The AI promptly sends the group plummeting into the belly of a subterranean mako research facility.
Find a way out of your cell.
Having escaped the cell, Cait Sith must now search for a way to free Aerith and Barret.
Navigate the ventilation system to escape your cell.
Cait Sith succeeds in using the ventilation system and emerges on the other side of the cell.
Look for a way to free Aerith and Barret.
Reunited outside their cell, the three begin their trek back to Shinra Manor.
Find a way to push the button that unlocks the cell door.
By throwing a box against the switch, Cait Sith is able to unlock the cell door.
Escape from the research facility and return to Shinra Manor.
After arriving at the upper floor, the three are greeted by the Hojo AI yet again.
Remove the debris so the elevator can continue its descent.
Throwing a box at the offending debris removes it, enabling the elevator to complete its descent.
Turn the valve above the generator by throwing a box at it.
Hitting the valve with a box allows Cait Sith to power on the generator.
Find a way to open the gate.
Powering on the generator allows the gate to open, and the three continue their journey upward.
Throw containers of accelerant into the revolving distribution funnel to supply the blinking red generator with enough fuel to operate.
Having supplied a sufficient amount of accelerant, the generators activate, thus allowing the party to unlock the gate.
Activate the generator in order to power the elevator.
Cait Sith successfully activates the generator, allowing Aerith and Barret to join him.
Switch the type of ventilation duct through which you can pass and head upstairs.
After opening the nearby duct and rolling to a higher floor, Cait Sith resumes his search for the generator.
Add cargo to the elevator so it may arrive at your floor.
Jettison cargo from the elevator so it may take you to the upper floor.
Now that Cait Sith has arrived at the correct floor, he must search for the generator.
The group boards the elevator and rides it to a higher floor.
Destroy the supply crates that come down the conveyor belt by throwing Shinra boxes at them.
Cait Sith succeeds in destroying ten or more supply crates.
Cait Sith is unable to destroy many supply crates.
Find the password written down somewhere in this room.
Having found and input the password, the three unlock the door and pass through.
Return to Shinra Manor and resume your search for the terminal.
Cait Sith, Aerith, and Barret navigate Hojo's booby traps and eventually make it back to Shinra Manor, where they resume their search for the terminal with the others.
Continue your search for the terminal.
Make for the room with the terminal.
With Vincent's permission, the party makes its way to the terminal. Thus, the members begin their search for information on the temple.
Explore the vicinity while Cait Sith uses the terminal.
Soon after Cloud enters the connecting room, he falls to his knees in pain. Vincent is less than pleased at the party's trespass, and he attacks them.
Leave Shinra Manor and return to the village.

On their way back to Nibelheim, the group encounters Roche. Cell degradation seems to have taken its toll on him, and after his fight with Cloud, he assumes the listless, benumbed form of the black robes.
Head to the Nibel airstrip to meet Cid.
The party arrives at the Nibel airstrip, and after learning his old acquaintance Ifalna is Aerith's mother, Cid offers to shuttle them to the Gold Saucer.
Head to the Gold Saucer in Cid's plane in search of the keystone.
An engine malfunction causes the Tiny Bronco to ditch in the ocean. After some makeshift modifications, Cid's aircraft is now a seacraft, and the party sets sail on it for Costa del Sol.
Ch. 13: Where Angels Fear to Tread

Rufus orders all hands on deck in his effort to reach that which he deems "the promised land": the fabled Temple of the Ancients. In pursuit of the black materia allegedly contained therein, Cloud and company follow Shinra's lead. Though the two parties' motives may differ, their destination is the same, with both groups set to coalesce in the land up north.
In a fortuitous turn, the party runs into Johnny─who just so happens to have room for them at his newly acquired hotel.
Check if there are any rooms available.
The party gives up on the Royal Coast and decides to seek shelter elsewhere.
Check if there are any rooms available.
The party gives up on Costa del Sol Resort and decides to seek shelter elsewhere.

The party has a chance encounter with Johnny, who─as luck would have it─can accommodate them at his new hotel.
Cloud finds Yuffie enjoying a frozen treat. She takes a break from her dessert to try weaseling her way into the party once more.
Cloud sees no sign of Yuffie in town. Perhaps their paths will cross again someday...
The party arrives at Johnny's hotel, but they are dismayed to find a dilapidated shack in a severe state of disrepair.

Johnny regales Tifa with talk of his new ties to Shinra, inspiring a mix of sympathy and concern for her old friend.

Changing booths provide a space for you to switch up your attire.

Cloud and Sephiroth can now use their devastating synergy ability Double Helix.

Open the commands menu and select this ability to bring the materia guardian crashing down to the cave floor.

Your ATB gauge will gradually fill over time, but can quickly be filled by striking enemies with .

Once you have accrued at least one ATB charge, press to open the commands menu.

From there, you can expend ATB charges to activate abilities, cast spells, or use items.

Expending ATB charges will grant characters synergy. When two characters share enough synergy, you can activate their synergy abilities.

These abilities not only deal tremendous damage, they also apply unique buffs, such as increasing limit break levels , granting unlimited MP , or extending the duration enemies are staggered .

You have been sucked into the board game known as Fort Condor.

To claim the protorelic here, you will need to lead the Condor Cavalry to victory over the advancing Shinra forces.

Your forces are composed of two types of units: hero units and ally units.

Press / to change your hero units, and / to adjust your overall strategy, which will alter the types of deployable ally units.

When you are satisfied with your battle formation, press to begin the skirmish.

To deploy a unit, use the cursor to select a location on the battlefield and press . Here, you will enter Tactical Mode where you can choose a unit.

Take note of your opponent's deployment strategy located on the right side of the screen and plan accordingly.

A unit is assigned one of three roles: vanguard (), ranged (), or defense (). Pay close attention to these roles, as they determine what enemies a unit will be effective against. You can view a diagram illustrating the relationship between these roles in the top-right portion of the screen.

Each unit also has an ATB cost. The stronger the unit, the more ATB is required for deployment.

Deploying units with the same role as a hero unit will fill the hero's deployment gauge. Once this gauge is full, you will be able to place the character on the field.

Hero Unit Roles
Cloud: Defense
Barret: Ranged
Tifa: Vanguard

Note that these units can only be deployed once per skirmish.

The moment a hero unit is placed on the field, they will unleash a devastating attack that damages enemies and buffs allies.

These units are immensely powerful and can easily turn the tide of battle, so knowing when and where to deploy them is key.

You will lose if you cannot defeat the boss unit before time runs out.

As the skirmish draws to a close, the enemy will be unable to deploy new units, granting you the perfect opportunity to unleash an all-out assault.

In Hard mode, take control of the reconstructed Condor Cavalry to defeat the advancing Shinra forces.

While the enemy units are still just as powerful, the Cavalry's spirit is now broken and your allies are fatigued, making your job as their captain that much more difficult.

A portion of the Junon region has been added to the demo.

In this segment, you will be able to control Cloud, Barret, Tifa, Aerith, and Red XIII as they fight challenging foes in both the open wilds of Junon and in Chadley's combat simulator.

Note that elements of this section have been streamlined for the demo and will differ from the final game.

By having completed the Nibelheim flashback, you will gain access to the Junon portion of the demo once it becomes available via an update.

In this soon-to-be-released segment, you will be able to control Cloud, Barret, Tifa, Aerith, and Red XIII as they fight challenging foes in both the open wilds of Junon and in Chadley's combat simulator.

Check back soon for more information on the upcoming Junon demo.

Note that elements of this section have been streamlined for the demo and will differ from the final game.

Vending machines offer a variety of useful items that will aid you on your adventure, such as potions and plumes of phoenix down.

They also sometimes offer limited quantities of certain items at special prices. Save some gil by stocking up on these resources while they are on sale.

Press while on the pause menu or main menu to open Photo Mode.

While active, time will stop, allowing you to manipulate the camera and apply filters for that perfect shot.

If none of the default filters tickle your fancy, do not worry: you will unlock more as you progress through the game.

Note that you can also climb down such surfaces.
Press <button=dodge> to roll forward or jump over certain terrain. The action Cloud performs will change depending on the environment.
Sitting at a rest stop or sleeping at lodgings will fully restore both HP and MP.
Approach locations marked with <button=auto-action> to perform context-sensitive actions, such as squeezing through tight spaces or climbing up ladders.

Press to use your weapon and attack.

For example, if you find boxes marked with the Shinra logo, try breaking them open. They may contain useful items, including mako shards that restore MP.

Note that you cannot attack in certain locations.
Press <button=map-menu> to view your current position on a map of the area, or to check your progress in the story.

Press to open the main menu.
From there, you can review your party's stats, inspect your inventory, and change your equipment.

You can also adjust various settings from the Options section of the System menu.
Hold <button=accel> to sprint or press <button=dash> to keep sprinting until you stop moving. While doing so, you will automatically perform terrain actions.

Materia can be set into most weapons and equipment via the Materia & Equipment section of the main menu.

Try equipping the materia Cloud was provided for this mission.

Materia set into your equipment will gain ability points (AP) with every battle. Once enough AP is accrued, your materia will improve, further enhancing its effects and the potency of its spells.

For example, take the fire materia:

★ allows the caster to use Fire.
★★ allows the caster to use Fira.
★★★ allows the caster to use Firaga.

Enemies will grow alerted to your presence as you approach. Once the gauge fills up, combat will ensue. Press before it fills to get the jump on your foes, or retreat to avoid a fight. If you land the First Strike, your ATB gauge will fill slightly at the start of battle.

You can also run away after the battle has begun by putting some distance between you and the enemy.
Inspect pianos you encounter to start tickling the ivories and perform pieces using sheet music you have acquired.

A local named Tifa guides the SOLDIER survey team─headed by vaunted war hero Sephiroth─toward the mako reactor at the peak of Mt. Nibel.

On your journey, you will find a plethora of materia. You can equip any of the orbs you pick up by pressing and then selecting Materia & Equipment.

Exploration Controls

You can now play the card game
Queen's Blood.

Find other players (denoted by the icon) around the world and challenge them to matches. Should you win, they will often give you new cards to add to your collection. Defeating players will also give you the opportunity to fight other opponents in different towns.

You can also build and edit decks by selecting Card Decks from the main menu.

Each player takes turns placing a card on the board in one of the three "lanes" that span from left to right.

First, try placing a card on one of the highlighted tiles adorned with an emerald pawn.

Once a card is placed, its power is added to your lane total. New positions will also be added to the board, which are tiles with emerald pawns upon which you can place cards.

The yellow number in the top-right corner of a card is its power, while the positions a card will add to the board are indicated by the yellow squares in the graphic at the bottom.
Next, place a card so that one of its yellow tiles overlaps with one of your existing positions.

When one of your cards' position tiles overlaps with a position you control, the position rises in rank. As there are two pawns on that tile now, that position is rank 2.

Cards can only be placed on positions equal to or higher than their rank, which is denoted by the number of in the top-left corner of the card. Thus, in order to play more powerful cards, you will have to raise the rank of your positions.
As you now have a rank 2 position, try placing your rank 2 (<button=card-cost><button=card-cost>) card on it.

When one of your cards' positions overlaps with one of your opponent's, you claim that position as yours.

Note, however, that claiming a position will not raise its rank.

You can keep track of who is winning a lane by looking at the point totals on each side of the board. The numbers on the left represent your power, while ones on the right represent your opponent's.

You may notice that some cards have tiles with red borders. These are the tiles that are affected by the card's ability. Place cards effectively to make the most of their abilities and amass more power in more lanes than your opponent.

In the event you cannot place a card, you can pass with . When both players pass consecutively, the game will end.

Once the game is over, each player's score is tabulated. Only the player with the higher power in a lane has their power added to their score.

In other words, no matter how high your power in a lane may be, if it is less than your opponent's power in the same lane, it will not count toward your score.

After calculating the winner for each lane and adding their lane scores up, the player with the higher total score wins.

That concludes the Queen's Blood tutorial.

You can add more cards to your collection by winning them off other players or purchasing booster packs from shops. In your quest to amass cards, you may even end up becoming the best player on the planet!
Adjust your party's gear by accessing <color=orange>Materia & Equipment</color> from the main menu.
Spend skill points (SP) at Maghnata Books locations and automats to augment your party's <color=orange>folios</color>, thus unlocking powers latent in your allies.

Adjust your weapon skills via Upgrade Weapons in the main menu.

Raising your characters' weapon levels will unlock more of these skills─as well as stat boosts─allowing you to customize your party to suit your play style.

Changing a character's weapon will not reset this level.

From the Item Transmuter screen in the main menu, you can convert raw materials into practical items such as consumables, equipment, accessories, and more.

To expand your transmutation options, collect transmuter chips found throughout the world, or improve your craftsmanship.

Adjust your battle party from the Combat Settings screen in the main menu.

You can create up to three preset parties to swap between. While exploring the world, open the commands menu and press or to switch parties.

Approach Piko without being noticed.

Chadley will employ the data you collect to develop new materia, create new combat simulations, and embark on other scientific endeavors.

Activate the remnawave towers you encounter and help Chadley deepen your understanding of this world.

Press to use your chocowhistle and summon your bird to your side while out exploring the world.

Note that you can only call a chocobo in a region once you have wrangled that region's bird.

People the world over are willing to pay top gil for Cloud's hand-for-hire services.

To track these odd jobs, open the map with and select Quests.

You can warp to any unlocked waypoints, such as towns, repaired chocobo stops, and activated remnawave towers.

Press to open the map and select a location to instantly travel to it.

Note that you can only fast travel to chocobo stops once you have wrangled the region's chocobo.

Certain settlements will have a noticeboard, upon which citizens in need will post job offers. Accepting a job will mark your new employer on your map.

Tackle the odd jobs listed here to earn rare rewards, deepen your bonds with your allies, and increase your party level.

Overcoming challenges, helping people in need, and exploring the world will deepen your party's bonds, thereby increasing your party level.

The higher this level, the more skills and abilities will be available in your folios.

Cloud's actions affect his relationships with his allies, and the strength of these bonds can alter portions of the story.

Press to view a comrade's feelings toward Cloud, as indicated by symbols such as and .

Use the training grounds on Bill's ranch to get the hang of chocoback riding.

Pass each of the goalposts in order, and complete the course as quickly as you can.
